loans.name: Sanya Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sanya SHG Group in Western Kenya! This  group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Dinah is the facilitator of the Sanya SHG Group. She takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and to reduce poverty by harvesting more. In the recent 2011 season, Dinah had a good maize yield harvesting 16 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Dinah was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Dinah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Dinah will save for the future and invest in livestock rearing.
In the photo above, Dinah is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Gundsambuu

texts.en: Gundsambuu is 28 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bulgan province, Mongolia. Her husband is a school teacher and her two kids go to kindergarden. She started her hairdressing business in 2005 by renting a space in a market. Her hairdressing skills are excellent, however she's losing a lot of customers due to her rusty old equipment. Therefore she is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy new equipment. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy new hairdressing equipment.

loans.use: To buy new hairdresser equipment.

loans.name: Malombo

texts.en:
Malombo lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is married, has six children, and owns a grocery stall which has been in operation for ten years. She was introduced to Milango by her friends and joined in order to access credit.

Malombo is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase vegetables. She will use the income obtained from the business to purchase furniture. 

She looks forward to opening a big stall and employing many people. Her only challenge is some credited clients not paying on time.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables

loans.name: Hans Buchanan

texts.es:
Hans Buchanan, tiene 44 años de edad, casado desde hace 8 años, tiene 1 hija de 8 años de edad, vive en una aldea de Choloma, Cortes.
El señor Hans, tiene un negocio de venta de pizza cacera, que las prepara junto con su esposa en casa, desde hace 2 años.  A este negocio le dedica 9  horas diarias. Su venta es ambulante, entrega a domicilio y por encargos o pedidos, las distribuye en una bicicleta , la pizza se vende bastante en la zona,  ya que se consume a cualquier hora.
Ha solicitado este préstamo para comprar un horno que le servirá para aumentar la producción y cumplir con la demanda que tiene.
Su sueño es llegar a tener un  local fijo donde vender pizzas.
texts.en:
Hans Buchanan, age 44, has been married for eight years, and he has an eight year old daughter.  He lives in the village of Choloma, Cortes.

Hans has a business selling homemade pizza.  He has been preparing the pizzas at home, together with his wife, for two years.  He devotes nine hours a day to this business.  He sells in an itinerant manner, and he delivers to homes by contracts or orders.  He delivers on a bicycle.  The pizza sells well in the area because it can be eaten at any time.

He has requested this loan to buy an oven.  The oven will serve to increase production and meet the demand that he has.

His dream is to have a fixed place where he sells pizza.

loans.use: to buy a stove to make pizzas to sell.

loans.name: Los Girasoles Group

texts.es: La Sra. Roció  es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar, Roció tiene 34 años de edad  actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Los Girasoles” grupo  conformado por 10  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Roció   trabaja desde hace 9  años en la venta de comida es de decir vende menú (almuerzo y desayuno) en su domicilio  este negocio surge por que sus hijos empezaron a ir al colegio y el sueldo de su esposo no alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos básicos alimentación, educación y pagos de servicio. Es así que trabajo muy duro para sacar  adelante a su familia, empezó vendiendo desayuno y con el tiempo tuvo mayor clientes  y después empezó a vender almuerzo Roció nos cuenta que su motivación eran sus hijos, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, sus hijos pudieron estudiar, poco apoco fue comprando cosas para su hogar y sobre todo su familia cuenta con una mejor calidad de vida,  con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar insumos(Arroz, Fideos) .Sabemos que Roció  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Roció has a spouse and two school age children.  She’s 34 years old and a member of the “Los Girasoles” (The Sunflowers) communal bank, a group composed of ten members who carry out a variety of commercial activities.

Roció has worked for nine years selling food, that is, she sells set menus (lunch and breakfast) at home.  This business arose because her children started attending school and her husband’s salary was insufficient to cover basic food, school and utilities costs.  She, therefore, worked hard to move her family forward and started out by selling breakfast.  In time, she acquired more customers and started then to sell lunch too.  Roció tells us that her children were her motivation.  Thanks to her effort and dedication she’s attained better income and her children were able to go to school.  Gradually she was able to buy things for her house and, above all, her family now has a better quality of life.

In order to continue making progress, she’s asking for a new loan to buy ingredients (rice, noodles).  We know that Roció will reach her goals with much work and effort and that Edaprospo loans will help her.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, noodles, oil, etc.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia tiene 49 años de edad y tiene seis hijos, ella se dedica al comercio a la venta de abarrotes, venta de comida y también se dedica a la agricultura. 

Lucia pertenece al banco comunal “Mercaditos de Patria” de la ciudad de Patria. Ya son varios años que trabaja con la Asociación Arariwa y le va muy bien. Las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Patria de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco. Desde la ciudad del Cusco a nuestro destino hay una distancia de 200 Km. (aproximado nueve horas de viaje) hasta llegar a la localidad de Patria. Durante el viaje cruzaremos parte de la cordillera andina Peruana, observaremos hermosos valles interandinos, comunidades indígenas andinas quechuas y camino a la Reserva de Biosfera del Parque Nacional del Manu. 

En esta oportunidad Lucia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar y otras cosas más. Su sueño de Lucia es comprarse una casa grande.   

Lucia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Lucia, 49, has six children.  She has a grocery store and also works in agriculture.

Lucia belongs to the communal bank "Mercaditos de Patria" in the city of Patria.  She has been working with the Arariwa Association for several years and it has gone well for her. The meetings of the members of the communal bank take place monthly in Patria in the province of Paucartambo, department of Cusco. From the city of Cusco to Patria there is a distance of 200 Km. (approximately nine hours of travel). During the trip we cross part of the Peruvian Andes and we see beautiful interandean valleys, Andean Quechuan indian communites and the trail to the Manu National Park Biosphere Reserve.

On this occasion Lucia is requesting a loan to buy goods such as rice, sugar and other items.  Her dream is to buy a large house.

Lucia is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy goods such as rice, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Aseel

texts.en:
Aseel is a 27 year old married woman who supports 1 family member from Al Hashmi Amman Jordan.She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for her home improvements,she will be repainting her home.In the future she wants to buy a home.
Since Aseel is under 30 year old,her loan is considered a youth loan.
Aseel prefers not to display her photo on the internet,thus the above photo is of her husband

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Briggite Yeralddin

texts.es:
Briggite tiene 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad caracterizada por sus lugares turísticos como las “Islas Ballestas” y el “Candelabro de Paracas”, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de maíz, algodón,  entre otros. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho jugar vóley con sus vecinas y amigas de su barrio, asimismo en ocasiones le encanta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pato”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar la carrera de enfermería.

Día a día Briggite traba en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 9 horas al dia y puede atender hasta 25 clientes diariamente; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es conocida y sobre todo porque es amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque ofrece productos de calidad a un bajo precio.

Briggite está muy alegre y agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mostradores y comprar mercadería para su negocio como polos, chompas, pantalones, |entre otros; de esta manera ella podrá exhibir sus productos de mejor manera y también tendrá más variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para poder realizar su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y tener un local para su negocio”.

loans.use: Para la compra de mostradores y mercaderia (polos, chompas, pantalones, entre otros)

loans.name: Purificacion

texts.es:
La socia Purificacion se dedica al negocio de transporte,la socia junto con su esposo se dedican al negocio de servicio de taxi,la socia administra el carro y su esposo maneja el carro,la socia ya tiene 6 años en este negocio y le va muy bien.La socia solicita el credito para comprar llantas.

La socia esta contenta con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de sus cuota.
texts.en:
Purificacion makes a living in the transportation business.  Together with her husband, they have a taxi service.  She manages the car and her husband drives the car.  She already has been working in this field for six years and it is going very well.  She is requesting the loan to buy tires.

She is happy with the loan and promises to repay her installments.

loans.use: to buy tires and spare car parts.

loans.name: Jesugnonnan Group

texts.fr: JESUGNONNAN est un groupe  est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Evelyne, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 28 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école mais a appris la coiffure. Activité qu’elle exerce à son domicile depuis quatorze ans. Evelyne est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Dénis. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Evelyne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, de façon secondaire à son activité, Evelyne vend des produits de beauté, des condiments et de l’huile végétale. Evelyne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Evelyne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUGNONNAN un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des produits de beauté, des condiments et de l’huile végétale.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen lives in Kiminini, a remote village where the opportunities to get ahead are difficult and the living conditions are tough. Most of the people who live in Kiminini dream of getting a good education and a well-paying job, Maureen, has never secured a job and she opted to become a full time smallholder farmer.
Maureen is married and is blessed with two lovely children who she refers to as “my heart beat.” Her primary sources of income are milk selling, poultry farming, and some personal business that she does to supplement her meager income. 

For the past five years, Maureen has been earning a decent income from cereal selling. However, the demand is overwhelming and she wants to increase her cereal business, but the biggest challenge is lack of funds. She is seeking a loan to purchase cereals. If taken seriously, cereal selling has the potential of being a big business because the demand for cereals such as maize is always high. With your loan, Maureen is going to make more income that will enable her to take care of her family's expenses. 
Lenders kindly Collaborate with an enterprising woman who has a creative mind and big dreams!

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Nathalie

texts.en:
Miss Nathalie K. was born on 20th December 1973 in Kara at the North of Togo. After her training in dressmaking, in difficult conditions, she managed to open a workshop with the help of good-will people. Honest, strict and serious at work, she manages her workshop with efficacy. She is single and raises her two (02) children live with her. Having known that there is no haberdasher’s shop in her quarter and that dressmakers of the area have to go a long distance to have dressmaking materials. Miss K. expressed the desire to open a haberdashery in her workshop and sell all those products to other dressmakers of the quarter; this will be an additional source of income. The credit of $750 she would like to have will help her have the required material to start the haberdashery, and have adequate funds to run this activity.

Mlle K. Nathalie est née le 20 décembre 1973 à Kara dans le nord Togo. Après sa formation en couture dans des conditions pénibles, elle a réussi à ouvrir un atelier avec le concours des personnes de bonne volonté. Honnête, rigoureuse et sérieuse au travail, elle gère son atelier avec efficacité. Elle est célibataire et survient entièrement aux besoins de deux (02) enfants qu’elle a pris chez elle. Ayant constaté qu’il n’existe aucune boutique de mercerie dans son quartier et que tous les couturiers de cette zone se déplacent sur de longues distances pour s’approvisionner en matériels de couture, Mlle K. a manifesté le désir d’ouvrir une mercerie dans son atelier et vendre tous ces produits aux autres couturiers et couturières du quartier. Ce qui va constituer pour elle une source de revenu supplémentaire. Le crédit de $750 qu’elle sollicite va servir à acquérir le matériel nécessaire pour l’ouverture de la mercerie et à disposer d’un fonds de commerce adéquat pour le succès de cette activité.

loans.use: To have the required material to start the haberdashery

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is a young woman of 22 years, married, with 1 child. Her husband has helped her open a beauty shop. Some of the items include mesh, trinkets, necklaces and assorted hair goods.

Nana is seeking the KIVA loan to increase the product base so as to meet the demand of her customers. She also wants add children's wear to her range of products since the demand is very great.

loans.use: Capital to expand her product line

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius lives in the Lumo area of Dar es Salaam. He is married with two children. He owns a retail shop near his residence. The shop sells different consumable items, especially food items. Rice, maize, cassava, potatoes, and beans are staple foods in Tanzania. Julius plans to increase the stock of these items. There is an expectation of their price rising in the near future. Having enough stock now will help him make more money later. The extra stock demands more funding. Through his savings, he managed to contribute 20% of the required stock. The strategy will help him increase income, the aim being to sustain his family and pay for school fees for his children. To implement his plans, Julius needs USD 750 as working capital.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Guardina

texts.es:
Sra. Guardina is 54 years old and married with 8 children. Despite not being able to read or write, she launched and manages her own business manufacturing and selling chipa, a type of bread roll. Chipa is one of the most commonly consumed typical foods of Paraguay. Sra. Guadina works in her house, where she has a clay and brick oven which she uses for the preparation of chipa. Once she has prepared a certain quantity she goes out to sell her products door to door and her children tend to the clients who arrive at her home to buy chipas. Her hard work has allowed her to pay for her children's education.

Guardina is a highly respected member of her community; she has always participated in community groups working to grow and improve the neighborhood. She has previously applied for loans to invest in the construction of ovens, since when she first started her business she prepared her products in an oven borrowed from a neighbor. These days she is eager to continue growing her business, and has decided to build another oven. The new oven would allow her to prepare more chipas; demand for her chipas is high. She is applying for a loan of $210, which she commits to repay punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Guardina tiene 54 años, está casada y tiene 8 hijos, y a pesar de ser analfabeta supo emprender y manejar su propio negocio, la elaboración y venta de “chipa”. Chipa es una de las comidas típicas más consumidas de nuestro país; ella trabaja en su casa donde tiene un horno hecho de ladrillos y barro que utiliza para la cocción de la chipa. Una vez que elabora una cierta cantidad de chipas ella sale a venderlas de forma ambulante mientras que en su casa sus hijos la ayudan atendiendo a clientes que se acercan a comprar ahí. Con su noble trabajo ha logrado costear la formación académica de sus hijos. Guardina, es una señora muy respetada en su comunidad por su capacidad de liderazgo, ya que siempre integro grupos comunitarios, con finalidades de crecimiento y mejoramiento de su barrio. Ella ya ha solicitado préstamos con anterioridad invirtiéndolos en la construcción de su horno, ya que no contaba con una y lo prestaba de sus vecinos; hoy día ella está deseosa de seguir creciendo y tiene pensado construir otro horno mas para poder producir en mayor cantidad, ya que la demanda de sus productos es alta, para ello solicita un crédito de $ 210 que se compromete a devolverlos de forma puntual.

loans.use: Construction of a clay and brick oven

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah N. is 38 years old and married with six children; four boys and two girls. They all attend school, with three in secondary school and the others in primary school. Sarah sells handicraft in Abaita Babiri near Entebbe town.

She has been a member of Abagalana Womens' group, one of Pearl Microfinance's best performing loan groups, for 8 years. For instance, she is currently servicing a loan of USD 200 and pays promptly.

She says she has been able to educate her children with financial support from her husband. However, Sarah also earns money now -- she sells handmade tablemats, tablecloths, bags, scarves and sweaters. She is happy that she does not need to continue waiting for her husband to bring home money because she can also earn and help pay for the household expenses. Sarah is requesting a $400 loan to buy yarn for sweaters, which are in high demand in the current rainy season.

loans.use: Sarah would like to buy yarn for sweaters which are currently in high demand due to the rainy season.

loans.name: Roberta M’Bambé

texts.fr:
Roberta M’Bambé M. was born on April 30, 1974 in Lomé. She is single and has no children, but is responsible for two other people. After high school she became a hairdresser, but with few customers, she turned her hairdressing salon into a cafeteria, restaurant and bar, which was a great success. However, given that she has no funds to put into her business, she cannot meet the needs of her customers. She is therefore asking for a loan of $1,000 to enable her to buy drinks directly from the Brasserie, which will cost her less and increase her income.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

M. Roberta M’Bambé est née le 30 avril 2007 1974 à Lomé. Elle est célibataire sans enfants, mais a deux (02) autres personnes en charge. Après ces études secondaires, elle a fait la coiffure mais faute de clientèle, elle a transformé son salon de coiffure en cafétéria, bar restaurant ce qui lui réussit bien. Mais devant le manque de fonds de commerce elle n'arrive pas à satisfaire sa clientèle. Pour cela elle sollicite alors un crédit de $1000 qui lui permettrait d'acheter les boissons directement à la Brasserie ce qui lui couterait moins cher et augmenterait ses revenus.

loans.use: To buy drinks at wholesale

loans.name: Gulu

texts.en: Gulu (his father is pictured) was born in 1984, and lives in Yenikand village. He has his own farming business. He has been in this business for 4 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
My name is Kalsoom Z.. I have lived all my life in Multan, a mid-size city in Pakistan. My husband has a motorcycle repair business and he has been doing this business since his teens. Now he plans to expand his business further and needs a loan for this purpose.

I want my community to grow and therefore I want to help a few other women. They are: Hafeezan B., who she needs a loan for their animal fodder business; Nasreen B. will also invest in their livestock fodder business; Naziran B., who needs a loan to buy a spinning machine.

loans.use: Expand motorcycle repair business

loans.name: Namunina B(Ii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sarah N.. She is currently in the business of stone quarrying and is requesting a loan of UGX 900,000 to expand her business. Sarah is 38 years old and she is single. She has 2 children who are 8 and 10. Both of her children go to school. Each week Sarah makes approximately UGX 30,000 in profits from her business. With the extra profits from her loan she hopes to expand her stone quarry business.

Sarah is joined in her small group by Mayimuna N., Ruth N., Gertrude W., and Christine M.. Mayimuna N. is currently in the business of brick laying and is requesting a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to to re-invest in the business. Ruth N. is currently in the business of brick laying as well. She requests a loan of UGX 200,000 to start a sand selling business. Gertrude W. is also in the brick laying business and is requesting a loan of UGX 800,000 to re-invest in the business. Christine M. is currently in the fishing business. She is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to expand her fishing business.

loans.use: To expand the businesses

loans.name: Yeyet Mulyeti

texts.en: Yeyet, 29, is married to D. and has one child, age 8. Everyday she sells fresh fish at her house while her husband sells them door-to-door around places. They can earn $20 a day. She is a member of MBK and is now asking for a loan of $75 to expand her business. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Elizabeth Angelica

texts.en:
Elizabeth Angilea S. R. owns a restaurant in the city of Pucallpa. She serves tasty meals of regional, Creole, and oriental origins. She has run the restaurant for eight years and it is always packed during lunch.

Elizabeth is 54 years old and happily married. She has 3 grown children and one of her daughters helps run the restaurant. Elizabeth started the restaurant because she loves to cook and she wanted to help her husband by earning money. Elizabeth loves serving the people of Pucallpa and has made lots of friends at the restaurant.

A member of the community bank Amigas Siempre Unidas, Elizabeth would like a loan of $400 to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to buy sugar, oil, bananas, rice, salt, potatoes, and condiments.

loans.use: To buy sugar, oil, bananas, rice, salt, potatoes, and condiments

loans.name: La

texts.en:
Mrs. La C. was born 1980 and lives in Trauk Leak Village in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She is a subsistence farmer and the mother of three children, all of whom are attending school. Her husband, Lai Lonh, is also a farmer. They live independently from their parents. They are very hard workers and try to earn money to support their family.

In November 2007, their children got dengue fever and they spent $250 for their care. Also, last year, their rice field faced drought, making their crop smaller. As a result, Mrs. La C. does not have enough money to buy cows to plow the rice field this year. She decided to request a loan to buy cows to use as draft animals.

Her husband is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To buy cows to plow their rice field

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela W. is a provisions seller. She sells things such as tins of fish, sugar, tea, and rice. She is married, but her husband's income from fishing is not sufficient to cover the expenses of Angela and her two children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria is a young woman who is a widow and the mother of two children. She sells clothing for women and men, among other things.

Gloria has been in this line of work for more than 10 years and her store is located in a busy area. She did some remodeling of the store in order to have the amount of space that she needed.

She comments that sales this winter season sales have gone very well. It is due to this fact that she wants to obtain a greater amount of merchandise. In this way she will be able to meet the high demand that she has this season.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria, es una señora joven, viuda y madre de dos hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas para damas y caballeros, entre otras cosas.

Gloria se ha dedicado a este rubro por más de 10 años y su local comercial se encuentra en un lugar muy concurrido de la zona, ella realizo refacciones y modificaciones para poder tener el espacio correspondiente para su salón comercial.

Gloria, comenta que en esta temporada de invierno el registro de venta es bastante alto. Es por ello que desea adquirir mayor cantidad de mercaderías, de este modo podrá abastecer la fuerte demanda que tiene en esta época del año.

loans.use: To buy sweatshirts, t-shirts, slacks, sweaters, jeans, ect.

loans.name: Girah

texts.id:
Although situated in a coastal area, Girah does lose heart about her work. Girah has taken advantage of the activity near the docks by setting up a food stall. The idea and hope was that the ship crew would shop and have their meals at her stall. Her business has since developed regular clientèle who stop by for her simple and tasty fare.

Through her friend Girah received information and ultimately a loan from the DINARI foundation. The borrowed funds were used to open her food stall business. To sustain the business, Girah has to work around the clock, because the stall is located sea-side and there is a continuous flow of fishermen who anchor there to rest. Her husband devotes himself to keeping Girah company in the stall because their children are married and have moved out. They pour their energy into the business; even cooking and resting is done in the stall itself. With this same perseverance and effort ,Girah will improve the stall. She will develop it into a respectable place that is suitable for working out of and of which she can be proud.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Aarati, Kiva volunteer.

Walaupun letak daerah tempat tinggalnya yang dipesisir pantai, Girah tidak patah semangat dalam berusahanya.Girah memanfaatkan keramaian dermaga dengan membuka warung makanan. Dengan harapan para awak kapal dapat berbelanja dan makan pagi siang dan sore hari ditempatnya. Pelanggan pun sudah mulai terbiasanya dengan keberadaan warung makannya yang sangat sederhana. Melalui temannya Girah mendapat informasi dan akhirnya mendapat dan pinjaman dari yayasan DINARI. Dana pinjaman tersebut dipakai untuk mengembangkan usaha Warung makannya. Untuk menjalan usaha ini, Girah harus berjualan selama 24 jam nonstop,sebab warung terletak di daerah dermaga yang setiap saat ada nelayan yang berlabuh untuk beristirahat. Dengan setia Asbullah, suaminya, tetap menemani Girah di warungnya siang dan malam karena anak-anaknya sudah semua menikah. Semua kegiatan untuk menjalan usaha, baik memasak dan istirahat, dapat dilakukan diwarungnya. Dengan keuletan inilah Girah dapat memperbaiki warung sehingga layak untuk ditempati.

loans.use: Needs working capital to better equip the stall

loans.name: Alfonso Vicente

texts.es:
Alfonso is 38, lives with his wife and three children. He is an active farmer dedicated to grow corn and potato, activity he does for long periods, growing crops in areas that are far from his home where he walks to for two hours. Once there, he starts working watering and fertilizing his land, this takes all day.

He likes this activity and enjoys earning a living doing something he has liked since he was young, even with the difficulties he goes through when it comes the time to invest in the purchase of fertilizer and products necessary to take care of the land.

Alfonso sees in his family the best way to get better at work, because seeing his family happy satisfies the effort he makes. He plans to invest in expanding his land, to increase the amount of crop and be one of the best farmers in the region.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Alfonso tiene 38 años, vive en con su familia, conformada por su esposa y sus tres hijos. Es un activo agricultor dedicado al cultivo de maíz y papa, lo que realiza en largas temporadas, sembrando sus chacras que se encuentran en zonas muy alejadas de su hogar, a donde tiene que llegar caminando por un lapso de 2 horas y así iniciar su trabajo regando o abonando sus terrenos, esto le toma todo el día.

Sin embargo, esta labor no le desagrada, por lo contrario, le agrada ganarse la vida dedicándose a lo que en realidad le gusta desde joven, a pesar de las dificultades que tiene en el momento de invertir en la compra de abonos y diversos productos necesarios para el cuidado de sus chacras.

Alfonso ve en su familia la mejor forma de mejorar en su trabajo, ver a su familia feliz satisface su esfuerzo. Tiene pensado invertir en la ampliación de sus terrenos, para sí aumentar la capacidad de sembrío y lograr ser uno de los mejores productores de la zona.

loans.use: To expand and prepare faming land.

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
María tiene 54 años. Ella es una persona que se dedica íntegramente a trabajar. Ella labora en una fábrica de cueros, donde proporciona alimentos a los trabajadores. Ademas por las noches se dedica a cuidar a personas de edad avanzada. Asimismo, trabaja manualmente el cuero, produciendo carteras y monederos. 

A María le gustaría seguir con sus actividades laborales, pero también le gustaría tener una bodega en su casa, para lo cual necesita un pequeño capital para comprar los productos que en un futuro venderá.
texts.en:
María is 54 years of age. She is someone who is fully devoted to working. She works in a leather factory where she provides food to the workers. Also, at nights, she works by taking care of the elderly. Also, she works with leather by hand, making wallets and coin purses.

María would like to continue in her work activities, but also would like to have a store in her home. For this she needs a little capital to buy the products that she will sell in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire products to have in a store

loans.name: Trinidad Susana

texts.es:
La microempresaria Trinidad C. B. tiene 34 años de edad es casada con tres hijos los cuales estudian en nivel primario. Esta señora se dedica desde hace 6 años a administrar una pulpería en donde vende una variedad de productos, tanto cárnicos como de granos básicos y otros.

Con este negocio aporta a los gastos de la casa ya que su marido se encuentra en el desempleo a la espera de cualquier trabajo que pueda encontrar. Por lo que prácticamente su familia (que consta de 5 personas) dependen de este negocio.

Esta pulpería se encuentra bastante surtida sin embargo requiere de un financiamiento para aumentar sus productos y poder obtener mayores ganancias.

Por lo que necesita que se le financie lo siguiente: 60 libras de pollo los cuales compra a US$ 1 dólar cada libra, 2 docenas de leche la lechera a US$ 30 dólares cada docena, 30 libras de posta de res la cual compra a US$ 1.50 cada libra, 2 quintales de arroz americano a US$ 50 dólares cada quintal,  3 quintales de arroz nacional a US$ 45 dólares cada quintal,  3 quintales de azúcar a US$ 30 dólares cada quintal, 3 bidones de aceite a US$ 33 dólares cada bidón y 6 docenas de jabón de lavar a US$ 6 dólares cada docena,
texts.en:
The businesswoman Trinidad C. B. is 34 years old, and married with three children in primary education. For six years she has run a store where she sells a variety of products, such as meat, staple grains and other things. With her business she contributes to her household's expenses, as her husband is unemployed and must wait for whatever work he can find. Essentially, her family of five people depends upon her business' success. Though her store is quite well stocked, she requires a loan to increase the variety of products and to obtain greater profits. She is asking for financing to buy the following : 60 pounds of chicken which costs US$1/lb., 2 dozen bottles of La Lechera milk (US$30/dozen), 30 pounds of beef (US$1.50/lb.), 2 quintals (a quintal is equivilent to 46kg, or 100 lbs.) of american rice (US$50/quintal), 3 quintals of national rice (US$45/quintal), 3 quintals of sugar (US$30/quintal), 3 drums of oil (US$33/drum) and 6 dozen pieces of soap (US$6/dozen).

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Keaveney, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to purchase stock

loans.name: Gulrukhsor

texts.en:
L. Gulrukhsor is a 29-year-old widower and mother. She does sewing work in a tailoring shop to earn money for her children. She started because Gulrukhsor loves this trade. Shortly after her husband passed away, this activity became her only income source to get the resources that her family needed. Gulrukhsor is doing all the best to ensure her children a good education and the best future. She wishes that her children can continue with their education. That is the reason that she needs to continue growing her business. 
She asks for a 4000 Somoni ($1200 US dollars) loan that will be invested in buying supplies to increase her production and cover her customers' demands. She commits herself to return the money in 10 months. Help this family with improving the quality of their lives by contributing to the growth of Gulrukhsor’s business. They will sincerely thank you for it.

loans.use: To purchase new modern fabrics for sewing the national dresses.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
“I plan to improve my business through perseverance, courage and hard work,” said Maribel, a village store owner and wife of a carpenter who works abroad. 

Believing in the saying that: "if others can, why can’t I",  Maribel F., is the 40-year-old wife of Chito and mother of their only child John Micheal F., 8 years old and in second grade. Maribel still maintains a small store even though her husband is already working abroad, because she knows that her husband's work there is not for a lifetime.

Maribel requests a loan of $125 (5,000 PHP) to buy additional goods to sell in her store. Her weekly income is about 1,400 PHP, and pays for her child’s education and other basic needs of their family.

loans.use: Buy additional goods to sell in the store

loans.name: Milagros De Jesus

texts.es: Milagros es una joven de 28 años de edad, reside en villa reconciliación de Howar  cuatro cuadras al norte, en la ciudad de Managua, se dedica ala venta de cosméticos y costura que desde muy joven a prendió a coser, tiene ocho años de experiencia, comenzó con ayuda que su mama le brindo para que fuera teniendo mas oportunidad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, lo cual desea ir construyendo un futuro para cuando tenga su familia, sus planes son seguir estudiando para formarse como profesional, y ganar un salario fijo, con la solicitud de préstamo va invertir en cosméticos y telas para trabajar en la costura ya que hace a sus clientes los estilos que ellos deseen, así como también hace ropa para vender y aprovechar el tiempo como para obtener ingresos. a futuro es captar clientes, y obtener un inventario de productos mas surtidos.
texts.en:
Milagros is a young woman 28 years old. She lives in Villa Reconcilación in Managua. She sells cosmetics and has been sewing ever since she learned to sew as a young girl. She has eight years of experience. She got started with the help of her mother, who wanted her to have more opportunities. She is single and has no children, and wants to build a future for when she has a family. Her plan is to continue her studies so she can get vocational training and earn a steady income. With this loan request she will invest in cosmetics and fabrics, since she does both custom design for her customers as well as ready-made clothing that she sells to increase her income. Her future goals are to attract more customers and obtain a wider variety of inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabrics for dressmaking, and cosmetics

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: Dame H. Jeanne est âgée de 42 ans,elle n'a jamais fréquenté et dès son jeune âge,elle aida sa mère dans la vente de diverses articles. Elle a 5 enfants. Après s'être mariée, elle s'est lancée dans la vente de friperie pour laquelle au départ,elle était ambulante.Aujourd'hui,elle est devenue une semi-grossiste et c'est pour renforcer son activité que dame H. sollicite ce prêt.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jeanne H., 42, never attended school and from a young age, she helped her mother sell various items. She has 5 children. After having married, she began to sell used clothing, in the beginning as an ambulant salesperson, going door-to-door. Today she has become a sort of wholesaler and it is to bolster that business that Mrs. H. is requesting this loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing 4 bales of used clothing

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Mrs. Amelia P., 37 years of age, is married and a resident of Barandias, Pangantucan, Bukidnon Southern Philippines. She is an active snack food operator whose project is located at the school canteen.  She uses as her daily income from the school canteen 10% of her gross sales.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 8,000 to purchase additional snack food items for sale.  Her simple aspiration in life is to have her own canteen.

loans.use: To purchase food snack  items for sale

loans.name: Emma Rosa

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur de la ciudad de Managua la señora Emma A. se dedica a su actividad  de agricultura por medio del cultivo de la tierra en la siembra de plátano.

Es importante destacar que actualmente ella ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel el cual le ha beneficiado arduamente en la compra de fertilizantes para sus cultivos. Espera confiadamente porque requiere con urgencia dicho préstamo para salir adelante y así mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en:
Emma A. works the land cultivating bananas in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur in the city of Managua. It is important to emphasise that she has managed to move her business forward by going to Ceprodel, greatly benefitting from the purchase of fertilizers for her crops. She is waiting in hope because she urgently requires this loan to develop her business and so improve her financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Tulibeck

texts.en:
A. Tulibeck lives in the J.Ismoil region of Tajikistan and, as with many rural residents, he is engaged in the livestock business.

Tulibeck has been engaged in livestock for 18 years and he knows everything about domestic animals. Tulibeck also works as the driver in the collective farm but livestock is the main business he is engaged in. Tulibeck is married and has three children. His wife helps him in taking care of the animals and with the milk production.

Tulibeck is applying to Kiva for a business development loan of 1600 TJS for 6 months in order to build a summer cow barn. He thanks Kiva for its support and wishes all the best.

loans.use: To build a summer cow barn

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en: Akenese T., 42, is married with eight children.  She has many years of experience in the fresh fish business. She sells to the villagers and public, two days per week. She has had two previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 tala (~$165 US).  SPBD loans are Akenese’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used for home improvements and school fees.

loans.use: To purchase cement, timber, a new fishing net, new canoe, iron roofing and to pay school fees

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en: Felipa T. is a resident of Alicomohan, Sugbongcogon, Misamis Oriental, in the Southern Philippines. She is married to Adelfo T. and blessed with six children. With her current family's situation, Felipa knows that they need to work hard to survive. Buying and selling lemons is one of their main sources of income. Once they purchase the lemons, they deliver it on consignment to their established customers. With her first loan with HSPFI, Felipa wants to expand the business by using the loan as additional business capital. Her simple desire is to see all her children finish their studies up to college level.

loans.use: To purchase lemons to sell.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz es una joven muy entusiasta y alegre, a sus 18 años ya tiene un negocio propio, vive en la casa de su madrina y  trabaja duro para mejorar su actual situación económica. Desde hace 3 años viene trabajando duramente, vende ropa todos los fines de semana en la Explanada Laguna Temporal (Lugar donde se hacen ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca), le gusta mucho vender ropa, sobre todo a las personas que buscan algo novedoso y llamativo, es muy alegre y divertida y las prendas que vende son de muy buena calidad. Beatriz desea que su negocio prospere y que crezca mucho, lo más difícil para ella es conseguir la ropa, puesto que adquiere sólo lo mejor porque tiene una reputación ganada, la cual le ayuda a vender mucho más. Beatriz esta en su segundo préstamo con MFP, es una de las socias más jóvenes de su banco comunal y por eso recibe todo el apoyo de las demás para que le vaya bien en su negocio. Los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, serán empleados en la compra de más ropa, para así poder incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que tiene en stock.
texts.en:
Beatriz is an enthusiastic and happy young woman who, at just 18 years of age, has her own business. She lives with her godmother, and works hard to improve her current economic situation. She has been working for 3 years, selling clothing on weekends at the Laguna Temporal Esplanade (the location where the markets of the city of Juliaca take place). She enjoys selling clothes, and especially helping out people who are looking for something new, eye-catching, and of good quality. Beatriz wants her business to prosper and grow a great deal. The most difficult part for her is acquiring the garments, given she only buys the best because she has a reputation to uphold that helps her make more sales. Beatriz is in her second loan with MFP, and is one of the youngest members of her cooperative bank. For this reason, she gets support from all the other members so that her business goes well. The eight hundred soles requested will be used to purchase more clothes, so she can increase her inventory supply.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Ma. Flora

texts.en:
Ma. Flora S. is from the town of Katipunan. She is 48 years old and married with four adult children. To make a living, Ma. Flora provides mechanical services to local community members. She's been engaged in her business for over 24 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Ma. Flora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to purchase materials needed to provide her service. Ma. Flora is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase construction materials for house repair. This loan will be her 8th loan from PMPC. She plans to have a comfortable shelter for the family. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for house repair

loans.name: Bora

texts.en:
Mr. Bora S., 32, and his wife, Mrs. Saosilin Keo, 25, were married in 2003 and just have one 4-year-old son. The couple lives along National Road Number One about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Bora has been a mason for over ten years; he works in his village and in Phnom Penh. His wife has been a garment factory worker for eight years. Bora doesn’t have his own transportation and he always travels to work with his relative. So, he is applying for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to commute to work

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa R. is from the city of Oroquieta. She is 68 years old. Andresa is widowed and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Andresa owns & operates a sari-sari store business in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Andresa has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Andresa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Andresa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from PMPC. Andresa is requesting a new loan of 14950 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Andresa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna S. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 39 years old. Edna is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Edna owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks in the local community. Edna has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Edna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Edna is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to repair their house. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Edna from PMPC. She wants to have a better shelter for the family to live in.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair their house

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn N. is a fish vendor and her husband is a fisherman. She works from 8 a.m. - 5 p.m. everyday to sell fish. She has seven children and is expecting to have a new baby, her 8th child, this coming September 2009. Her dream for her children is for them to be able to graduate from college so that they will know how to manage their lives well.

Obtaining a loan from CEVI will be really helpful in buying fishing equipment that Jocelyn’s husband needs. Some of the loan will also be utilized to buy a new boat.

Jocelyn likes CEVI so much for it gives her not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment for her husband and a new boat

loans.name: Elyorjon

texts.en: I. Elyorjon has been dedicated to cattle farming for the past two years and has vast experience in the field as it is the only business he is in. This work is satisfying and it enables him to purchase goods for his home and support his parents with household expenses. He provides the markets with meat and his family with necessary food. Elyorjon wants to buy young cattle and needs money so he decided to apply for a loan of 500 USD. He is counting on your help and expresses his gratitude for your generous heart. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: Agath

texts.en:
Agath A. is 41 years old and married to a teacher. She has three children who all go to school. Agath is currently in the business of selling bread and phaste, and is requesting a loan to purchase eggs to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to support her children's education.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase eggs to sell

loans.name: Parwen Tabash Group

texts.en:
Parwen is the group leader of Parwen Tabash group. There are five members in this group and they each want to take a loan to expand their business. So they have requested a group of loan 50,000 Afghani.

Wasala wants to take a loan for her quilt-making business.

Parwen wants to take a loan for her husband who has a general store.

Bobo Gul wants to take a loan for her son who is a huckster.

Afghan Gul wants to take a loan for her tailoring business.

Farzhna wants to take a loan for her bead-working business.

They thank AFS and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Naty

texts.es:
Naty, de 31 años, es una madre muy amorosa, vive en la casa que su esposo le dejó cuando se divorciaron y lo que más desea es darles una buena vida a sus queridos hijos. 

El trabajo de Naty es la venta de materiales de construcción, ella abre su ferretería muy temprano por la mañana y es la principal distribuidora de su barrio, ya que no tiene competencia cercana. Sus vecinos siempre acuden a su ferretería cada vez que necesitan algo para la reparación de sus casas, además que saben que recibirán una buena atención.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de lo que sucede en su barrio, lleva 2 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los materiales de construcción hasta su ferretería. 
Para un futuro cercano desea modificar la infraestructura de su casa, para ampliar su ferretería.

Este es el primer préstamo de Naty con MFP y quiere acceder a otros créditos posteriormente, por eso está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente. Con los 3000 soles solicitados comprará nuevos materiales de construcción para implementar mejor su ferretería.
texts.en:
Naty, 31, is a very loving mother. She lives in the house that her husband left her when they divorced. What she wishes for most of all is to give her dear children a good life. Naty sells construction materials. She opens her hardware store very early in the morning. She is the main distributor in her neighborhood, and she does not have any competition nearby. Her neighbors always go to her hardware store each time they need something to repair their houses. Also, they know that they will receive good attention. What she likes most about her work is talking with her customers and finding out what is happening in her neighborhood. She has been in this business for two years. The most difficult part is transporting the construction materials to her hardware store. In the near future she would like to modify the infrastructure of her house in order to expand her hardware store. This is Naty’s first loan with MFP. She would like access to subsequent loans. Therefore, she is prepared to make all of her payments punctually. She will use the 3,000 PEN that she is asking for to buy new construction materials to better set up her hardware store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Leng S. is 31 years of age and married to a military policeman. They have been married for years and have three children; one is married, while the other two are single and garment workers.

Leng operates a little grocery store in front of her home. She has been in business for eight years and is earning approximately $4 per day. As the rice fields come to maturity, Leng S. is looking for capital in order to buy rice in bulk at a reasonable cost from farmers so she can resell it when it commands a better price.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk directly from the rice farmers.

loans.name: Eliecer

texts.es:
Eliecer C. V., tiene la edad de 34 años, esta en unión libre, y tiene 3 hijos, que junto con su esposa son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de  ganado de leche.El negocio del ganado le ayudará a su familia a crecer como ganadero, además él desea vender  los derivados de la vaca como lo son  la leche, quesos y otro. También él se dedica a la agricultura. Es la primera vez don Eliecer se financia con  FUDECOSUR, el manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho y le brindaron muchas facilidades. El espera que con este proyecto crezca y pueda superarse como persona y así poder en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y tener una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Eliecer C. V., 34, is in a common-law relationship and has 3 children who, together with his wife, are his greatest priority in life. The financing he requests is to buy dairy cattle. Cattle will help his family and himself to grow as a cattleman; besides, he wants to sell the products derived from his cows like milk, cheese, and others. He also farms. This is Eliecer's first loan with FUDECOSUR. He states that the credit committee has helped him much and provided easy loan terms. He hopes to grow with this project and to excel as a person in order to offer his family a better quality of life and economic stability. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet A. is 40 years old and married with four children. Her children are excelling in school. Her husband is a government worker. Juliet owns a beauty salon where she creates lovely hair styles for her customers. She also sells hair products like shampoo, hair cream and hair extensions. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is popularly called Madam Juliet in her community in Benin City, Edo State.

LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. Juliet is a LAPO client requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more salon products to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future. Juliet says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To stock up on more salon products to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa de 42 años  vive feliz con su esposo Anaclo de 48 años, con él tiene 3 hijas que son su orgullo; Verónica de 23, Deysi de 19 y Ángela de 5 años, juntos  viven en una cómoda vivienda propia ubicada en una lejana zona de la selva central del Perú.Desde hace 7 años se dedica a la venta de  frutas , como manzanas, plátanos, naranjas, sandías, melones, duraznos, granadillas, entre otras frutas secas, con la ayuda de su hija mayor Verónica, que cada mañana apertura  el local e inicia el negocio; lo que más le gusta de vender las frutas es que sus hijas están en casa junto a ella y  consumen lo que vende  cuidando su alimentación; “vendiendo frutas he  podido construir mi casa, educar a mis hijos, mantener los gastos del hogar  y hasta vestirme ,no me puedo quejar de las ganancias” refiere Rosa ,a la vez resume que por esta razón su negocio es muy rentable. Para  el futuro tiene planeado ampliar su negocio hasta el patio de su casa y surtirlo de más variedad de frutas para satisfacer a sus clientes.Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y sabe que debe pagar puntualmente si quiere seguir progresando para lograr cumplir sus objetivos.El dinero del préstamo quiere invertirlo bien, por ello comprará más frutas las cuales venderá al por mayor, sobre todo desea comprar uvas por la demanda que tiene este producto a fin de año y así poder obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa, 42, lives happily with her 48 year old husband, Anaclo, and their three daughters. Verónica, 23; Deysi, 19; and Ángela, 5, are their pride. They live together in their own comfortable house, which is located in a far away area in the central jungle of Perú. For seven years she has been selling fruit like apples, bananas, oranges, watermelons, melons, peaches, passion fruit, and other dried fruits. She does this with help from her oldest daughter, Verónica. Every morning she opens the place and starts the business. What she likes best about selling fruit is that her daughters are at home with her. They consume what they sell, taking care of their nutrition. “By selling fruit I have been able to build my house, educate my children, pay the household expenses, and even dress myself. I am not able to complain about the earnings,” Rosa says as she summarizes why her business is very profitable. In the future she plans to expand her business out to the patio of her house. She will stock it with a greater variety of fruit to satisfy her customers. This is the fourth time that she has had a loan with MFP. She knows that she needs to pay punctually if she wants to continue progressing in order to meet her objectives. She will use the money from the loan to invest it well, buying more fruit to sell wholesale. Above all, she wants to buy grapes because of the demand there is for this product at the end of the year. That way she will be able to get greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a greater quantity of merchandise for her business

loans.name: Kikonya C Nakayuwa Juliet Group

texts.en: Juliet N. is a hardworking businesswoman aged twenty-one years old. She is married with four children; two of whom go to school. For over four years, she has had a grocery business. To increase her capital, she has been adding stock to her business by purchasing grocery items such as tomatoes, onions, beans, vegetables, pineapples, etc. to sell. She is encouraging and active and her future plans include purchasing a motorcycle to generate income through transport and a plot of land to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Hesborn Joseph

texts.en:
Hesborn Joseph O. is a retail shop owner in Malanga, Busia district. From farming, he started this business in 1999 as a source of income generation for him and his family. He is married and blessed with four children.

Hesborn Joseph buys his stock from Busia once a week. He would like a loan of KES 20,000 which will be used to restock his shop.

loans.use: To restock his retail store

loans.name: Rex

texts.en: Rex P. is from the village of Purok 4, Sta. Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. He is 29 years old and is single. Rex owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Rex joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Rex is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his 2nd from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Agnés

texts.en: Agnés S. is a 44 year-old woman from the region of Diourbel, Senegal. She is married and the mother of two children. Madame S. has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NGASCOP for eight years and has paid back her previous loans in time. Like many others in her village, she raises cattle which she sells in the grand market in nearby Bambey. With this loan she can buy new cattle.

loans.use: To purchase young cattle

loans.name: Malia

texts.en:
Malia M. is 71 and married with 4 children (ages 25 - 39).  She owns a business venture, selling wood handicrafts to tourists and local community members.  Malia has many years of experience in this business.  Malia needs a loan of WST $1750 to purchase additional handicrafts to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

You can view pictures/video of fine mat weaving, taken by a Kiva Fellow, at:   http://picasaweb.google.com/agnes.p.chu/WeavingFineMats#

In 2006, Malia joined SPBD.    This is her 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Malia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Malia M. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.65 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.5 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional handicrafts to sell

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Gerlie C., 39, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Edwin C., a waiter, and they are blessed with five children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her wooden furniture shop for quite some time now.

Gerlie has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her furniture business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 16,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying raw materials needed to continue production of her furniture.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education. She also wants to live out her years with her family in peace.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw materials needed to continue production of her furniture.

loans.name: Omar Roman

texts.es:
Don Omar es padre de familia de cinco hijos, de edad de 43 años, vive en un barrio de la capital que se llama Healeah, su negocio es una pulpería que desde hace varios años logro poner para ganarse el pan de cada día, lo hizo con dinero de su liquidación de su trabajo. Ahora el administra su negocio y con ayuda de su esposa ha logrado equilibrarse en las compras, y el despacho ya que desde horas temprana se levanta para vender. Su casa es de concreto, falta el repello, hacer divisiones, aun es de tierra lo cual desea embaldosar para una mejor higiene. Asi como poner el local de la venta bien cerrado para una mejor visión  del cliente como seguridad.
Con este préstamo comprara zinc nuevo y perlin ya que el techo esta en mal estado y se le pasa el agua en el invierno por tal razón desea cambiar  para dar un techo seguro a su familia.
texts.en:
Don Omar is the 43 year old father of 5 children. They live in an area of the capital called Healeah. Don Omar runs a general store which he opened several years ago to help cover daily expenses. He opened his store with money he got from his previous job. Today he runs his business with the help of his wife and things are going well. They get up early each day to start their work. Their home is made of cement and needs several important repairs. With sales going well at his store, he is a good client for the bank. With the loan, Don Omar will purchase the materials he needs to fix his roof which has been leaking badly.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He will use the loan to purchase materials to fix the roof on his house.

loans.name: Maria De La Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Maria de la Concepción C. S., tiene 44 años de edad habita en el Barrio San Juan de los Ríos, es casado y su esposo labora como agricultor, a la vez es carpintero y le apoyá económicamente a los gastos diarios, sus hijos trabajan en la carpintería y estudian la escuela secundaria, ellos se dedican a la agricultura desde hace 2 años.

Fue con el apoyo del esposo, que logró comprar un terreno y empezar sus días en la siembra, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas, que le permitan mejorar sus tierras para la siembra de los cultivos, esto favorecerá a la familia con mejores condiciones económicas y  la posibilidad de contar con el Capital necesario para futuros inversiones o proyectos de vida.
texts.en:
Maria de la Concepción C. S., 44, lives in the San Juan de los Ríos neighborhood. She is married and her husband is a farmer but he also works as a carpenter and helps her with household expenses. Her children work in the carpentry shop and also go to secondary school. They have been farmers for two years. With her husband’s help, she managed to purchase a plot of land and start her farming days. She is asking for funds to buy farming supplies that will allow her to improve the soil for her crops. This will be of benefit to the family because it will produce better economic conditions and provide the possibility of having capital for future investments and life projects.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia Q., 65, is from the village of Antipolo. She is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Cecilia raises livestock: pigs for sale.  Cecilia  has been in business for over eight years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Cecilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecilia  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC to shelter her livestock.  Cecilia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. This loan will be her second from PMPC.  Cecilia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her living conditions. 

---------------------------------------
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Xoljuyup 3 Group

texts.es: Doña Santa Rafela , tiene 45 años  de edad quien es una mujer trabajadora  y a salido adelante con sus hijos, y se ha dedicado a la elaboración y venta de cortes típicos, su negocio ya cuenta con 30 años de estar funcionando, vende todos los días y con eso logra el sustento diario. Conjuntamente con otras vecinas deciden organizar un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo. El cual será utilizado como capital de trabajo y así poder  incrementar el volumen de ventas. Son 7 señoras que conforman el grupo solidario   denominado “Xoljuyup 3”, las señoras de dedican en la elaboración de blusas y venta de la misma  como también en su mayoría compra y venta de ropa típica. En Colyujup, cantón Chuichexuc Santa Lucia Utatlán, Sololá.
texts.en:
Santa Rafela, 45, is a hard-working woman who has gotten ahead with her children. She makes and sells traditional clothing; she has had this business for 30 years. She sells every day and with this earns her daily bread. With other neighbours she decided to organize a group to request a loan. It will be used as working capital to increase sales volume. This group, called "Xolijuyup 3", is made up of 7 women. They make and sell blouses. As well, the majority of them buy and sell traditional clothing. They are in the Colyujup, in Chuichexuc Santa Lucia Utatlán, Sololá.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Nafissatou

texts.fr: Nafissatou S. est âgée de 27 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SINTHIANG HOULATA depuis le 03 mars 2006 et a 07 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit, elle n’a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle développe une activité de petit commerce de tissus et son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’en acheter en quantité plus importante que d’habitude. Son objectif est de réaliser des bénéfices qui l’aideront à mieux participer ç la prise en charge de sa progéniture par exemple par rapport à la santé et la nourriture.
texts.en:
Nafissatou S. is 27 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She has been a member of the SINTHIANG HOULATA village bank since March 3, 2006 and has received a loan 7 times. She has never had any problems with repayment. She is developing a small fabric business and her new loan will allow her to purchase fabric in larger quantities than usual. Her goal is to make a profit that will help her to better contribute to the care of her offspring, for example, in relation to their health and diet.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and resale of fabric

loans.name: Krishna

texts.en: This is 40-year-old Krishna A.. She is married and has four children aged 16, 22, 20, and 18. In 2010, Krishna established a livestock business. Working seven days a week and sixteen hours a day, she supports her family. Krishna has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to purchase feed for her livestock. In the future, she plans to promote and expand her business. Krishna hopes to take future loans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support. About Patan BPW: This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner in Nepal: micro-finance institution, Patan Business and Professional Women (Patan BPW). Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. It operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to its clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. With a Kiva loan, Patan BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer, which enables them to grow cash crops to sell in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our Patan BPW partner page to keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates. Also, please join our Patan BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites L. is from the village of Poblacion, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 39 years old. Marites is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Marites runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling fruits, soft drinks and other items in her local community.
