Marites has been engaged in her business for over 22 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marites joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marites from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Fozia's Group

texts.en:
Fozia has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s business. He is a painter and paints walls, windows and doors. He has been doing this business for over 10 years and Fozia is very confident that her husband will be able to successfully upgrade his business by buying paint boxes of different colors and brands for his business. 

She 42-year old woman who operates a quilt selling business. She buysquilts from the city of Lahore and sells to her community and also at the markets. The speciality of her quilts is that they are lite in weight but very warm. She earns approximately 5000 PKRs which she uses to pay for the education expenses of her daughters. She has given birth to two daughters and a three years old son. Both of her daughters are attending school and getting their education. 

She is a resident of a city of Borewala, a small city of Pakistan. She owns a three rooms house and has been living in it with her family for over twenty years.

loans.use: Purchase paint boxes for painting business

loans.name: Trần

texts.en: K. Trần Thị is a 51-year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. She is married and has three grown-up children. To making a living, K. owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling bamboo products to local businesses and community members. K. has been in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 5.000.000 dong (VND) a month. In 2008, K. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. K. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA which was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture products. K. is now requesting a new loan of 7.840.000 VND which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This will be her second loan from SEDA. K. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. No. 20206030027. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. K. Trần Thị (20206030027) là 51 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành. Để kiếm sống, K. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng tre cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. K. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, K. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng. Vào 2008, K. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. K. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung. Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. K. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture bamboo products

loans.name: Mujeres Virtuosas Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Mujeres Virtuosas, se conformó en fecha 29 de octubre del 2008, mediante el deseo de la señoras de conformar un grupo unido para trabajar y de esa manera ayudar a sus familias.
De esta manera cada una tiene su actividad en forma independiente y también realizan algunas actividades para recaudar fondos y así se ayudan mutuamente con la responsabilidad conjunta que tienen. 
La Sra. Petrona A. es una de las integrantes y posee un puesto de venta de frutas y verduras, debido a su buena ubicación posee buena clientela y buena demanda de sus productos, gracias a la buena atención y calidad de las frutas y verduras que posee para comercialización.
Ella desea agrandar el negocio, adquiriendo al por mayor frutas y verduras, abaratando los costos y así obtener más ingresos por su venta, así tambén desea incrementar a travéz de la venta de jugos y ensaladas de frutas, postres. Para ello solicita el prestamo para la compra de frutas.
texts.en:
“El Comité de Mujeres Virtuosas” (The Committee of Virtuous Women) was formed on October 29, 2008, by women who wanted to form a group that would allow them to work and in this way help their families. Each member is able to run her own business, while at the same time collect funds to mutually support one another in their collective responsibilities. Ms. Petrona A. is one of the members and has a fruit and vegetable stand. It’s in a good location, she has a good customer base, and demand for her products is high because of the good customer service she provides and because of the quality of fruits and vegetables that she sells. She wants to add to her business by acquiring larger quantities of fruits and vegetables, thereby lowering her costs and increasing her profits. She also wants to start selling juices, fruit salads, and desserts. She is asking for this loan so she can buy more fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fruit for resale

loans.name: Oscar Lino

texts.es:
El cliente Oscar Lino G. Martínez. Vive en el municipio santa Rosa Del Peñón departamento de león del centro de salud una cuadra al Norte 1 ½ C al este, Es soltero  trabaja actual mente en la alcaldía santa Rosa del peñón desempeña  el cargo como Conductor 6 años de estar laborando en esta institución.
El cliente cuanta con una casa de habitación Familiar el cual la quiere mejorar.
El destino del crédito es para la Compra de Cemento Para La construcción de un comedor.  para el mejoramiento de su vivienda. 
Esto le permitirá mantener en mejores condiciones el bien estar de su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar lives in the town of Santa Rosa Del Peñón, in the León region of Nicaragua and is single. He works for the town of Santa Rosa Del Peñón as a driver. He has worked there for 6 years. 

Oscar wants to make improvements to his home. 

His loan will be used to buy cement to build a dining room. This will enable him to maintain the well-being of his family.

loans.use: Purchase of cement to construct a dining room

loans.name: Claritza

texts.es:
Claritza tiene 35 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su hija de 14 años de edad en casa de su madre ubicada en el distrito agrícola de Cayaltí, una zona de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, ella trabaja en base a pedidos, mientras más pedidos realiza más dinero gana, sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y familiares. Asimismo vende zapatos por pedidos y  se encarga de administrar un negocio de venta de comida en el mercado del distrito desde hace casi cinco años.

Claritza ya ha trabajado anteriormente con un crédito financiado por el Fondo Kiva. Con ese préstamo ella pudo incursionar en la venta de zapatos y gracias a ello ya puede generarse ingresos adicionales. Actualmente ella desea seguir ampliando su negocio de venta de cosméticos. Por ello se encuentra solicitando un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles.

Claritza se encuentra muy agradecida con las personas que han colaborado con ella a través del fondo Kiva. Ella planea seguir trabajando y creciendo como empresaria para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Claritza, 35, is single and lives with her 14-year-old daughter in a house with her mother located in the agricultural district of Cayaltí, an area of regular business activity which is an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. 

She sells beauty products by catalog based on customer orders. The more orders she takes the more money she earns. Her primary customers are her neighbors and family members. At the same time she sells shoes in the same manner and for almost five years she has managed a business selling food in the district's market.  

Claritza has already worked previously with one loan financed through the Kiva Fund. With that loan she was able to delve into shoe sales thanks to which she now is able to generate additional income. Currently she wishes to continue growing her business in cosmetics sales and so is seeking a loan of an additional 500 soles. 

Claritza is highly appreciative towards the people who have contributed to her success through the Kiva fund. She plans to continue working and growing as a business owner in order to get ahead.

loans.use: Expansion of a business selling cosmetics by catalog

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El Sr.Juan García es un hombre muy trabajador el hace trabajos de carpinteria y albañileria y hace tres años coloco en su casa una tienda de abarrotes que con la ayuda de su Esposa la Señora Juanita, es atendida, el siempre ha sido una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y con muchas ganas de salir adelante , sigue mejorando las condiciones de su casa y ahora negocio requiere el credito para terminar la elaboracion de la barda ya cuenta con algo de material solo que no lo pudo terminar por falta de recursos para eso es su credito.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan García is a very hard working man; he does carpentry and bricklaying jobs.  Three years ago he installed a grocery store in his home that his wife, Juanita, tends to.  He has always been a very hard working, responsible person with desires to get ahead in life.

He continues to make improvements to his home and now it’s the business that needs a loan to finish building a wall.  He already has some of the necessary supplies but he was unable to finish it due to lack of funds so this is the reason for the loan.

loans.use: To finish building a wall.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa B. is a 44-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a fishing  business. She lives in Sitio Mahayahay, Brgy. Daan Lungsod, Medellin, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 12500. 

Celsa is now borrowing PHP 20000 so that she can fund her business operations. This will be her ninth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Celsa aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund her fishing business

loans.name: Lochin

texts.ru: Ашурматов Лочин проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 40 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Более 10 лет занимается растениеводством. Арендует земельный участок, где выращивает овощи и сеет бобовые культуры для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений и топлива для трактора.
texts.en: Lochin A. lives in Shahrituz.  He is 40 years old, married, and has four children.  He has a high school education.  He has been farming for more than ten years.  He rents the plot of land where he grows legumes and vegetables.  He is taking a loan mineral fertilizers and fuel for a tractor.

loans.use: Закуп минеральных удобрений и топлива

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 56 years old, married, and has four children between the ages of 31 and 20 years. She has been farming for the past twenty years, growing such crops as maize, vegetables, and potatoes.

This will be her fourth loan through Juhudi Kilimo, and she plans to use it to purchase poultry.

With the anticipated profits from the loan, she hopes to be able to pay for school fees and better feed her family. In the future, she hopes to own four dairy cows and a poultry farm.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn T. is a married woman from the town of Banga. She has children who go to school. Analyn is a farmer. She particularly plants and harvests rice crops. She sells her harvest at the market. Analyn also owns and manages a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells biscuits, chicken eggs and other products. Analyn plans to start a small backyard piggery. She says she wants to have an extra source of income in case of emergencies.

Analyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Analyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and piglets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and piglets

loans.name: Joseph Maina

texts.en: Joseph has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last 23 years. He is married to Lydia Waithira and they have two children. Joseph was introduced to KADET LTD  by his friend and this will be his third loan. He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. Joseph plans to use this loan to prepare his land for the planting season. In the future, Joseph hopes to practice onion farming on a large scale.

loans.use: to prepare his land for the planting season

loans.name: Benedetta

texts.en:
Benedetta N. is thirty-six years old, is married, and has two children, aged fourteen years old and five years old. Benedetta’s business is located at a busy market, known as Mukuru Kwa Njenga, and she is served by the Kitengela branch. She owns a tailoring shop and makes clothes such as blouses, dresses, ladies suits, trousers and school uniforms. She serves the local people in this business, which she has been operating for the last ten years. She has managed to provide employment to one person. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However she works very hard to keep her business doing well.
Benedetta is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy materials to expand her business. She hopes to grow her business into supplying of ready-made clothes at wholesale. She also sees herself buying a plot of land on which she will build her home. She describes herself as very honest, creative and business-oriented.

loans.use: Materials

loans.name: Jia's Group

texts.en:
Jia lives with her family in Lahore, which is famous for its history and culture in Pakistan. She lives there in a 2 room brick house. She is 45 years old, and has given birth to 2 sons. Her eldest son works in a private organization while the second one is a motor mechanic. 

Jia supports her family by selling clothes. She purchases clothes from the famous clothes markets of Lahore called “AnarkA.” and “Azam market” and sells to her local area clients. She operates this business from her home and earns a good income every month. Besides her business, she also gives the proper time to her household activities and makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her clothes selling business. With the loan, she will buy clothes of different variety in bulk quantity. She expects that her business will improve after the loan investment and she will be able to make more sales and profits by offering more varieties of clothes to the clients. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 6th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea R. is from the village of Baybay, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 38 years old. Andrea is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Andrea owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general services to local community members. Andrea has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Andrea joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Andrea is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Andrea from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials for gara cloth production

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua B., who is married to a farmer and has four children, runs a provisions store in Abrafo, near Abura, selling soaps, detergent, toilet paper, etc. Her income supplements her husband’s and helps to pay for utility bills and school fees.

Educated up to junior high school, Akua is keen to grow her business and will do so with this loan by purchasing more goods in quantity and variety to attract more customers. Her plan is to reinvest profits back into her store. Eventually, she wants to open a second shop in a different locality.

loans.use: to purchase more goods in quantity and variety to attract more customers.

loans.name: Noomali

texts.en: Noomali is a very painstaking lady who practices farming in Olopito-Narok, Kenya. She has been in this business for over five years and earns a monthly profit of KES 7,000. She is 28 years old and married to Jackson, also a farmer, and they have two children. She is applying for her first loan, which she plans to use to buy farm inputs. Noomali intends to use the additional income generated by this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children's school fees. She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Valentina; ella tiene 38 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de realizar llamadas telefónicas, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m y la socia también realiza negocios independientes ahora que se acerca las fiestas patrias que se celebra por el día del Peru,la socia va a vender banderas del Perú y luego los vende en forma ambulatoria, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de banderas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como tela e hilos para hacer las banderas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the San Rafael Communal Bank located in the district of Cusco, province of Cusco, department of Cusco.  

The member’s name is Valentina.  She is 38 years old and married with three children.  She works from 7:00 AM until 6:00 PM, alternating her daily activities between her telephone call center job and operating an independent business.  Now that the Peruvian National Holidays are approaching, Valentina is going to work as a street vendor selling Peruvian flags.  She wishes to expand her business of selling flags and is requesting this loan to buy materials such as fabric and thread to make the flags.

Valentina is happy to receive the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: buy materials such as fabric and thread to make flags.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes N. lives in the Kamwokya neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, one of whom is in school.  

Agnes lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees and medication.   

Agnes runs a pub. She has been in this business for three years and she works seven days out of every week. Agnes sells her products by means of retail. 

Agnes has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer and jerry cans of local gin. 

The main business challenges for Agnes include defaulters and the increasing price of beer.  

Her goals are to see her business grow big, to own a fully stocked pub and also to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and jerry cans of local gin.

loans.name: Floreta

texts.en:
Floreta  is from the village of Looc, Libertad Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Floreta owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling farm-raised fish in the local community. Floreta has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Floreta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Floreta is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fingerlings to raise. This loan will be Floreta's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fingerlings to raise

loans.name: Sonia Andromaque

texts.fr: Née le 31 Août 1981 au Bénin, Sonia Andromaque est mariée à Jean un agent de la mairie. Le couple à trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Deux sont leurs propres enfants. Sonia Andromaque vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Sonia Andromaque assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis huit ans environs, Sonia Andromaque vend des produits cosmétiques et des mèches. Parallèlement à cela, Sonia Andromaque  vend divers produits. Sonia Andromaque s’approvisionne dans l’un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l’aidant à couvrir les diverses charges de sa famille. Dans l’optique de rehausser davantage le niveau de son activité et d’accroître son profit, Sonia Andromaque sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits dont Sonia Andromaque avait bénéficié ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Sonia Andromaque, born in Benin on August 31, 1981, is married to Jean, an employee at the mayor's office. They have three children, who all attend school and are in their care. Two of them are their own children. Sonia Andromaque lives with her husband and the children. The parents share the various household expenses.

For around eight years, Sonia Andromaque has been selling cosmetics and hair extensions. Next to this activity, she sells various products. She gets her supplies at one of the large markets in Benin. This activity generates enough income to enable her to provide for family expenses. In order to boost her activity level and make more profit she came to the microfinance institution Alidé and applied for her third loan. Sonia Andromaque has repaid her previous two loans on schedule.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, cosmetics and soap.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is married and has four children. She is 40 years old and lives in Farmintong, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Cynthia sells different kinds of products in her general store to earn a living and has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more products for her general store. Cynthia has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to build a window with security bars on her house, providing better security for her family

loans.name: Jesites

texts.en:
Jesites is 34 years old and is married with two school-aged children. She earns about PHP 7,000 per month as a farmer working in the Philippines. 

Jesites grows rice and has been doing this for almost 8 years. Jesites is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides.

In the future, Jesites hopes to have a plentiful harvest in order to earn a higher income to finance the education of her children. She is thankful that Kiva lenders offers a financial assistance to strengthen their source of income. She believes that having patience and strong determination will lead her to reach her business goals in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for rice farming

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 40-year-old married woman with five children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been operating a bar for five years. She got her initial capital to start this business from farming plus a loan acquired from Kiva partner, HOFOKAM. Her main hardship is bad debtors. Rose's vision is a bigger bar and to educate her children. Rose is requesting a credit facility to buy beers, sodas and chairs for her pub.

loans.use: to buy beers, sodas and chairs for her pub.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a hard working 35-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with a 15 year-old-child who is going to school. For the last 3 years, Mary has been engaged in dairy farming to make a living. She also makes extra income by rearing pigs for sale. She wants in the next 5 years to be living her dreams. Her dream is to own a herd of cattle and pigs. 

Mary is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy animal feed and pigs. Thanks to Faulu Kenya she has been able to acquire business management skills.

loans.use: buy animal feed and pigs

loans.name: Mariana Azucena

texts.es:
En la  parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Desarrollo Femenino. Este lugar se lo conoce por su rica gastronomía y su vegetación, es este lugar la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y comercio en general.

En este lugar vive la señora Mariana, tiene 45 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, dos mayores de edad y dos de 16 y 11 años tres de ellos estudian en universidad y uno en colegio. El marido es comerciante. 

Nuestra amiga para ayudar a su marido el cual no gana lo suficiente para mantener el hogar se dedica  a preparar hayacas (plato típico del campo manabita que es muy apreciado por las personas de otras ciudades), ella todos los días prepara las hayacas que luego manda a entregar con su esposo hasta la ciudad de Manta  al mismo tiempo que el realiza sus ventas de verduras y frutas en el mercado. Lleva más de 20 años en este negocio.

Este crédito es para comprar víveres necesarios para preparar estos productos. Lleva más de 5 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que les da el banco. 

Su sueño es gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
In the Calderon parish of Portoviejo city, the Desarollo Femenino ["Women's Development"] Communal Bank meets every fifteen days. This region is known for its rich gastronomy and its vegetation. The majority of its inhabitants are farmers and general merchants.

Mariana lives here. She is 45 and in a common-law marriage from which she has four children. Two of them are grown and the other two are 16 and 11. Three of them are in university and the other is in school. Her husband is a merchant.

In order to help her husband, who does not make enough money to maintain the household, our friend makes hayacas (a traditional dish from the Manabi countryside that is highly prized by those from other cities). Every day she prepares hayacas that she later sends with her husband to Manta city while she sells fruits and vegetables in the market. She has had this business for over 20 years.

This loan is for purchasing the necessary supplies to prepare these products. She has been in the Communal Bank for over 5 years and she likes it because of the help that the bank gives them.

Her dream is to have good health.

loans.use: to purchase supplies.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana está muy satisfecha con su credikiva  anterior pues logró comprar telas en mayor volumen y fabricó cubre lechos, artículos D. lencería que gustaron a sus clientes por eso los vendió y ganó muy pronto dinero. En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, con el cual comprará nuevamente insumos y materiales para lencería pues al final D. año debe estar preparada para que sus clientes, comprando los artículos que Diana fabrica,  adornen con motivos naviD.ños los interiores D. sus viviendas. Ella dice a sus  financiadores D. Kiva  que Gracias al apoyo que recibe por medio D. Kiva y D. la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, se capitaliza su negocio y aumenta las ganancias, para sacar adelante a su familia especialmente a su hija que tiene discapacidad auditiva y del habla.Si usted quiere conocer la historia D. Diana ingrese al siguiente enlace:  http://kiva.org/lend/211189
texts.en:
Diana was very pleased with her previous Kiva loan, which enabled her to buy fabrics in bulk so that she could produce bedding and linens that her customers prefer. As a result, she sold them and earned a profit very quickly.

At the moment, she is requesting another Kiva loan so that she can buy a new supply of materials for making linens because she has to be prepared for the year-end purchases from her customers. They buy the items that Diana produces and use them for home decorations during the Christmas season. She expresses her thanks to the lenders for the support she has received through Kiva and Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Diana has been able to capitalize her business and increase her earnings, thus allowing her family to move forward, especially her daughter who has hearing and speech disabilities.

To learn more about Diana’s story, please click on the following link: http://kiva.org/lend/211189

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for making linens.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del  Banco Comunal “Central Vaquería”, ubicado en la parcialidad de Vaquería,  distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos.  Cuenta con educación secundaria.
Junto a su esposo se dedica a la compra  y venta de animales caseros, también tienen una panadería.  Su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó en la compra de tres ovinos.
Este nuevo préstamo de S/. 700.00 nuevo soles, lo incrementará al capital de su negocio para comprar una camionada de leña para su panadería. 
La señora desea seguir adelante con el negocio por ello es cumplida en sus pagos a Manuela Ramos.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones,  la puntualidad y la responsabilidad entre las socias.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the communal bank “Central Vaquería,” which is located in the Vaquería neighborhood of Llave District, Collao Province, Department of Puno.  She is 40 years old, married and has 2 children.  She completed secondary school.
Together with her husband, she makes her living buying and selling small livestock.  They also have a bakery.  Her first loan was for 500.00 PEN (about $180 USD) and she used the money to purchase three sheep.
This new loan for 700.00 PEN ($250 USD) will increase her business capital and allow her to purchase a truck load of firewood for her bakery.
The Señora hopes to continue moving forward with her business and be timely with her repayments to Manuela Ramos.	
What she likes about the communal bank are the meetings and the punctuality and responsibility of the members.

loans.use: to purchase a truckload of firewood.

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en:
Hamlet was born in 1965. He lives in Vanadzor city with his family, which consists of his wife and three children: two daughters and a son. Hamlet’s elder daughter graduated from Vanadzor branch of Yerevan teachers' training institute last year, his younger daughter is a pupil, and his son now is getting a higher education in Yerevan.
 
Hamlet’s specialization is electrical engineering, but he has never worked in his specialty. Hamlet runs his own business where he produces jewelry. He has equipped a room in his home where he has been working more than 20 years. Hamlet performs not only private orders but also sells his production to his regular customers from the Vanadzor gold market.   

Thanks to his business, Hamlet supports his family and pays for his son’s education. He was able to buy the necessary furniture for his home and to pay for his elder daughter’s education. 

This is Hamlet’s second loan from Nor Horizon and now he is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy materials for his business.

loans.use: To buy gold and other materials for his business

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 30 years old and is married. He has two children. In his village, Jean Bosco owns a shop where he sells clothes. This is his third successful year in this business and the hours of this business are from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day.

Jean Bosco has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase his working capital and buy more clothes to sell. Jean Baptiste will earn more profits. With these profits, he will be able to build a secure future for his business as well as for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Merabu

texts.en:
Merabu, a 39-year-old married mother of three, lives in the Iganga region of Uganda where, for the past three years, she has been working hard to manage her small shop which sells mattresses.

To help expand her business, Merabu has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more mattresses which will help her to generate greater profits and operate with larger inventories. She hopes that in the future she will be able to shift into selling wholesale.

Merabu is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Merabu who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more mattresses.

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es: Sandra María está estudiando Licenciatura en Farmacia y está en el último año de su carrera, el crédito solicitado será para pagar los módulos para graduarse. Actualmente trabaja  en una farmacia. Ella quiere ser docente de la carrera de farmacia, se considera una persona afortunada por poder tener la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera que a ella le gusta. Los conocimientos que ha adquirido tanto en los estudios como en el trabajo, le hacen una persona capaz de desarrollar esta carrera.
texts.en: Sandra María’s studying for a Bachelor’s in Pharmacy and is in her last years of coursework.  The loan she asked for will be to pay for her final course modules and graduate.  She currently works in a pharmacy.  She wants to teach pharmacy.  She considers herself to be a fortunate person for having the opportunity to study a career she likes.  The knowledge she’s acquired both through her studies and at work makes her a person capable of unfolding in this career.

loans.use: to pay for her final course modules.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: La señora Susana nacida en Santa Cruz se dedica a la repostería a la elaboración de galletas y panes es casada con el señor Ramón  tienen dos hijos, su domicilio es propio que se encuentra ubicado en la zona el torno,  viven hace 30 años en esta zona, la señora tiene con esta  actividad ya varios años,  la repostería es lo que mas le gusta, vende tortas, queques, etc. a pedidos, además es maestra, el destino del crédito es para la compra de horno y utensilios para  poner un pequeño local para vender sus productos se siente muy agradecida con la institución por la confianza otorgada.
texts.en:
Susana was born in Santa Cruz and she’s a pastry maker; she bakes cookies and bread.  She’s married to Ramón and they have two children.  She owns her house located in El Torno.  They have lived in this zone for 30 years and she’s been in this line of work for several years now.  Pastry making is what she likes best.  She sells cakes, Bundt cakes, etc. on order.  She’s also a teacher.

The loan will be used to buy an oven and utensils to open a small locale to sell her products.  She feels very grateful to the institution for the trust placed in her.

loans.use: to buy an oven and utensils.

loans.name: Rosemelia

texts.en:
Rosemelia is 36 years old and married to her husband Maximo, who is a farmer in Dalaoig, Alcala, Cagayan. To make a living, Rosemelia and her husband are both involved in rice production. They have been cultivating a hectare rice field, which enables them to produce yield of about 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per harvest season. Harvest falls twice a year during the months of April and November.

As of now, Rosemelia had insufficient funds so she is asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers necessary in maintaining good crops.

In the future, Rosemelia hopes to strengthen her business and continue to send her two children into college education.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizers necessary for maintaining good crops.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister).

Alice has a business of secondhand shoes. She has been in this business for over 10 years and she works 6 days out of every week. Alice sells her products at the market by means of retail. Alice has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of secondhand shoes. The main business challenges for Alice include transportation and the increasing prices of used shoes.

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and also to start importing used shoes.  Alice lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used shoes

loans.name: Maura Elisa

texts.es:
Maura es una señora de 50 años, optimista con ganas de luchar por sus hijos y triunfar. Tiene 4 hijos, es viuda, vive con una hija en Ibarra en la Provincia de Imbabura.

Maura trabaja vendiendo cosméticos a domicilio ya que no tiene un local, es el tercer crédito que solicita a fodemi el mismo que va a utilizar para la compra de cosméticos como perfumes, cremas, joyas y otros productos ya que en temporada navideña incrementan las ventas y para Maura los ingresos económicos que le servirán para dar el estudio a su última hija y cubrir sus necesidades.

El sueño de Maura es seguir trabajando con entusiasmo y ver a su última hija cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Maura is a 50 year old woman who is optimistic and has the desire to fight for her children and to triumph.  She is a widow, and she has four children.  She lives with her daughter in Ibarra in the Imbabura province.

Maura works selling cosmetics door-to-door because she does not have a place to sell.

This is the third loan she has requested from Fodemi.  She will use the loan to buy cosmetics like perfume, creams, jewelry, and other products.  During the Christmas season sales increase.  Maura will use the income for her last daughter’s education and to cover their necessities.

Maura’s dream is to continue working with enthusiasm and to see her last daughter fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to buy products like perfume, jewelry, and creams, among others, in order to take advantage of the Christmas season.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es: Emerita de 52 es una mujer carismática, luchadora con ganas de seguir creciendo. Está casada con Marcos quien es empleado. Sus hijos ya no viven con ella, pues son independientes. Ahora ella y su esposo están juntos vive  en su propia su casa la cual compró con ayuda de él. Emerita se dedica a la venta de libros, para esto cuenta con un local instalada en su propia casa, de esa manera se ahorra en gastos de alquiler. Su negocio es muy concurrido por los vecinos y extraños que pasan por la zona, a quienes  atiende con amabilidad. Su librería lleva ya 9 años de funcionamiento tiempo en cual ha llegado a ser muy conocida y concurrida, contando con el apoyo de su esposo para la atención al publico en sus ratos libres. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que se hizo muy conocida en la zona, y que le trae ingreso económicos que le da la tranquilidad de poder brindarle a ella y a su esposo. Comenta que escogió esta actividad por la necesidad de contar con un oficio y sentirse una mujer productiva, por tanto  tiene muchas ganas de seguir creciendo en su rubro y ampliar su negocio, vendiendo otros artículos para el hogar y la familia. Por tanto éste sería su préstamo número 06 con la institución MFP,  se siente muy cómoda con el grupo en el cual trabaja pues los conoce muy bien por el tiempo que viene trabajando con ellos, considera que son personas responsables, lo que le anima a seguir en el grupo. Con el préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles, comprará juguetes de diversos modelos y muy variados a precio por mayor, considera que a mayor variedad más acogida tendrá su negocio.
texts.en:
Emerita, aged 52, is a charismatic, resilient woman who wants to continue to grow her business. She is married to Marcos, who is an employee. Her children no longer live with her; they are independent. Now it is just Emerita and her husband living in the home they bought together. 

Emerita sells books for a living. In order to do this she has a store set up in her own home. This way, she saves on rental costs. The store is very popular with local residents as well as people who are passing through. They all receive a warm welcome from Emerita.

The bookstore has been operating for 9 years. During this time it has become very well-known and popular. Emerita’s husband helps out by serving customers when he has a spare moment. 

What Emerita likes about her work is the fact that it has made her very prominent in her local area and that it gives her an income which gives her the peace of mind of being able to provide for her little children. She says she chose this occupation because she needed to practice a trade and feel productive. For that reason, she would really like to continue in her line of work and expand her business. 

This would be Emerita’s sixth loan with the organisation MFP. She feels very at ease with the group she works in. She knows the people very well, as they have been working together for a long time, and she feels that they are responsible people, which makes her want to remain in the group. 

Emerita will use the loan of 2000 PEN to buy a variety of different toys at wholesale price. She believes that her business will be more popular if it offers a variety of products.

loans.use: to buy toys wholesale.

loans.name: Daniel Fernando

texts.es:
El señora Daniel Fernando es casado, tiene 24 años de edad, cursó el segundo grado de educación básica, trabaja en una organización de servicios profesionales, lleva 3 años de experiencia.

El trabaja como agente de créditos para una organización y por necesidades de su familia, solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de comida para su hogar: cereales, azúcar, lácteos, frutas, etc., espera recuperarse económicamente y darle una mejor condición de vida su familia.
texts.en:
Daniel Fernando is married.  He is 24 years old and studied up to the second year of 'educación básica' (middle school).  He works for a professional services organization and has three years experience.

Daniel Fernando works as a loan agent for an organization.  Owing to the needs of his family, he is requesting a loan which he will use to buy food for his household: cereals, sugar, dairy products, fruit, etc.  He hopes to get back on his feet financially and provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to cover some personal expenses

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 24 years old. She is married with 1 child, aged 1 year old. She owns a shop and has been in business for 2 years. Her husband is a businessman. With the loan, she would like to buy more items such as Colgate, shoe polish, and pens for resale. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy more items such as Colgate, shoe polish, and pens for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Regina wants to buy more nails,iron sheet,paints,timber,water pipes,and cnstruction bricks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expansion of her fresh juice refreshments business

loans.name: Erika Lorena

texts.en:
EriKa is a single mom with a small daughter. The need to provide for her daughter motivated or to start her own business, since it would allow her time to spend with her daughter.

For this reason, Erica has been selling clothes for the past three years. It hasn't been easy for Erica to rear her daughter by herself, but her strength and love for her child has allowed her to do it and to have her own business which has provided her with income from the very beginning.

Now is the beginning of the new season and Erika needs a loan of $250 which she will use to purchase merchandise so she can offer a more diverse inventory to her clients and continue growing the business like she has until now. She pledges to repay this amount within three to six months. Be an important part of the growth of this business and help this family. They sincerely thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Lighthouse Translations, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Erika es madre soltera de una pequeña hija, la necesidad de mantener a su hija la motivaron a iniciar su propio negocio, ya que este le permitía pasar tiempo con su hija y no descuidarla, por esta razón, desde hace tres años, Erika se dedica a la venta ropa. No ha sido fácil para Erika sacar adelante a su hija ella sola, pero el amor de madre y su fortaleza le han permitido hacerlo y tener un negocio que ha rendido frutos desde su inicio.

Por el inicio de la nueva temporada, Erika necesita de un crédito por $250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder ofrecer más surtido a sus clientes y continuar creciendo como hasta ahora, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a esta familia, ellas agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: increase on her stock

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Mrs. Doris O. lives in Benin, Edo State and has been a member of LAPO for the past 2 years. She is 42 years old, married with four (4) children, and sells cooked food and drinks in her area. She is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 475 for the enhancement of her micro-business.

loans.use: To buy more food ingredients

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi A. was born on February 17, 1967, in Lomé. She was not fortunate enough to go to school due to the pitiful financial situation of her parents. Selling beignets (a kind of doughnut) is her main business. Single with two persons care for, she needs financial support in the amount of $400 to strengthen and grow her business. The loan will be used as capital to buy sacks of flour for making beignets.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Madame A. Afi est née le 17 février 1967 à Lomé. Elle n’a pas eut la chance d’aller à l’école à cause de la situation financière misérable de ses parents. Elle exerce comme activité principale la vente de beignet. Célibataire, avec deux (02) personnes à charge ; elle a besoin d’un appui financier de $400 pour renforcer et accroître la taille de son commerce. Ceci lui servira de fond de commerce pour l’achat de sacs de farine de blé pour la préparation de son beignet.

loans.use: A supply of flour

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu A. sells cosmetics, lace materials, thread, needles, handkerchiefs, baby diapers, and provisions such as milk, soap, and minerals. Salamatu is married and has three children ages 15, 6 and 3 years old. Her husband is an electrician but his income is low. Salamatu works very hard. To help with the family finances, she also sells shoes and mineral water. Her store is located at Moree Junction, about 5km from Cape Coast.

She is also a member of a lending group called “Emmanuel Traders Group” located on the Yamoransa – Accra highway.

Salamatu is asking for a loan of US $800 to fill her store with cosmetics, shoes, baby dresses, minerals, lace materials, thread, and provisions such as milk, milo, soap, and bags of rice. She intends to pay the loan back within seven months.

loans.use: To fill her store with cosmetics, shoes, baby dresses, and provisions such as milk, milo, soap, and pepsodent.

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Mrs. Kamala B. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati, Nepal. Kamala has two sons; both are studying in Higher Secondary School. Her husband is a taxi driver and drives his taxi in Kathmandu valley.

Kamala already has one cow and she sells cow's milk door-to-door daily, morning and evening. The demand for cow's milk is increasing in that area because grass-fed cow's milk is good for health.

Now Kamala is requesting her third loan of US$ 325 to purchase a young milch cow because of the increased demand for cow’s milk in her area. She has grassland of her own, so she does not has to buy food for her cows.

loans.use: To buy a young milch cow

loans.name: Twelusigwe

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! Twelusigwe K. is 45 years old and she is married with six children. Her children are between the ages of 10 and 24 years old and she has one other dependent, her house boy. In 1997 Twelusigwe established a pharmacy and she now seeks a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of medicine. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA:
SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilities as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing whereby SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA will purchase equipment from said client, extend a loan to her, and then lease the same equipment back to her – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; therefore, financial institutions do not consider Tanzanian women to be credit-worthy because they lack tangible assets that could serve as collateral. As a result, Tanzanian women with low income receive poor financial support and meager access to basic needs and services. SELFINA thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of medicine in bulk

loans.name: Sumiati

texts.en: Sumiati, 42, is a mother of 4 children. She is married to I. who is a private driver earning $30 a month. She produces baby clothes then sells them on credit. She gets income from her business--$15 a week with a small profit. To add to her business capital she is asking for a loan of $75, and as a member of MBK she will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Pasanqueri Group

texts.es:
The “Pasanqueri” group works with the Pro-Mujer Villa Exaltación focal group in the Villa Exaltación area of El Alto.

This particular women's group is new and is in its 2nd cycle. All are very excited and happy to start their own businesses so that they can support their families. They all have large families and need to help their spouses with the household costs, especially since the majority of them have children who are old enough for school, but they do not have the money to give them a proper education.

There are several types of businesses within the group. For example, Don Carlitos has a public taxi service. Also, members sell clothing, condiments, produce, and cosmetics. They sell these goods retail, and have to purchase them wholesale in order to sell them as street vendors.

The entire group needs a larger loan to be able to get the products wholesale and, thus, expand their businesses and increase their profits. With these improvements, they will be able to support their families and pay the loans back quicker.

Translated by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

EL GRUPO "PASANQUERI" TRABAJA CON EL CENTRO FOCAL DE "VILLA EXALTACION DE" PRO-MUJER HUBICADO EN UNA VILLA DEL MISMO NOMBRE, EN LA CIUDAD DE EL ALTO .

ESTE PARTICULAR GRUPO DE SEÑORAS, ES UN GRUPO NUEVO CUMPLIENDO ASI SU SEGUNDO CICLO. TODAS MUY EMOCIONADAS Y FELICES DE EMPRENDER NEGOCIOS PROPIOS CON EL UNICO FIN DE SUSTENTAR SUS HOGARES YA QUE EN GENERAL TODOS CENTAN CON FAMILIAS NUMEROSAS Y NECESITAN APOYAR A SUS PAREJAS CON LA ECONOMIA DE SUS FAMILIAS, YA QUE LA MAYORIA TIENEN HIJOS EN EDAD ESCOLAR Y NO LES ALCANZA EL DINERO PARA OFRECERLES UNA EDUCACION DIGNA

EXISTEN DISTINTAS ACTIVIDADES DENTRO LA ASOCIACION COMO POR EJEMPLO DON CARLITOS TIENE UN TAXI DE SERVICIO PUBLICO, ADEMAS EXISTE LA VENTA DE ROPA, CONDIMEMTOS, VERDURAS, FRUTAS, COSMETICOS QUE GENERALMENTE SE LAS REALIZA AL POR MENOR, TENIENDO QUE ADQUIRIR ESTOS DISTINTOS PRODUCTOS AL POR MAYOR PARA PODER LUEGO OFRECERLOS DE MANERA AMBULANTE AL POR MENOR.

TODO EL GRUPO AFIRMA QUE NECESITA MAYOR CREDITO PARA PODER ADQUIRIR ESTOS PRODUCTOS AL POR MAYOR ASI LOS NEGOCOS CRECERIAN Y SUS GANANCIAS SERIAN MAYORES DE ESTA FORMA PODRIAN SUSTENTAR A SUS FAMILIAS Y PARALELAMNETE PODER PAGAR LOS CREDITOS DE MANERA MAS RAPIDA,

loans.use:
The group has expressed that they need more loans to be able to acquire wholesale products.

EL GRUPO AFIRMA QUE NECESITA MAYOR CREDITO PARA PODER ADQUIRIR ESTOS PRODUCTOS AL POR MAYOR

loans.name: Mtumbia

texts.en:
Mtumbia, age 30, is married with 3 children, ages 11, 9, and 4. She sells clothing and began this business 3 years ago. She works from 9am to 4pm daily and makes a monthly profit of about $180 from her sales.

Mtumbia hopes for a loan to purchase more clothing to sell. She is a member of the Umoja Ni Nguyu loan group, whose members guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Ernestian

texts.en:
Ernestian A. sells cocoa products. She is married, and her husband works at the University of Cape Coast Sanitary Office. Her husband's income is insufficient for Ernestian and her two children. Demand has been high, and she would like to expand her business.

She is asking for a loan as additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Nelva

texts.es:
Ms. Nelva M. sells fuel (gasoline and kerosene) on one of the city of Juliaca’s main avenues. She has been in business for over 10 years, during which time she has become popular and preferred by her customers. She is now one of the most important fuel suppliers for urban drivers in the city of Juliaca. Nelva works from the early hours of the day, and thanks to her efforts and dedication, she has been able to keep her family from want. At this time, this hardworking, 53-year-old mother still has enough strength to keep fighting for her loved ones, so she is requesting a loan of 600 Peruvian soles, which she will invest in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Nelva vende combustible (gasolina y petróleo) en una de las principales avenidas de la ciudad de Juliaca, se dedica a esta labor desde hace más de 10 años, en ese período se hizo muy popular y querida por sus clientes, convirtiéndose en una de las proveedoras de combustible más importante de los transportistas urbanos de la ciudad de Juliaca. Nelva trabaja desde tempranas horas de la mañana y gracias al esfuerzo y dedicación que siempre puso en su actividad logró mantener sin privaciones a su familia. En esta oportunidad esta trabajadora madre de 53 años sigue teniendo suficientes fuerzas para continuar luchando por los suyos, recurriendo a solicitar un préstamo por el monto de 600 soles, dinero que invertirá en su negocio.

loans.use: Increase business capital

loans.name: Fatma's Shukrani Group

texts.en:
Fatma is married, and has 2 children, ages 10 and 14. She became a fish seller in 2000. Everyday, she works from 10am to 6pm at her business, and earns a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Fatma is now requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who all have businesses dealing with various food sales.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou S. est une veuve, mère de 10 enfants. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour prendre en charge la scolarité de ses enfants puisqu’en tant que veuve elle devient le seul soutien de la famille. Elle veut renforcer son commerce de nététou (graine d’un arbre transformée en produit alimentaire local). Elle va faire dans cette activité donc et en même temps  acheter et vendre de la pate d’arachide. <b>Elle va rembourser ce prêt en une seule échéance au bout de six mois<b/>.
texts.en:
Fatou S. is a widow and the mother of 10 children. She is requesting this loan to take care of her children's education because as a widow she became the sole provider for the family. She wants to bolster her business of netetou (seed pods of nere, a leguminous shrub, transformed into a local food product by cooking and fermenting). She will practice this activity and at the same time will purchase and re-sale peanut paste. She will reimburse this loan in one single sum at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Prépation et vente de nététou (graine d'un arbre transformée en produit alimentaire local)

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel tiene 18 años. Ella actualmente estudia con miras a ingresar a la universidad. 
En su tiempo libre ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y a la preparación de bombones de chocolate.

Para mantener su negocio, Raquel necesariamente tiene que vender sus productos a crédito, lo cual hace muy lento el crecimiento de su negocio y algunas veces hasta le provoca deudas.

El último crédito que recibió Raquel lo empleó en su negocio de venta de productos de belleza, así mismo ella cuenta que le gustaría ampliar su negocio, para lo cual necesita un capital mayor para trabajar.
texts.en:
Raquel is 18 years old. Currently, she is studying for her college entrance exams. In her spare time, she sells beauty products and prepares chocolates. To maintain her business, Raquel needs to sell her products on credit, which slows business growth and occasionally leads to debts. Raquel used the last credit that she received toward her beauty products business. She would like to expand her business, but requires a greater financial investment to do so.


Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her stock of beauty products.

loans.name: Julia Yamileth

texts.es:
Julia S. es una dama muy esforzada y con la responsabilidad de mantener su núcleo familiar compuesto por sus dos pequeños hijos en edades escolares. Ella se ha dedicado al negocio de pulpería desde hace cuatro años y es importante destacar que desde que comenzó con esta actividad la ha venido desarrollando cada día más.

Este logro se lo debe a Ceprodel por lo que la ha beneficiado con créditos que le han permitido salir adelante en su negocio ya que por medio de los créditos ha comprado los productos de su pulpería. La razón por la cual una vez mas acude a Ceprodel es para obtener el crédito con el cual comprar productos para ofrecerlos a sus fieles clientes que tanto la visitan.
texts.en:
Julia S. is a hard-working woman and has the responsibility of maintaining her family of two small, school-aged children. Since 4 years ago, Julia has owned a local store, and since the beginning has developed her business bit by bit. This accomplishment Julia owes to Ceprodel for the loans that it has given her. They have permitted her to have success in her business, as she used the loans to purchase goods for her store. The reason that Julia yet again is requesting a loan is to purchase products to offer to her loyal clients that frequent her store.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and grains for local store

loans.name: Dasolatu

texts.en: Dasolatu lives in Igbelerin, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells kitchen utensils and baby clothes. Dasolatu is 40 years old and married with two children. Dasolatu has been in this business for 1 year. She would like a loan of N100, 000 ($850 USD) to purchase more kitchen utensils and baby clothes for her shop. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more kitchen utensils and baby clothes to sell

loans.name: Mabe

texts.en:
“It hurts me so bad every time I have to say 'No' to my children when they ask me to buy something because I have nothing to give,” says Mabe V., 35-year-old mother from San Roque, Zamboanga City. With her husband's income from driving a family-owned "tricycle", they could hardly meet all their needs. “I still need to look for ways to augment our family income,” she added.

Because she aspires to a good life for her children, she went into retail business. She runs her store alone and tries to help her husband earn a living for their family. She is requesting a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI to purchase additional items to sell in her store.

“I just want to expand my business slowly. With my loan, I have an edge compared to my competitors,” she said. “Now, I have easy access to credit assistance, training, and the insurance coverage CEVI offers,” she added.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell in her store

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly is a member of the Las Entusiastas (“The Enthusiasts”) Village Bank. She is 46 years old, separated, and has four children. Nelly has a workshop in which she makes different kinds of fireworks (like “castles” and “bombardments”) by special order. Two of her children help her make the fireworks. Nelly also has a small store in her home, where she sells dry goods. Nelly needs a loan of 2000 Peruvian soles to buy rice, sugar and milk. Nelly dreams of improving her businesses and of buying a car.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar and milk

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Con treinta y cinco años cumplidos Efraín es una persona que ha hecho mucho en su vida y aún tiene mucho más por hacer. Padre de dos hijos aún menores y casado hace diez años aproximadamente, Efraín siempre ha velado por el bienestar de su familia.

Hace más de quince años, Efraín y su hermana estudiaron un curso de confección de tejidos gracias a un programa del estado denominado PROJOVEN. Con sus conocimientos sobre la confección de ropa hoy junto con su hermana maneja un pequeño negocio textil. Hace cuatro años produce ropa para venderlas en diferentes mercados y por la temporada de invierno especialmente.

Por otro lado, Efraín también se desempeña como maestro de obra contratista encargándose de la construcción de obras civiles, teniendo bajo su cargo personas trabajando para él. Por lo mismo, y con el único fin de progresar hace un año inicio sus estudios universitarios en la carrera de Ingeniería civil, carrera que estudia en las noches, en el poco tiempo libre que le resta. Al finalizar sus estudios tiene planes de formar su empresa de construcción.

Por si fuera poco, junto con su esposa ha iniciado un nuevo proyecto. Hace dos meses por la temporada de verano se animaron a producir y vender al por mayor un tipo de helado llamado “zambito”. Con el cual tiene muchos planes para poder mejorar la distribución y aumentar el número de producción.
texts.en:
At 35 years old Efraín is a person who has done a lot in his life but still has a lot left to do. He is the father of two young children and has been married for approximately ten years. Efraín has always seen to the well being of his family. More than fifteen years ago Efraín and his sister took a course on textile manufacturing thanks to a state program called PROJOVEN. Using their knowledge of clothes manufacturing, Efraín and his sister operate a small textile business. For four years they have produced clothes to sell in different markets, specializing in winter clothing. In addition, Efraín works as a contractor for civil construction projects, managing a group of people who work under him. At the same time, in order to get ahead, he started taking classes at a university one year ago and is studying to be a civil engineer. He conducts his studies at night, in the little free time he has. Once he finishes his studies he plans to start a construction business. As if this wasn't enough, he and his wife have started a new project. Two months ago they decided start a business for the summer months in which they would produce and sell at wholesale a type of ice cream called "zambito". They have many plans of how they can improve distribution and increase the production numbers.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raw materials and tools for a new ice cream business

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.ru: Тахмина - девушка 20 лет не замужняя. Она молодая и уже опытная в своем деле. Тахмина предоставляет услуги парикмахера в городе Вахдат. Она является профессиональным дамским мастером в салоне «Ситора» и делает стрижку, прическу, укладку, завивку, а также красить по желанию клиента  течение восьми лет. Она хочет получить займ в сумме 1000 на шесть месяцев и купить сушилку.
texts.en:
Tahmina is 20 year old and single. Despite her young age, she is an experienced hairdresser. For the past eight years she has worked for a beauty salon Sitora in Vakhdat. Tahmina is applying for a loan of 1000 in order to buy a professional hair dryer for her salon.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a professional hair dryer for her beauty salon

loans.name: Hum

texts.en: Hum Y. is 37 years old and has a business selling grocery products. She is able to make US$ 7 every day. She is a widow who resides with her school-aged child. She is asking for a loan to expand her grocery store by adding more items to meet her clients demands.

loans.use: Expand grocery store inventory

loans.name: Doussou

texts.fr:
Madame Doussou D. a 54 ans et réside avec son époux et leurs six  enfants à KaboÏla II, le centre ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle s’est initiée à l’activité de teinture et de vente de bazins qu’elle a appris auprès d’une camarade il y a plus de six ans. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes pour la qualité de ses produits. Vu l’emplacement de sa boutique située au bord d’une des artères principales de la ville de Sikasso, elle reçoit beaucoup de   clients. Elle expédie souvent ses bazins teintés à Abidjan (république de Côte d’Ivoire) sur commande.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer au programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et  est à son premier prêt individuel.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 8 pièces de bazins blancs, 10 boîtes de teintures de couleurs différentes, 10 paquets de soudes caustiques et 10 complets de tissus  pour homme, 5 pièces de tissus léger, 10 boîtes de pommade, etc. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako ensuite elle les revend  dans sa boutique non loin de  la gare routière de Sikasso.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Doussou D., age 54, resides with her husband and their six children in KaboÏla II, the downtown of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having lacked the chance to advance in school due to societal reasons, she got started in the business of dyed damask fabrics and their sales. She learned how to do this from a friend over ten years ago. She is in high demand by her customers, who are composed essentially of women, for the quality of her products.

Given the location of her shop, found along one of the main arteries of the city of Sikasso, she receives many customers. She also ships her dyed damask to Abidjan (capital of the Cote d’Ivoire) by special order.

Wanting to do better in satisfying her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on her first individual loan.

With this loan, she plans to buy eight bolts of white damask, ten containers of dye of different colors, ten packets of caustic soda, ten cloth suits for men, five bolts of light-weight cloth, ten containers of ointment, etc. She supplies herself in Bamako and then resells the goods in her shop, not far from the Sikasso bus station.

She envisions realizing a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to augment her working capital, to help cover family expenses, to make loan interest payments, and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy damask fabrics, caustic soda, dyes, light-weight cloth, men’s fabrics, ointments, etc.

loans.name: Tojiniso

texts.ru:
Точинисо женщина - косметолог в городе Худжанде, которая имеет большой опыт по предоставлению косметологических услуг.Она каждый свой займ использует для увеличения своего бизнеса , продажи различных парфюмерных средств.У неё имеется витрина , где она рекламирует продукцию парфюмерных товаров.
 Точинисо начале имела возможность только предоставление услуг косметолога, а на сегодня она уже стала иметь дополнительный доход с реализации парфюмерной продукции.
texts.en:
Tojiniso lives in Khujand. She is an experienced cosmetologist. Tojiniso took her earlier loans to expand her cosmetology salon business. With the money she borrowed, Tojiniso added a product display in the window of her salon. Today, Tojiniso earns additional income by selling perfumes and cosmetics in addition to providing cosmetology services.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase store inventory (cosmetics)

loans.name: Safina

texts.en: Safina K. is a very hardworking businesswoman. She is fifty years old and married with six children, all of them working. She has a poultry business of her own, raising over 250 chickens. She is requesting a loan to purchase more chickens and chicken feed to expand her business to fulfill customer demands. Her dream is to maximize her poultry business.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita B. is a 55-year-old entrepreneur who runs a business buying and selling slippers. She is a resident of Barangay Malibabag over Peñablanca, Cagayan. She wasn’t able to pursue her studies because of their family’s poor living conditions. When she got married she and her husband decided to invest their little capital into her current business. Aside from slippers, Charlita also sells bags, wallets, and purses to generate income daily.

With her desire to expand the business, she has decided to request a loan of PHP 6,000. She wishes to utilize the loan wisely so that her business can grow and expand. She hopes to use any extra income to support their children’s education and also hopes to employ others in her business someday.

“With God’s help, we were able to fight the challenges of life and now we can already, at least, sustain the needs of our family with the minimal income of our shop,” ended Charlita.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Erdenebat

texts.en:
Erdenebat B. is a 29-year-old married father of two sons. His family lives in a 'ger' (nomadic housing tent) district in Uvurhangay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. He works as a security guard for a small local company. As his salary is not enough to feed his family, he also runs a retail business making furniture.

In 2007, Erdenebat started renting a room to run his furniture-making business. He makes a variety of wooden furniture for gers, such as chairs, tables and beds. Ger furniture is a bit smaller than house furniture. Most of his customers are local residents who live in the ger district. Erdenebat purchases planks at wholesale prices and dries them for 15 to 30 days, depending on how sunny it is. He says, "My dream is to open a big furniture factory in the future." With this loan, he will buy planks and boards for his business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for his business

loans.name: Nusrat Ramzan Group

texts.en:
Nusrat baji is married to Mr. R., who runs a wheat selling business. He buys wheat wholesale and sells it to his customers. He has been in this business for the last 5 years, and earns a good profit from it. Nusrat baji helps him by packing the wheat in sacks. She is applying for a loan to buy wheat to increase the profit of her husband’s wheat selling business.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Farida baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Shaheen baji wants a loan to buy electric supplies (wires, switches, and switch boards) for her business selling electrical supplies. Faryad baji wants a loan to buy leather to sell. Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Nusrat baji is seated in the center of the group.

loans.use: To buy wheat to sell

loans.name: Candelaria Lissette

texts.es: Candelaria Lissette T. S. de 25 años de edad reside en el departamento de La Libertad junto a sus padres, hermana y dos hijas Johana de 11 años y Yadira de 4 años de edad.
