Hace un año Candelaria se ve en la necesidad de poner un negocio ya que por su nivel de educación se le hace muy difícil conseguir un trabajo con un buen salario y es cuando a Candelaria se le ocurrió la idea de poner una tienda, al observar que no hay ninguna en la zona vio que sería un buen negocio, y efectivamente es así Candelaria ha tenido buena aceptación por sus vecinos ya que posee excelente ventas ; es por eso que ahora está dispuesta a invertir en su negocio para lo cual necesita de un crédito ya que desea surtir su negocio para seguir aprovechando lo bien que le va en su tienda.
texts.en:
Candelaria Lissette T. S. is 25 years old and lives in the department of La Libertad together with her parents, her sister and her two daughters, Johana aged 11 and Yadira aged 4.

A year ago, Candelaria understood that she needed her own store, as she had great difficulties to get a job with a good salary due to her education level. She realized that there was no other store in her area, and indeed she was well accepted by her neighbors who ensured her an excellent turnover. Today, Candelaria is ready to invest more in her store. That’s why she needs a loan to increase her inventory and take advantage of her continued success.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her store

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a fish vendor in the rural village of Cebu, San Isidro, Isabela. She is married and is very diligent in her business in order to assist her husband in providing the needs of their children.

With her desire to make her business grow, she is now asking to borrow PHP 5,000 that she can use for her vending business. She usually purchase her products in Ramon, Isabela at a wholesale price and sells them at a retail price in the village.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
En el  mercado central del departamento de León la señora Martha E. vende refrescos a la intemperie con el propósito de llevar el bienestar a su casa de habitación. También vende reposterías en conjunto con los refrescos y es muy visitada por los clientes en su establecimiento.

Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las frutas para elaborar dichos refrescos y para la compra de las reposterías. Espera en que Ceprodel le brindará el crédito y así saldrá adelante en su actividad con miras a obtener un lugar estable y no a la intemperie.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima para elaborar refrescos

loans.name: Mark Lester

texts.en:
Mark Lester is 20 years old and already married to Miracmelie. They are both striving hard to make their marriage successful and have a better life.  They live in Barangay La Paz, Cabatuan, Isabela, a rural and plain area located near the Catholic church and their Barangay Health Center unit. The young couple is blessed with a two-year-old daughter named Haycee Crismacion.

Mark has operated and managed a small bakeshop in front of their house for almost four years. His weekly income of PHP 3,500 is already of big use in the maintenance of his bakeshop. He is now borrowing business capital of PHP 20,000 from Kiva lenders for the continuous growth of his business.

Mark also plans to have a bigger venue where he can hire out-of-school youth in their village. He wishes that he can become a successful entrepreneur someday for the welfare of his family.

Mark is a very hardworking and responsible father, despite his young age. He spends most of his time in making his business grow. He is very thankful that, even at a young age, he is blessed with his own business to provide for the growing needs of his children.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en: Lucita T. is from the village of Binuangan. She is 52 years old and is married. Lucita owns and operates a business selling dried fish and longganisa (sausages flavoured with indigenous spices) in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Lucita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Lucita is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es: Petrona C. D. M.  D. 59 años D. edad resiD. en Tejutla municipio del departamento D. Chalatenango. Petrona vive con su esposo y su único hijo llamado Carlos. Petrona es una mujer con muchas responsabilidades, es la mano derecha D. su esposo ya que es el apoyo económico incondicional, ella ha instalado un tienda en su casa con la cual logra generar ingresos que son D. gran utilidad para cubrir los gastos del hogar, ella solicita D. este crédito para reinvertir en su negocio surtiéndolo D. nueva mercadería.
texts.en:
Petrona C. D. M., 59, lives in the Tejutla municipality in the Chalatenango department. She lives with her husband and her only child, Carlos. Petrona is a woman with many responsibilities. She serves as her husband’s right hand helper giving unconditional economic support. She has installed a store in her house. It has generated income, which is very useful in covering the household expenses. She is asking for this loan to reinvest in her store and stock it with new merchandise. .

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her store

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana P. will use the loan she is requesting to to start her own hog-raising business. She will use the profits from her business to supplement her husband's income as a laborer and to sustain the education of her four children, ages two to eight years old.  After her hog-raising business grows, she wishes to repair their dilapidated house to comfort her children. With her continuous access to loans through ASHI, Diana believes that some day she will realize her dreams for her children through the success of her business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and materials needed to build a pig pen.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
This is Alma Q., a 39-year-old vendor from Caloocan City. She lives with her three children, one of whom is in high school and another of whom is in grade school. Her husband, Alberto, has a business buying and selling.

Alma has been tending her hamburger stand for seven years now. She also sells fresh eggs. She is earning more than 16,000 PHP a month. Much of her profits go to meet her children’s educational needs. Alma is thankful to Kiva partner, the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative. The loans it provides help her pursue her business. She is now on her ninth loan cycle with her application for a new loan of 8,000 PHP for use as additional capital.

About CCT
The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 57 años, vive con sus 2 hijos; Juan de 29 y Franklin de 27, en su casa propia en el distrito de San Martín de Porres de la ciudad de Lima.

Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de comida, prepara pasteles y variados entremeses para posteriormente salir a venderlos. Esta es una actividad que puede realizar libremente desde su domicilio, dándose el tiempo para realizar las labores del hogar. 
Rosa se encuentra feliz con su trabajo, pues siempre le agradó la cocina y preparar este tipo de bocaditos, por lo que más que un trabajo, es un pasatiempo que le gusta realizar, además obtiene buenos ingresos, lo cual la motiva a querer expandir su negocio, y es así que para el futuro quisiera tener un snack. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, menciona que es muy responsable con su trabajo por lo que cumplirá puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de ingredientes para preparar sus bocaditos, pues comprar al por mayor le resulta más económico.
texts.en:
Rosa is 57 years old and lives with her two sons, Juan (29) and Franklin (27). Her house is located in the San Martín de Porras district in Lima.
For the past four years, she has been making and selling a variety food, pies and appetizers. She’s able to perform this business from her house, which allows her enough time to do her household duties.
Rosa is very happy with her work; she’s always liked to cook and prepare appetizers. More than a job, this is a hobby that she enjoys. It’s also good source of income, which motivates her to continue to grow her business and open her own snack bar in the future.
This is her first loan with MFP. She is very responsible with her work and she promises to make timely payments. With this loan, she will buy cooking ingredients at wholesale to lower her food preparation cost.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Naqra Hama Group

texts.en:
This is the Naqra Hama group. This group is made up of three members.

Hama is the group leader. She is about 40 years old, married and has 6 children. She wants to take a loan for her quilting business to buy necessary materials for her business.

The second member is Hamida. She wants to receive a loan for her tailoring business. With the loan she can grow her business and buy a new (sewing) machine for her business. 

The last member of the group is N. Ahmad. He wants to take a loan for his business selling mobile phones in his shop. With the loan he wants to expand his business and buy the required materials for his shop.

Together, they have requested a group loan of 30000 AFN to change the status of their businesses and their lives. They would like to commend this effective process.

loans.use: expand and progress for their business

loans.name: Badamsuren

texts.en: Badamsuren is 27 years old and lives with his parents and siblings in Khovd province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a traditional Mongolian housing tent called a "ger". His mother has a monthly pension of 81,000 tugrugs (~560 USD). Because of his low income, Badamsuren is operating a transportation service in order to help with the family's living expenses. He transports baggage and luggage to and from the countryside to the center of the province. Besides transportation he also sells coal and firewood by using his truck. Badamsuren started his business in 2006 after buying a big truck of his own. He has found success with his business over the years and has built a reputation as a good and honest driver. Badamsuren is focused on continuing to improve his business and provide a good life for his family. He hopes to use his earnings to buy a new truck in the near future. Badamsuren is requesting a 3,300,000 tugrug (~2300 USD) loan to purchase machinery parts for his truck and some coal to sell.

loans.use: to purchase machinery parts for his truck and some coal

loans.name: Walid

texts.en: Walid has nine years of experience in the poultry business and has owned a poultry shop in his town since 2008.  He's 31 years old and single.  He helps his father with the household. Walid is requesting a loan of $1,200 US to buy additional chickens in order to increase his business productivity.

loans.use: Chickens for poultry farm

loans.name: Ana Basilia

texts.es:
La Señora Ana Basilia R. es madre de cinco hijos todos en edad escolar, tiene un tramo ubicado en el sector Madera del mercado central, su esposo le ayuda en el negocio el elabora parte de los productos que ella vende en su negocio, también ella vende piñatas que ella misma elabora.
La señora R. tiene tres años de trabajar con ceprodel ella nos comenta que le gusta trabajar con estos financiamientos ya que le ayuda bastante a surtir su negocio y a sacar adelante a sus hijos ella y su esposo son personas trabajadores luchadoras por el pan de cada día y por llevarles el sustenta a su hogar.
Viene a vender a las ocho de la mañana y lo cierra hasta que cierran el mercado diario hasta los domingos tienen un taller en su casa y ellos elaboran roperos, chineros, gaveteros sencillos. Este financiamiento ella lo solicito por que a ella le gusta trabajar con nosotros ya que le facilitamos el crédito rápido a corto plazo y con un interés bajo y necesitaba comprar una Madera que le vendían barata.
texts.en:
Ana Basilia R. is the mother of five school-age children. She has a stall located in the Madera (wood) sector of the central market. Her husband helps her with the business; he makes some of the products that she sells in her business. She also sells piñatas that she makes herself. Mrs. R. has been working with Ceprodel for three years. She tells us that she likes to work with this funding since it helps her to supply her business and to help her children move forward. She and her husband are determined people who work hard for their daily bread and work hard to support their household. She opens the stall at eight in the morning and closes it when the market closes everyday, even on Sundays. They have a workshop at home, and they make simple wardrobes, china cupboards and dressers. She requested this funding because she likes to work with us since we quickly issue her short-term credit with a low interest rate, and she needed to buy some wood that was being sold cheap.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood products (wheels, cradles, handicraft products, etc.)

loans.name: Marilyn's Group

texts.en:
Marilyn A. is from the town of Sta. Maria Echague. She is 45 years old. Marilyn is the leader of a 15-member loan group sponsored by GDMPC. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Marilyn A..

Marilyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marilyn owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Marilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Marilyn's 6th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Agazahid

texts.en:
Agazahid A. is married with four children and he has always been a hard-working man who has made sure, from his young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread.

Agazahid has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs. With a small starting capital, thanks to his perseverance and dedication, he began this enterprise four years ago. Today, Agazahid needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase the range of his goods. For this purpose he is requesting a loan of 1600 AZN. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

We believe Agazahid’s perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: purchase more foodstuff to sell

loans.name: Koreti

texts.en:
Koreti F. is 50 and married with 3 children (ages 18 - 24).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Koreti has many years of experience in this business.  Koreti needs a loan of WST $1750 to invest in expanding the business.  She plans to use the earnings from her business o improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Koreti joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Koreti's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Koreti F. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.87 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Indrani

texts.en:
Indrani P. is a 29-year-old married woman living in Akurassa with her husband and three children ages 13, 9 and 6.

Indrani has an envelope business where she sells envelopes to local customers. She has been doing this business for one year. She is honest and careful in her business and works hard. She cooperates well with others and has a positive mood. She is very enthusiastic.
 
Indrani has asked for a 20,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka in order to expand her envelope business.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To develop her envelope business

loans.name: Eliodoro Ignacia

texts.es:
El Sr Eliodoro C. es casado posee casa propia con todas comodidades de un hogar es del Barrio La Amistad Distrito Cambyreta  tiene 4 hijos mayores.
 Los hijos adultos también ayudan para los gastos a la unidad familiar porque son micro empresarios. 
El señor Eliodoro de dedica a la venta de accesorios de celulares, bijouteri, lentes, calculadoras, linternas y Solicita  un crédito de para la compra de los mismos.
texts.en:
Eliodoro C. is married and owns his own house that has all the comforts of home in the La Amistad neighborhood of Cambyreta district; he has four adult children who contribute to the household’s finances because they are micro entrepreneurs. Eliodoro sells accessories for cell phones, costume jewelry, sunglasses, calculators, flashlights, etc. He is asking for funds to buy more of the same.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cell phone accessories, sunglasses, calculators, etc.

loans.name: Oem

texts.en: Mrs. Oem P. is a modest villager living in Siem Reap Province, the province of Cambodia. She owns farmland in the village where she plants rice and vegetable crops to make an income. P. is a divorced mother who has given birth to five children who are still single. Two of her children help with the family's daily expenses by working in different jobs. One of P.'s daughters is selling grocery items out of the home. Recently, they ran out of grocery items. This is why P. would like a US$ 1000 loan. She plans to order additional grocery inventory to sell and the rest of the money will be used for cleaning up the field and growing crops.

loans.use: To order additional grocery inventory to sell

loans.name: Elenida

texts.en: Elenida D. owns and operates a retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in her community. She is 53 years old, married and has three grown-up children. She is from the village of Sta. Isabel, Dipolog City. Elenida is just starting this business. In 2005, Elenida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Elenida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from PMPC. Elenida is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell to expand her business. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Davickson

texts.en:
Davickson M. is 56 years old and married with 3 children, ages 15 to 25 years old. Two of the children are attending school.

He is a farmer from Nyamira town in Western Kenya. He has been farming for 41 years and his main product is tea, coffee, milk, beans and maize which he sells to the local market. His major challenges in farming is the unstable market for his products and lack of farming eguipment like spraying pumps.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 70,000 KES to purchase and feed a dairy cow. This loan will help him acquire a dairy cow that will produce enough milk for sale and improve the family's living standards. In future, he would like to expand his farming activities and supply more products to the market.

He hopes to get more and better breeds of cows to enhance his milk supply and sales.

loans.use: To purchase and feed a dairy cow

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 50-year-old widowed mother of five children who has struggled to see her children through school, having raised them with the income from her cereals shop.  She has operated the business for ten years but was previously employed.  Jane joined a group of women called Furaha ladies in Faulu Kenya, which has enabled her to save money on weekly basis.  Jane is requesting a loan of Kes. 40,000 to purchase an additional stock of cereals, and she hopes to grow her business into a wholesale enterprise in the future.

loans.use: To buy more cereals for sale

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie B. is from the village of Nangcaan, Rizal. She is 31 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Rosemarie owns & operates a business venture in the transportation sector operating a motorcycle.  Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,400 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosemarie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for personal purposes. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase spare parts for the unit. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rosemarie from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for the motorcycle

loans.name: Chekee Salame

texts.en: Chekee Salame A. is from the village of Poblacion, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 24 years old and is single with two infant children. Chekee Salame owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Chekee Salame joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: So

texts.en: So B. is 29 years of age and a married woman. In order to meet the needs of the family, So B. sells a little grocery inventory out of her home. She has been in this business for two years. To help contribute to the family, her husband works as a building laborer for a small firm. So B. and her husband have been married for years and they have two young children who attend school. She hopes to enlarge her business and is applying for a $500 US loan to be used to accumulate a larger number of necessary grocery items to sell.

loans.use: expanding store inventory

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin R. is from the town of Tigdok, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is 54 years old and is married with three adult children. Benjamin owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. He is just starting this business. In 2010, Benjamin joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be his first from PMPC. Benjamin plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to his house. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Carlos Ariel

texts.es: El Señor Carlos Ariel tiene 46 años es casado y tiene 1 hijo de 7 años a su cargo, el se dedica a la venta y compra  de ganado hace mas de 12 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que inicio por un hermano que le enseño este medio de vida a la cual él se hace cargo, lo que le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos consecuente mente mejorar su calidad de vida su familia, Carlos  solicita su préstamo para la compra de vacas, chivos y toros. Es una persona muy trabajadora.
texts.en:
Carlos Ariel is 46 years old, married, and has one seven year old child in his care. He has had a business selling and purchasing livestock for more than 12 years, which he started because his brother taught him this livelihood, of which he has taken responsibility. This will allow him to improve his income, consequently improving his family's quality of life. Carlos asks for his loan to buy cows, goats and bulls. He is a very hard worker.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Fischetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es:
ROSIBEL S. H.,Trabaja como Cocinera en la Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería, es acompañada y tiene dos hijos estos se encuentran en edad escolar.
el prestamo solicitado espara la compra de materiales de construccion y gastos medicos de su mama,
 ha trabajado ocho credito con ceprodel y todos estos han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
ROSIBEL S. H. is employed as a cook at the National Engineering University.  She has a life partner and two school age children.

The requested loan is to buy building materials and for her mother’s medical expenses.

She has managed 8 previous loans with Ceprodel all of which have been for home improvement.

loans.use: To buy bricks and cement to repair a wall in her house.  Will also use the money for her mother’s medical expenses.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet M. is from the village of Tinaclaan, Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years old. Janet is single. To make a living, Janet runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products, such as food for snacks, candies, shampoo, soap, eggs, salt, etc. Janet has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Janet joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Janet is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Janet from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Palomas Group

texts.es:
La  A.C. PALOMAS  inicia su ciclo Nº 1 en el Centro Focal de Cascada, sin embargo cuenta con algunas socias que ya han participado en los servicios de Pro Mujer. Es el caso de la señora presidenta la señora Virginia, quien comenta que ya está doce años en la institución.  Esta asociación Palomas, está compuesta por ocho integrantes, siete mujeres y un varón. 

La señora  Leonarda es una mujer madura de 52 años de edad, divorciada, madre de cuatro hijos. La señora refiere que ha participado en otras asociaciones y con el dinero su negocio ha crecido y ha podido mejorar sus condiciones de vida.  Su negocio inicio con un pequeño puesto a la puerta de su casa en el que vendía chicharrón de pollo, con el tiempo pudo adecuar un ambiente para abrir una pensión.  Además, comenta que hace unos años ella recibió un diagnóstico en el consultorio de salud en Pro Mujer, que le salvó la vida, pues puso al descubierto una enfermedad que requería una operación de emergencia.  
El crédito que ha solicitado de Bs. 2000.- será invertido en la compra de insumos para su pensión.
Con respecto a los negocios  que llevan adelante el resto de integrantes de la asociación son variados,  como: pensión, artesana de cuadros en lana,  trenzado de mantas, bordados, confección de ropa, venta de cosméticos,  compra - venta de plata y oro, venta de abarrotes.
texts.en:
The PALOMAS community bank are beginning their first loan cycle in the Cascada regional office.  However, the group contains some members who have already taken part in Pro Mujer's services.  This is the case for the president of the group, Virginia, who comments that she has been with the organization for twelve years.  The Palomas group has eight members, seven women and one man.

Leonarda is a mature lady who is 52 years old.  She is divorced and has four children.  She says that she has participated in other community banks and with the money her business has grown and she has been able to improve her living conditions.  Her business started with a small stall in the doorway of her home from where she sold deep-fried chicken.  Over time she managed to make the alterations necessary to open a guesthouse.  In addition, she comments that some years ago she received a check up in the doctor's office at Pro Mujer which saved her life since it diagnosed an illness which required an emergency operation.

The loan she has requested of 2000 bolivianos will be used to buy supplies for her guest house.  With respect to the businesses which the rest of the organization's members carry out, they are varied and include: guest house, hand-made wool pictures, making braided rugs, embroideries, dressmaking, cosmetics sales, buying and selling of silver and gold, and grocery sales.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies, rice, noodles and oil

loans.name: Edilberta

texts.en:
Edilberta B. is a married woman who lives in Barangay Lagunde, Oslob, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 1 business venture: fish vending business. Her husband Joseph B., who is 44 years old, works as a fish vendor to earn his living. They have 7 children who are 10 to 21 years old with one already working while the other 5 children are currently going to school. 

Edilberta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Edilberta has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 11th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Edilberta B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Bakary

texts.fr:
Né le 24 Mai 1982 à Sikasso, Monsieur Bakary K. est marié et père d’une fille, vivant dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Mamassooni-Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 N’ayant pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, il s’est vite initié à cette activité de coiffure des hommes et d’achat vente de matériels de coiffure  depuis maintenant 10 ans. Avec une telle expérience dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation et accueille beaucoup de commandes de matériels de salon et divers, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins fait défaut; il décida alors d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour ainsi solliciter un prêt lui permettant de mieux satisfaire ses clients.
Il est actuellement à son deuxième prêt qui lui permettra d’acheter 5 nouvelles tondeuses, 6 paires de peigne et brosses, 5 bidons d’eau de Javel, 5 bouteilles d’alcool de 90°, 10 bouteilles de pommade pour cheveux, etc. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 120 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born on May 24, 1982 in Sikasso, Mr. Bakary K. is a married father of one daughter living in a large traditional extended family in Mamassooni-Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  Not having had the chance to progress in school, Bakary soon became familiar with cutting men's hair and with the buying and selling of barber supplies.  He has been in this business for ten years now.  

With experience such as this, Bakary enjoys a good reputation and accommodates many orders for salon supplies and sundry items.  But the resources necessary for satisfying these needs is lacking.  He therefore decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to request a loan that will enable him to satisfy his customers further.

He is currently on his second loan that will enable him to buy 5 new clippers, 6 pairs of combs and brushes, 5 containers of bleach, 5 bottles of 90% alcohol, 10 bottles of hair ointment, etc.  

With this loan, he envisions making a monthly profit of 120,000 francs CFA.  He plans on using the profits to settle most of his expenses and his family expenses, as well as to pay the loan interest. He will reinvest the rest in his business.

loans.use: Buying equipment and supplies for his barbershop (clippers, hair ointment, combs, brushes, etc.)

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine N. is 47 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is single and has six children, four of whom are currently in school. Josephine has a retail shop business, which she has run for two years.         
To help expand her business, Josephine has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase beans and sugar. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Josephine hopes to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Josephine hopes to own a grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase beans and sugar for resale

loans.name: Tun

texts.en:
Tun S., 24, sells fish, earning an income of USD 2 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area that is known for Pre-Angkorian temples that were typically built before 800 AD. Her husband sells ice cream, earning an income of USD 2.5 per day. 

The family's monthly expenses include USD 66 for food, USD 5 for electricity, and USD 30 for other necessities. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for the family to use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits from her business to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner in Cambodia. S. appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family

loans.name: Baba

texts.fr:
Monsieur Baba B. est un homme marié de 60 ans qui vit dans une famille monogame  avec ses  seize enfants dans le quartier Est de la ville de Kolondièba, troisième région (Sikasso) de la République Mali. 
Pour augmenter son capital il adhère au programme crédit de  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier cycle. 
Monsieur B. a trente  ans d’expérience dans cette activité et il appartient à une ethnie d’éleveurs.
Il achète ces bœufs,  dans la ville de Kolondièba, dans les villages environnants et la frontière Ivoirienne. 
Il vend ces animaux en Côte d’Ivoire,  un pays frontalier du Mali. La vente se fait essentiellement au comptant.   
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice de 50.000FCFA par mois soit 150.000 FCFA par trimestre.
Le bénéfice  sera réinvesti  dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Baba B. is a 60-year-old married man who lives in a monogamous family with his sixteen children in the Est neighbourhood in the city of Kolondièba, third region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali.

To increase his capital he is a member of the Soro Yiriwaso loan program, with whom he is in his first cycle. Mr. B. has thirty years of experience in this activity and he belongs to an ethnic group of cattle farmers. He buys his steer in the city of Kolondièba, the surrounding villages, and the Ivory Coast border. He sells these animals in the Ivory Coast, a country bordering Mali. He sells primarily for cash. He foresees making a profit of 50.000 CFA francs per month, which is 150.000 CFA francs per trimester. The profit will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth forma parte del banco comunal “Los Alcaldes”  perteneciente a la ciudad de Valdivia. Ella tiene una rotisería y frutería en su casa, desde hace 6 años, en donde atiende ella y un sobrino. 
Con este préstamo comprará mercadería.
Vive con su esposo, quien trabaja de manera dependiente y con su hijo de 20 años, que este año comienza a estudiar en la enseñanza superior.
Su sueño es pagar los estudios de su hijo.
Ruth está muy contenta con el sistema de pago de los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza, los cuales son de forma semanal y en pequeñas cantidades, ya que le es más fácil cumplir con sus cuotas. Además agradece que no se le exigiera presentar antecedentes comerciales para entregarle el crédito.
Valdivia es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Ríos. Se destaca por tener uno de los pocos ríos navegables de Chile, el Calle Calle. Valdivia presenta, dentro de sus principales actividades económicas, la industria de la construcción naval, maderera, papelera, celulosa (Celco), cervecera y molinera. El turismo desempeña un papel importante, como también los servicios educacionales universitarios, encabezados por la Universidad Austral de Chile.
texts.en:
Ruth is a member of the "Los Alcaldes" community bank which is located in the city of Valdivia.  For the past 6 years, she has been running both a delicatessen selling roasted chickens and a fruit store from her home.  She serves in her businesses together with a nephew.

Ruth will use this loan to buy merchandise.  She lives with her husband, who works as a private employee, and her 20 year-old son who will start his higher education this year.  Ruth's dream is to be able to pay for her son's studies.

Ruth is very happy with Fondo Esperanza's loan repayment system.  Repayments are made weekly and in small quantities which makes it easier to meet them.  She is also grateful that borrowers do not have to present a commercial record in order to obtain a loan.

The city of Valvidia is located in the south of Chile, in Los Ríos region  It is known for being the home of one of the few navigable rivers in Chile, the Calle Calle.  Some of Valvidia's main economic activities are the shipbuilding industry, the lumber industry, the paper industry, the cellulose industry (Celco), the beer industry and the milling industry.  Tourism also plays an important part in the region's economy as does the university industry which is headed by the 'Universidad Austral de Chile'.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong T. N. is 31 years old.  Being a farmer, she has focused on growing rice and vegetables, and raising 200 chickens for meat. Agricultural products are used to support her family's food needs, and the sales provide an income for daily expenditures.

Regarding her participation in our credit program, she is a good cluster leader. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 9,810, 000VND to buy food and improve the chicken house.

loans.use: To buy food and improve chicken house.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is a 59-year-old widow who supports her family by operating three business ventures:   pig fattening, livestock and basket weaving. She lives in Danao City, Cebu. Gregoria joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gregoria has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 13,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000 to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs so that she can continue to save up for the future renovation of house. Gregoria is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase medicines and vaccines for pigs

loans.name: Patrick A.

texts.en: This is 46-year-old Patrick. He is married, and has two children aged 10 and 15 years. He has three additional dependents; they were street children whom he decided to help. In 2007, Patrick established his pharmacy business. He decided to start this business because after completing his studies in medicine, he saw that there were no clinics or pharmacies around. Working six days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,000,000 every month from this business. He needs a loan of Le 4,500,000 in order to purchase more drugs, first aid kits, and do some repairs to the shop. In the future, Patrick plans to further his studies in the medical field, and also to give his children a quality education. Patrick says, "God been my helper. This loan will enable me to achieve my goals." He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: This loan will be used to buy more pharmaceutical supplies for resale and to make repairs to his shop.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.es:
Ruby del Carmen O., vive en el municipio de Soledad, la tierra de las butifarras artesanales más deliciosas y antiguas  de Colombia en el departamento del Atlántico. Ruby  la muy inquieta y trabajadora  mujer,  vende de todo un poco: usted puede verla elaborando fritos, como arepas, empanadas,  carimañolas, hayacas y simultáneamente lista para viajar al departamento de Sucre, en Colombia,  con su libreta de registros y mercancías como ropa, sandalias, prendas de plata y otros accesorios para allí venderlos, y también puede verla de regreso a su casa,  con cajas de queso, aguacates y hasta diabolines (deliciosos pasabocas de queso y tostado elaborados en Sucre para venderlo en el municipio de Soledad. Todo este movimiento en su vida se lo debe a que hace 12 años tuvo una tienda y se acostumbró a realizar un gran esfuerzo  de trabajo  diario, que ahora no puede parar. Así que después de fracasar en la tienda, empezó a vender sopas en la puerta de su casa, y agregó mercancías variada para llevarla a Corozal en el departamento de Sucre, aprovechando el mercado natural  de sus familiares que allí viven y de esta misma ciudad regresa con diabolines, queso y aguacates para la venta, negocios de buen resultado y  que aún persisten.
Ruby tiene un año de estar vinculada a los programas de la  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con su crédito anterior ha logrado reemplazar los préstamos costosos, a una tasa de interés de  un 10% mensual,  por una tasa más baja y en plazos apropiados. En la actualidad solicita su segundo crédito a esta organización, para comprar ropa,  harina, queso, diabolín y aceite. Su sueño ahora es tener una casa propia y que su hijo termine la carrera de derecho, con lo que se sentiría muy realizada. 
Ruby  es una mujer muy valiente que vive con su cónyuge y 2 hijos de 24 y 25 años, ella afirma que su diario vivir es un gran desafío, pues nunca se queda quieta esperando que todo le llegue por arte de magia.
texts.en:
Ruby del Carmen O. lives in the town of Soledad, which is located in the Department of Atlántico and the home of the most delicious handmade sausages in Colombia. Ruby is a very energetic and hardworking woman. She sells a little bit of everything. Ruby can be found making fried foods such as arepas, empandas, carimañolas, hayacas, and often at the same time so that she can sell them in the Department of Sucre in Colombia. With her traveling papers in hand, she also brings with her merchandise such as clothing, sandals, silver jewelry, and other accessories to sell while she is there. When she returns home, she brings back with her boxes of cheese, avocados, and even “diabolines” (delicious toasted cheese snacks that are made in Sucre and sold in the city of Soledad). All of this activity in her life is a result of managing a store for twelve years. She became accustomed to performing a great deal of work each day and now she cannot quit. After her store closed down, she began selling soups from the doorstep of her house. She also started bringing various types of merchandise to Corozal in the Department of Sucre to take advantage of the market owned by her relatives who live there. Upon her return home, she brought back “diabolines”, cheese, and avocados to sell. These businesses generated good results and she continues to manage them.

Ruby has participated in the programs of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for one year. Her previous loan replaced other expensive loans, one with a monthly interest rate of 10%. This new loan had a lower rate and more favorable terms. At the moment, she is requesting her second loan from the organization in order to buy clothing, flour, cheese, “diabolines”, and oil. Her dream now is to have a house of her own and see her son finish his law degree, which would give her a sense of accomplishment.

Ruby is a courageous woman who lives with her husband and two children, ages 24 and 25. She says that her everyday life is a huge challenge, but it does not prevent her from hoping that everything will magically happen.

loans.use: To purchase clothing, "diabolines", oil, flour, and cheese.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy goats & sheep for animal sales business.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol es originaria de la localidad de Ocampo, ella se dedica a la venta de semillas y dulces en un local que tiene en su casa, también tiene maquinitas (juegos de video), tiene con este negocio aproximadamente 6 años y lo emprendió para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, pese a que ha tenido fuertes problemas como la muerte de sus bebe ella es muy constante en su trabajo. Dice que sus padres fueron quienes le inculcaron ser trabajadora ya que ellos son comerciantes y desde ahí ella le hecho ganas para salir adelante, Marisol esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos de abarrotes ya que quiere emprender ese negocio ella quiere comprar jabón, sopas, papel higiénico, semillas para dorar y vender, dulces, refrescos etc. dice que antes tenia su tienda de abarrotes pero que desde que falleció su bebe se deprimió y ya no pudo seguir adelante con su negocio. Ella esta muy agradecida por que le están otorgando este préstamo por que así otra vez va a poder surtir su tienda como antes y podrá tener una nueva entrada de dinero para su casa y así ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Ella esta casada con el señor José el cual es empleado y ahorita esta muy contenta por que tiene una bebe de 3 meses. Uno de sus sueños es salir adelante y darle lo mejor a su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Marisol is from the town of Ocampo.  Her business is selling seeds and sweet treats from premises located in her home.  She also has game machines.  She has been in this business for approximately six years and started her business in order to help her husband cover their household expenses.  Although she has suffered serious problems, such as the death of her baby, she is very persevering in her work.  She says that it was her parents who taught her to work hard since they are salespeople and it is from them that she got her desire to get ahead in life. 

Marisol is requesting a loan to buy groceries since she would like to start a grocery business.  She would like to buy soap, soups, toilet paper, seeds to toast and sell, sweet treats, soft drinks, etc.  She says that she used to own a grocery store but after her baby died she became depressed and couldn't continue in her business.  She is very grateful that she is being given this loan because it means she will be able to stock her store again and make a new source of income so that she can help her husband with their household expenses.

Marisol is married to José who is a private employee and right now she is very happy because she has a 3 month-old baby.  One of her dreams is to get ahead in life and provide her young daughter with the best.

loans.use: to buy groceries and seeds to sell

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie N. lives in the Makerere neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, one of whom is in school. She also takes care of her elderly parents. Sophie lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees and utility bills.

Sophie operates a restaurant. She has been in this business for three years, and she works seven days a week. She also generates additional income by selling sodas at the market. The main business challenges for Sophie include defaulters and the increasing price of food.

Sophie has requested a loan of 500,000 KES from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, sweet and Irish potatoes, and rice. Her goals for her business are to see it grow bigger and own a fully stocked restaurant.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, sweet and Irish potatoes, and rice.

loans.name: Kiyal's Group

texts.en:
Kiyal is the leader of this group. She is 28 and divorced. She is bringing up a son who is 7 and who studies at school. 

Kiyal is engaged in cultivating agricultural products. Seven years ago, with an initial investment of 10 000 KGS, she started to grow strawberries. Selling the strawberries, she earns approximately 40,000 soms during the summer season. This profit made it possible for her to purchase a fridge, a vacuum cleaner and a gas stove. These household appliances helped Kiyal to improve her living conditions. 

With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more strawberries in the local villages and then resell them in the city at the higher price. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase strawberries for resale.

loans.name: Candida

texts.es:
Cándida, tiene 69 años de edad, es madre soltera de una joven de 16 años de edad; Cándida tiene más de 10 años de dedicarse al negocio de la panadería, este pan lo elabora en su casa y sale a vender  junto a su hija de 6:00am a 10:00am, por los caseríos cercanos.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar harina, huevos y azucar además tiene el plan de iniciar el cultivo de maíz por lo que aprovechara con el préstamo a adquirir abono y fertilizantes, este crédito le ayudara a tener materiales para el negocio del pan y para iniciar el cultivo, cubriendo así dos áreas productivas de Cándida.
Los sueños de ella son crecer en el negocio, aumentando su producción y teniendo personal para que venda en la zona, también ayudar a su hija para que pueda accesar al estudio y se pueda superar.
texts.en:
Cándida is 69 years old.  She is a single mother of a 16-year-old young woman.  Cándida has been a Baker for over ten years.  She bakes the bread at home and goes out to sell it with her daughter from 6am until 10am throughout the neighboring hamlets.

She is currently asking for a loan to buy flour, eggs and sugar.  She also plans to start farming corn so will use the loan to buy manure and fertilizer.  This loan will help her have supplies for the bakery and to start her planting thus covering Cándida’s two productive areas.

Her dreams are to grow in business increasing production and having sales personnel in the zone and also to help her daughter access schooling so that she can improve herself.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs and sugar.

loans.name: Novembrita

texts.en: Novembrita is 52 years old and lives in Sepac, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. To earn a living, Novembrita has a business selling groceries. She earns about 3,500 PHP each month doing this type of work. Novembrita has a requested a loan to purchase products for her grocery store. She has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.

loans.use: to purchase products for her grocery store

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: Rubén es un padre de familia, natural de Carampa, ubicada al sur de Huancayo tiene 37 años y vive al lado de su esposa y sus 3 hijos en su propiedad. Siempre ha vivido en su tierra natal y desde su niñez sus padres le enseñaron todo lo esencial sobre como trabajar en la agricultura así como en la crianza de animales. Sin embargo siempre supo de las dificultades que existen en las tareas del campo que por condiciones climáticas pueden afectar seriamente las ganancias de la cosecha, por ello  optó en asegurarse sus ingresos con su tienda pequeña en su misma casa, su establecimiento es una de las 2 que existen en su comunidad y cada día tiene ventas regulares que le permiten tener un capital estable y ganancias más frecuentes a comparación de la agricultura que tiene que esperar varios meses en ver sus frutos. Ante esto sus proyectos de continuar es la de mejorar e implementar su tienda. Es la primera vez que esta solicitando crédito con MFP, su esposa fue la titular del crédito en ocasiones anteriores de manera grupal y decidió seguir trabajando con los préstamos grupales porque considera que es una manera efectiva de crecer en su capital e invertir de manera oportuna para su negocio. Es que por esta razón que invertirá el dinero recibido en la compra de más mercadería para su tienda.
texts.en:
Rubén is a father from Carampa located south of Huancayo.  He’s 37 years old living alongside his wife and three children in his home.  He has always lived in his native land and since childhood his parents taught him all the essentials of farming as well as livestock raising.  However, he always knew the difficulties inherent in field work because of the weather conditions that can seriously affect profits from crops.  Because of this, he opted to insure income by setting up a small store in his house.  His store is one of two that exist in his community and every day he has regular sales that allow him to have stable income and more frequent profits compared to farming where he has to wait several months to enjoy the fruits of his labor.  In light of this, his projects to continue are to improve and equip the store.

This is the first time he’s requested a loan from MFP.  Group loans were occasionally taken out by his wife previously and he decided to stick with the group loans because he considers them to be an effective way to grow his capital and invest in his business in an opportune manner.  He will use the money he received to buy more merchandise for the store.

loans.use: to buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Denie

texts.en:
Denie, aged 33, earns a living through farming. She helps her husband till their land in Surallah, South Cotabato. She has two young children aged seven and six.

Denie has been engaged in rice farming for eight years. She works hard to support her family. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seed and other farm inputs. Denie is hoping that their business will grow and that it will enable them to save for their children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seed and other farm inputs

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.es: El Sr. Kenneth trabaja en el transporte público, pertenece al sindicato mixto de Transportistas, trabaja en la línea  de taxi trufis, con una experiencia superior a 3 años en el rubro y en la misma línea. Vive en la casa de sus papás, tiene un hijo, que lo cuida su mamá, el cliente no tiene ninguna relación con la mamá de su hijo pero pasa pensión mensualmente para la manutención del niño. El crédito es para mantenimiento de su vehículo ya que esta presentando algunas fallas y esto no le permite brindar un buen servicio a los pasajeros, es un apersona muy trabajadora deseando mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hijo, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Kenneth works in public transportation. He belongs to transportation union and works for a taxi company that has fixed routes. He has three years experience in this job and with the same company.

Kenneth lives with his parents. He has a son whom his mother looks after as he no longer has any relationship with his son’s mother. However, he does provide money on a monthly basis for his son.

The loan is to pay for maintenance of his vehicle which has a few problems so he is no longer able to provide a good service to his passengers.

Kenneth is a very hardworking person who wishes to improve his standard of living as well as that of his son. He is grateful to the institution for the support it provides.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of his taxi

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 32 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.  He has been operating a welding workshop for five years.  He has employed three people to assist him in the business.  He has managed to retain his business for five years because of his good services.  David hopes to become financially stable in the future.  He has requested 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy metal bars.

loans.use: to buy metal bars

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: Verónica de 22 años es casada, tiene un hijo vive en una casa que le están prestando por tiempo indefinido, ella desde muy chica antes de casarse soñaba con tener su propio negocio no sabia lo que iba a vender pero tenia bien definido que quería ser ella misma su propio Jefe y no porque no le gustara seguir ordenes si no porque sabia que la única manera de lograr una estabilidad para ella y su familia seria teniendo su propio Negocio, Vero se dedica a la venta de artículos de segunda mano desde hace 2 años como lo son: ropa, zapatos, electrodomésticos, Juguetes y mas, ella solicita el apoyo para compra de mercancía y poder surtir su negocio para ella el ver su negocio lleno de mercancía es lo que la motiva a esforzarse mas.
texts.en: Verónica, age 22, is married and has one child. She lives in a home which they are renting for an indefinite period. Before getting married, as a young girl, she dreamed of having her own business. She didn't know what she would sell, but she knew very well that she wanted to be her own boss because she didn't like taking orders and she knew that having her own business was the only way to achieve stability for herself and her family. Vero has sold second-hand items such as clothing, shoes, home electronics, toys and more for two years. She is requesting support for purchasing merchandise in order to be able to stock her business. She wants to see her business full of merchandise, and this motivates her to work harder.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es: María Magdalena reside en casa propia junto en zona semi urbana, junto a ella vive su hijo el cual ya es mayor de edad. Ella se dedica a realizar filmaciones o grabaciones de video a eventos como: bodas, graduaciones, cumpleaños, etc. Esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante en los diferentes lugares cerca de la zona donde ella habita, como iglesias, escuelas y colegios, universidades, parques, centros comerciales, entre otros mas. Es una mujer muy creativa pero sobre todo con mucha iniciativa. Para ella no hay obstáculos a la hora de filmar. María cuenta con buenas referencias personales, muchas personas en la zona le tienen confianza y aprecian su trabajo, por ello la buscan. María ha decidido hacer este préstamo a INTEGRAL para comprar nueva cámara y accesorios de filmación ya que estas son  sus herramientas principales a la hora de realizar su trabajo y con los que cuentan ya no funcionan bien, ella comenta que siempre es bueno prevenir y estar lista antes que surja un evento porque para ella todos son importantes. Confía en Dios que de esta manera logrará mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
María Magdalena and her grown son live in their own home in a semi-urban area. She produces films and video recordings of special events such as weddings, graduations, birthdays, and other occasions. María conducts her business by traveling to different places near the neighborhood where she lives such as churches, elementary schools, high schools, universities, parks, businesses, and other sites. She is a very creative woman, but above all she demonstrates a great deal of initiative. For her, there are no obstacles that could hinder her when it is time to film. María has good personal references since there are many people from the area who express their trust and appreciation for her work, which is why her services are in demand.

María decided to request a loan from Apoyo Integral in order to buy a new camera and film accessories, since these are the main pieces of equipment that she uses in her work. She would not be able to function without them. María says that it is always good to be prepared and ready for any event because all of them are important. She trusts God that she will be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a video camera and film accessories.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Aida has a food cart selling home-made ice cream in different  flavors. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making home-made ice cream.

Aida is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Aida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making home-made ice cream.

loans.name: Annie Berthe

texts.fr:
Cliente de 39 ans, celibataire avec 2 enfants a sa charge, a l'arret de ses etudes secondaires, elle se lance en 2000 a la vente des layettes.Ayant deja beneficiee de trois cycle de prets a Hope, elle gere une activite tres rentable qui lui permet de rembourser sans probleme et faire des enormes epargnes.
Avec le nouveau pret elle va s'approvisionner a Kinshasa acheter de la layette pour nouveaux nes, comme des ensemble des tricots, barboteuses, couvertures, des series de draps, couvertures.
Elle vend en moyenne 15000 frs a 60000 frs, elle a rembourse sans probleme et a fait des epargnes considerables.
Elle est tres dynamique comme mere , elle s'occupe de ses enfants et de leurs scolarites.A la longue elle est entrain de se battre pour etre faire la vente en gros de la layette.
texts.en:
Annie is 39 years old, single, with two children in her care. Upon stopping her secondary education in 2000, she began selling baby clothing and supplies. Having already benefited from three loan cycles with HOPE, she runs a very profitable business that allows her to repay with no trouble and to put aside tremendous savings.

With the new loan, she will go to Kinshasa to stock up on baby supplies for newborns, such as knitted outfits, rompers, blankets and sets of bedsheets.

She sells on average 15,000 to 60,000 francs worth of goods; she has repaid [her past loans] with no problem and has set aside considerable savings.

She is a very energetic mother, taking care of her children and their schooling. For the long-term, she is in the midst of a struggle to become a wholesaler of baby supplies.

loans.use: to purchase dozens of diapers, baby jackets, knitted goods, blankets, bedsheets and clothespins.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman and has one child who is enrolled in school. Her husband works as a fishmonger. Rose operates a general store and has worked in this business for 4 years. Her primary customers are neighbors and passerby. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. She describes her greatest business challenge to be theft and her largest monthly expense is food. 

Rose will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase sugar, detergent, flour, salt and other supplies. Rose aspires to be the leading supplier in her village in the future. She joined Yehu because of their efficient loan products.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, detergent, flour, salt and other supplies.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Lucia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan for 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and rice.

Lucia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lucia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and rice.

loans.name: El Eden Group

texts.es: Un grupo con mucho en común que es el entusiasmo por surgir en los negocios propios, así es el Edén una alcancía comunal con características D. éxito. Conformado por 8 socias hace más D. 2 años. Cada integrante se dedica a diversos comercios, tal es así el caso D. la señora Juana integrante D. dicha alcancía, la señora Juana  con 38 años D. edad madre D. dos hijos que aun dependen D. ella, vio la forma D. surgir económicamente con la venta D. comida por las mañanas, también con el apoyo D. ventas D. verduras y D. juguetes. Lleva más D. 12 años dedicándose con esmero a este oficio el cual le ha dado muchas satisfacciones  para ella y su familia. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en la compra D. juguetes para la campaña naviD.ña ya que se acerca  pronto. Como la señora  Juana  el resto D. los integrantes tiene una historia en particular que contar, pero todas coinciden en el esmero y el desempeño que realizan cada día por el bienestar D. sus familias.
texts.en:
This group has a lot in common, including enthusiasm for moving ahead with their own businesses.  The communal bank is called "El Edén", and is characterized by success.  It was started by 8 members, two years ago.  The members work in various businesses.

For example, Señora Juana S. is a member of this communal bank.  Señora Juana is 38 years old, and is the mother of two children who are still financially dependent.  She saw a way of progressing financially through selling food in the mornings, and also is helped by selling vegetables and toys.  She has been working in this field with great attention for more than twelve years, and it has given her and her family much satisfaction.

With her recent loan, she will invest in purchasing toys for the upcoming Christmas season.

Like Señora Juana, the rest of the members each have their own story, but they all share the same level of care and accomplishment that they undertake each day for the well-being of their families.

loans.use: to buy toys for the upcoming Christmas season

loans.name: Nueva Integración (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En el sitio Los Rosales en la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los 2 socios y las 12 socias  del Grupo De  Crédito Nueva Integración. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la agricultura, crías de animales y comercio en general. Para ellos este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y están muy contentos por pertenecer a esta linda institución y están agradecidos por la ayuda prestada.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Sonia, tiene 36 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 19, 16, 14 y 10 años de edad los tres menores  estudian en colegio y  escuela. El marido es obrero municipal.
 
Ella para obtener sus propios recursos y con estos ayudar en el hogar se dedica a realizar quehaceres domésticos en una casa en el centro de la ciudad, pero ademas de esto también se dedica al comercio en lo que es venta de productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días y sus ventas las realiza en sus momentos y días libres, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Tiene dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han brindado en este tiempo.

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo’s Los Rosales site the two male and 12 female members of the “Nueva Integración” communal bank meet every two weeks.  They carry out a variety of activities like farming, animal husbandry and commerce in general.  For them, this is their second cycle in the communal bank and they are very happy to belong to this lovely institution and are grateful for the help provided.

One of the group members is Sonia, 36.  She’s in a common law relationship and has four children who are 19, 16, 14 and 10 years old.  The three youngest go to elementary school and secondary school.  Her husband’s a municipal employee.

To earn her own resources to help the household she works as a domestic employee in a house downtown but she’s also a merchant; she sell Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women’s accessories).  She works every day selling in her free time and on her days off.  She sells on credit and collects weekly.  She’s been in business two years and does very well.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and costume jewelry.  This is the second cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because of the help they’ve given her along this time.  Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.en:
Dionicio's primary source of income comes from rice farming. He is 56 years of age and yet still single. He is living with his parents. Dionicio aims for better yields and larger profit with every crop. He grows rice crops on his one-hectare rice field.

Dionicio would like to provide his parents needs, so he devotes his time to cultivating his rice field to increase his yields. He is glad because he has spent the last 20 years maintaining his farm and he is able to support his parents. Now that his parents are weak, he needs additional capital because of his expenses for their medicines.

Dionicio decided to avail himself of a loan of 30,000 PHP, allowing him to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicides and insecticides which will be use towards the growth of his rice fields. He is hoping that his plans will be fulfilled.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicides and insecticides which will be used towards the growth of his rice fields

loans.name: Roy Angel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Roy Angel; el tiene 29 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de juguetes como muñecas, carros entre otros juguetes, el socio junto con su esposa trabajan este negocio y también el socio  se dedica al negocio de transporte, el hace servicio de taxi en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de juguetería y mejorar en el negocio de servicio de taxi. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar juguetes y también el mantenimiento de su carro como comprar repuestos.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
