Sr. Roy Angel is a member of the Patron Santiago de Santiago Community Bank located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of the same name. He is 29 years old, married, and has two children. As well as the usual daily activities, he and his wife run a business selling toys such as dolls and cars. Roy is also a taxi driver in the streets of Cusco.

His dream is to expand the toy business and improve his taxi service. He is seeking a loan to buy toys and also to buy spare parts so he can maintain his vehicle.

Roy is happy to have the opportunity to obtain a loan and promises to repay it.

loans.use: to buy toys and also to buy spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Aba  Efua

texts.en: For the past 12 years Aba Efua has been cooking "banku" (dumplings) that she serves with hot pepper sauce and fried fish at Ayinase near Elmina. She is a widow taking care of 4 children who are currently in school. She hopes to expand her banku business and so needs a loan to buy maize, pepper, tomatoes, cassava dough and fire wood to make her food production easier. Her future plan is to build a better place to host her customers.

loans.use: to buy maize, pepper, tomatoes, cassava dough and firewood to make her food production easier

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es de la ciudad de Encarnación, surgió por contactos de una de las integrantes en la zona con la asesora de la fundación, quien luego de saber como trabajaba el programa decidió animar a sus amigas y vecinas. actualmente el grupo se encuentra en el ciclo numero 18, opera con la Fundación desde el año 2006.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Alicia, quien es casada, tiene 2 hijos. Ella nos cuenta que tiene una pequeña despensa en su casa, y su marido se dedica a la venta de gas y también realizan alquileres para eventos infantiles. Ambos se ayudan para poder sacar adelante a la familia. Alicia comenta que le va muy bien en las ventas y es por ello que solicita el crédito, para poder abastecer su negocio y de esa forma darle más variedad a la despensa, para poder seguir con las ganancias.
Ella desea comprar comestibles, bebidas, lácteos, panificados y demás. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por esta oportunidad de progreso que les da.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of Encarnación and came about because of contacts one of the members in the area had with the foundation's loan officer who, after learning how the program worked, decided to encourage her friends and neighbors. Currently the group is in its 18th loan cycle and has been working with the Foundation since the year 2006. 

One of the group's members is Ms. Alicia who is married with two children. She tells us she has a small grocery store in her home, and her husband earns a living selling natural gas, and they also provide rental services for children's events. They both help each other get the family ahead. Alicia comments that she is doing very well with her sales and so she is requesting the loan, so she may stock her business, giving it more variety in order to continue bringing in income. 

She wishes to purchase grocery items, drinks, dairy products, bakery items and other things. She appreciates the foundation and Kiva for this opportunity for progress they are being given.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, drinks, dairy products, bakery products and other items.

loans.name: Nonvigbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVIGBE est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans la même localité. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Nicole Lydie Adjoua est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Nicole Lydie Adjoua est âgée de 38 ans et vit au Bénin. Nicole Lydie Adjoua est mariée à une certain Euloge. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Nicole Lydie Adjoua vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison son supportées par le couple. Nicole Lydie Adjoua a arrêté l'école jusqu'au secondaire. Pour ce faire, Nicole Lydie Adjoua vend des produits congelés dans sa région depuis douze ans ;  ce qui lui permet de subvenir au besoin de sa famille. Nicole Lydie Adjoua s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Nicole Lydie Adjoua sollicite un premier crédit ensemble avec les membres du groupe NONVIGBE.

loans.use: Acheter des produits congelés.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Mrs. Judith E., a LAPO Client of distinguished features, cherishes talking about LAPO loan and the poor in Nigeria. Especially the impact of LAPO loan in her life and family for the past 8 years, she bent on loyalty to LAPO and ensure her repayment is 100%. She request for the above amount to increase her goods.

loans.use:
To buy more plastics for sale (plates, cups, 
Basins, coolers, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her snacks business

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a young woman with big aspirations. She's the youngest of three siblings. Her parents are retired. The need to earn an income that would allow her to cover her expenses and those of her parents motivated her to save enough money from previous jobs so that she could open her own business selling clothes, shoes, and accessories. She started her business two years ago and it has been well received by her clients; with sales growing continuously.

Margarita wants to continue to grow her business and is asking for a loan of $250, which she will use to purchase merchandise to improve the variety of products that she carries and continue to be a favorite among her clients. You can be an important part of the growth of this business and help Margarita fulfill her dream.

Translated from Spanish by Lighthouse Translations, Kiva Volunteer

Margarita es una joven con grandes deseos de superación, ella es la menor de tres hermanos, sus padres son jubilados y la necesidad de obtener un ingreso que le permitiera cubrir los gastos propios y los de sus padres, la motivaron a ahorrar de sus anteriores trabajos para poder iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de ropa, calzado y accesorios, inició su negocio hace dos años y ha tenido grande aceptación de sus clientes, incrementando cada ves mas sus ventas.

Ahora Margarita quiere continuar creciendo y solicita un préstamo por $ 250 dólares que empleara en la compra de mercancía para incrementar la variedad de sus productos y conservar la preferencia de sus clientes. Tú puedes ser pieza fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a Margarita a cumplir su sueño.

loans.use:
To purchase inventory

Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Marilin

texts.es:
Marili lives with her two children, ages 4 and 6. Like many Bolivian women, she lives away from her husband, who left to work in another state in Bolivia (Santa Cruz) leaving her act as both father an mother to her two small children, while working to support them. She is a hand-weaver, and she creates Mantas, traditional woman’s dresses, worn by the indigenous women of in the area. These are sold retail in the popular fairs in the city of El Alto. Marillin lives in a house with her parents on J.J. Perez street in the Villa Ingenio zone of El Alto. This loan will be used to purchase raw materials (wool). It is her second loan with Impro, and her good payment history has qualified her for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Marilin vive con sus dos hijo de 4 y 6 años; como muchas mujeres bolivianas vive alejada de su esposo que se fue a trabajar a otro departamento de Bolivia (Santa Cruz) y ella asume la responsabilidad de padre y madre de sus dos pequeños hijos y trabaja para la manutención de los mismos. Ella es tejedora a mano, realiza mantas para cholitas paceñas y las comercializa por detalle en las ferias populares de la Ciudad de El Alto. Marilin vive en la casa de sus padres en la calle J.J. Pérez de la zona Villa Ingenio de El Alto. El crédito lo destinara para comprar materia prima (lana). Es el segundo crédito con Impro y los buenos antecedentes de pago del primer crédito le facultan acceder a otro préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of wool

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Mrs. Francisca M. lives with her husband and two children ages 13 and 15 in her own house, located in the Tupac Amaru area, on the east hillside of the city of La Paz. Mrs. Francisca sells vegetables on the street and her husband works for a construction company. Using previous credits (four loans that have been paid in full), they built two rooms and steps for accessing their home. However, the housing project hasn’t been concluded. The requested loan will be used for building the cement foundation and a slab on the second floor, for the construction of two rooms in the future. This is the fifth time that they have applied for a loan, and their socioeconomic analysis qualifies them favorably for new credit.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Francisca M. vive en casa propia en la zona de Tupac Amaru ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 15 y 13 años de edad; la señora Francisca se dedica a la venta de verduras en vía publica y el esposo es empleado en una empresa constructora. Actualmente con créditos anteriores (cuatro creditos que a la fecha han sido completamente cancelados) realizaron la construcción de dos habitaciones y gradas de acceso en su vivienda, pero el proyecto de vivienda se encuentra inconcluso. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de una losa de cemento y enferradura en segunda planta, para la posterior construcción de dos habitaciones. Esta es la quinta vez que solicitan un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Building a cement foundation and a slab

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa, a 35-year-old mother of three, lives in the Vituka area in the city of Dar es Salaam. She sells both used and new clothes in the Vituka trading center. She also operates a restaurant alongside the shop. She received training in business and entrepreneurship from the Youth Self Employment Foundation, which has helped her expand her business.

Hawa requests a loan of $750 to purchase new and used clothing to sell in her shop.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther A. is 52 years old, married with 5 children; she comes from Afromedia in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells provisions, eggs, drinks and foodstuffs. She has been in her business some years and needs a loan to enable her buy more items to stock her store shelves.

loans.use: To buy more store provisions such as eggs, drinks & food

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en: Rasim is 44-year-old trader who sells men's clothes in the local Sabirabad bazaar. He started his business in 2002 after he borrowed money from his friends. Rasim has loyal customers because he always offers discounts and his goods sells very quickly.  Now Rasim would like to expand his business and start selling women's clothes along  with the mens clothes. He requests a loan of 1100 USD to purchase his first consignment of women's clothes.

loans.use: To purchase the first consignment of women's clothing

loans.name: Lilis

texts.en: Lilis, 35, mother of 2 children,  has a small grocery shop at her house, earning about $10 a day, while her husband, B., works at a construction site and earns very little. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of $75 to add to her business capital. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital for her little grocery store

loans.name: Norma Lidia

texts.es:
Norma C. 38-year-old resident of Ticuantepe who has been working the land for 16 years. Her husband is a security guard, which means they have a steady monthly income. They have one son, their pride and joy, who is currently in elementary school and learning the best life lessons from his parents. Their biggest source of income is the fruit of their labor; they grow pineapples and granadia fruit. She is proud of the quality of her crops and of her knowledge. While waiting for the best moment of production, she is requesting a loan in order to maintain her crops, holding off on the harvest until the market indicates that it is the best time to yield the biggest profits. Her dream is to acquire more land and produce more crops in the future because the land that she loves and has been a part of her life has allowed her to move her family forward.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Norma C., es mujer de sol y tierra, con 38 años habita en Ticuantepe y trabaja la tierra de sol a sol desde hace 16 años, su esposo es guarda de seguridad con lo que cuentan con un ingreso fijo mensual, tienen un solo hijo que es todo su mundo y amor el cual esta estudiando Primaria y aprendiendo a la vez las mejores lecciones de vida que sus padres le transmiten. Su mejor ingreso es el que sale del fruto de su trabajo en la tierra en la cual siembran Piña y Granadia, es una mujer orgullosa de la calidad de su producto y de sus conocimientos del mismo, esperando el mejor momento para la producción solicita un préstamo para darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de piña y detener asi la cosecha hasta que sea el momento que el mercado dicte como el adecuado para darle mejores ganancias y es entonces que carbureando la cosecha lograran incentivar la cosecha y tendrá su producto listo para la venta. Su sueño es tener mas adelante mas tierra para producir ya que de la tierra que ama y la vio nacer ha sacado adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies

loans.name: Ni Ketut Hudiani

texts.id:
Hudiani is a mother of 2. Her husband is a seasonal farm worker who does not have a permanent income. Therefore she helps to get extra income by raising piglets at the backyard of her house.

She has 7 piglets now which she feeds every 09.00 am. She can earn up to IDR 3.5 million from a 6 month period (around USD 393). She uses this money to send her children to school and to support her family daily needs.

She wants to use the loan money to buy more piglets and to build a permanent hut that she can use as cage for the piglets.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Setiap pukul 09:00 wita Hudiani memberi makan 7 ekor babi peliharaannya.Pekerjaan ini tentunya sudah menjadi rutinitas kesehariaannya. Kandang bambu yang sederhana dimiliki dibelakang rumah,sebagai tempat untuk menampung babi yang dipelihara. Usaha ini sangat membantu dalam memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Hudiani memiliki 2 orang anak yang masih menjadi tanggungan. Semangat untuk berusaha yang dimiliki membuat suaminya sangat senang karena sangat meringankan beban sebagai bapak kepala rumah tangga. Karena penghasilan suami sebagai petani yang tidak menentu. Keuntungan yang sudah dirasakan sangat memuaskan.dalam 6 bulan 7 bibit babi ini bisa menghasilkan Rp.3.500.000,- bersih. Keuntungan ini digunakan untuk biaya sekolah anaknya dan sangat menunjang kehidupannya.Untuk kedepannya Hudiani akan membuat kandang yang permanen agar babi yang dipelihara semakin banyak.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and to build hut (Membeli pakan dan membuat kandang)

loans.name: Fatma's Wema Group

texts.en:
Fatma is married with three children (ages 18, 17 and 16). She makes a living by selling food in her locality and works there beginning at seven each morning. From this business, which started a year ago, she is able to make a monthly profit of about $140.

Fatma hopes for a loan to purchase more food items in order to increase her stock. She is a member of loan group Wema and will be sharing this loan with her subgroup. The members of this loan group live in the same neighborhood and guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more food items

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
Mrs. Socorro is 47 years old and lives in the "Ayapal" neighborhood. She is single and has two children, ages 15 and 20 years old. She has three years of experience with her businesses renting rooms and selling clothing, which she began with money from microfinance loans. With this loan she will invest in a variety of merchandise to offer her customers a wide variety of products. Her plans as a business woman include extending her sales to the interior of the country, and as a mother, she hopes to teach her children the value of hard work so that they will be able to face the difficult situation in her country. She also hopes to finish setting up her home, and, most importantly, to keep her family united.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Socorro tiene 47 años de edad, habita en el barrio Ayapal, es soltera y tiene dos hijos de 15 y 20 años de edad. El negocio es alquiler de cuarto y venta de prendas, tiene tres años de experiencia y comenzó con préstamo de micro financieras, con el préstamo que le otorguen es para capital de trabajo en la inversión de mercadería varias para obtener mas clientelas con los diversos productos. Su planes como comerciante es poder extender sus ventas al interior del páis y como madre soltera es enseñarles a sus hijos el valor del trabajo para que ellos puedan enfrentar la dura situación del país, así como también desea terminar de acondicionar su casa, y el más importante mantener a su familia siempre unida.

loans.use: Invest in purchasing clothing to increase her sales

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Bùi Thị Toàn, 52 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2006. She put her first loan of 3,000,000 VND towards purchasing merchandise. Currently, her family has a general store. They get a steady income from their business of selling miscellaneous merchandise.

Even though they have the store, her family still grows rice and raises pigs. All of her children are grown. Her eldest child has moved out and has his/her own family. The other three children still live with her and are attending either high school or middle school.

Although they live in the countryside, her family is very determined to raise their children with an education. All of her children perform well in school. Her husband is a hardworking person. He is constantly active and helps with growing the rice and raising the pigs.

For this round of loans, they want to raise 9,000,000 VND to invest in their retail store. Their average income is 4,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Bùi Thị Toàn 52 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2006, vòng vốn đầu chị vay 3.000.000đ đầu tư mua hàng hóa, hiện tai gia đình chị có cửa hàng tạp hóa tại chợ thu nhập từ việc kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa rất đều đăn, mặc dù đi chợ nhưng gia đình chị vẫn làm ruộng và chăn nuôi lợn, các con chị đều đã lớn con đầu chị đã xây dựng gia đình và ra ở riêng, 3 con đang sống cùng gia đình chị đều đang đi học đại học và trung cấp, mặc dù ở nông thôn nhưng gia đình chị rất quyết tâm nuôi các con ăn học, các con chị học rất giỏi, chồng chị là người chịu khó thường xuyên động viên chi và giúp chị những công việc đồng ruộng và chăn nuôi. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ đầu tư vào cửa hàng tạp hóa. Thu nhập bình quân 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: To put towards their retail store that sells general merchanise.

loans.name: Thi Xuan's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. V. Thi Xuan (ID Number 13010001), 55 years old, has borrowed through the SEDA Fund one time. This time, she would like to borrow 4,704,000VND to buy and sell general goods. Her daily income is 100.000VND (about 6USD). Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. N. Thi Ba (ID Number 13010002), borrows 4,256,000VND to buy and sell general goods
  • Mrs. D. Thi Nam (ID Number 13010003), borrows 4,704,000VND to buy and sell general goods
  • Mrs. D. Thi Thuy (ID Number 13010004), borrows 4,256,000VND to sell drinks
  • Mrs. N. Thi Huong (ID Number 13010005), borrows 4,704,000VND to invest in her eatery
  • The total amount requested is 1,375.00USD

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

    chị Vũ thị Xuân năm nay 55 tuổi , MS 13010001 cô đã tham gia được một chu kỳ .Đợt này cô vay số tiền là 4.704000VND,để đi chợ và mỗi ngày cô thu nhập được hơn 100.000VND.Tronng nhóm của cô gồm có các thành viên:

  • Nguyễn thị Ba MS 13010002 vay mức 4.256000 VND để đi chợ
  • Đinh thị Năm MS 13010003 vay mức 4.704000 VND để kinh doanh
  • Đinh thị Thuỷ MS 13010004 vay mức 4.256000 VND để bán hàng giải khát
  • chị Nguyễn thị Hương MS 13010005 vay mức 4.704000 VND bán hàng cơm

loans.use: Selling general goods

loans.name: Ana Belkis

texts.en:
Ana Belkis, a dynamic, optimistic and assiduous young mother of a three-year-old girl, is fighting tooth and nail to improve her family's lifestyle and move ahead.  She's been selling fresh vegetables for two years in her community.   Her business is much profitable as the country people love to consume fruits and vegetables in the morning.  Ana Belkis thinks that time has come to diversify her offer and attract more clients to her business.  With her loan, she'll add fresh meat, especially chicken to her actual inventory.  The entrepreneur also is thinking about renting a small establishment to run her activity.
Ana Belkis wants to have enough money to provide her daughter with the best education to become a great professional in life.

loans.use: To introduce fresh meat in her small business of selling vegetables.

loans.name: Mwanaisha's Mwanzo Mgumu Group

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is married. She has been a dressmaker since 2003. She works daily at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $145 from her sales.
 
Mwanaisha is now looking for a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member  Tatu.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar tiene 42 años de edad, de padres campesinos, su esposa y sus tres hijos también se dedican a la chacra. Desde muy niño se ha dedicado a la agricultura, viene sembrando por temporadas en las alturas y en la parte baja siembra por regadío. En esta oportunidad ha sembrado papa, hay temporadas que apoya a su esposa en el pastoreo de los vacunos, cerdos y de sus burros, los que tiene para transportar su cosecha hasta un lugar donde tenga acceso el transporte. Oscar tiene  sueños de comprar más chacras, donde pueda sembrar sin dificultad, porque es la única actividad que le alimento y por ello la ama. El motivo de su esfuerzo, y el de su esposa es por educar a sus hijos, lograr que sean profesionales, por ello hace todo lo posible en invertir en sus hijos. Con el dinero comprará semilla y preparará la chacra, asimismo comprará. Ha decido sembrar alvejas, porque sus vecinos están sembrando y les está yendo muy bien, tiene mucha fe que su producción será todo un éxito.
texts.en:
Oscar is 42 years old. His parents were from the countryside. His wife and his three children also work at farming. Since he was very young he has worked in agriculture. It is sunny in certain seasons in the mountains and in part of the irrigated and cultivated valley. At this time he is planting potatoes. There are times when his wife helps to take to pasture the cows, pigs, and the burrows. They have to transport their harvest for some distance, when they have access to transportation. Oscar has dreams of buying more farmland, where he would be able to grow crops without difficulty, because it is the only activity that feeds him and those that he loves. He and his wife are motivated to work so hard in order to educate their children so that they may become professionals. Because of this they do everything possible to invest in their children. With the loan, they would buy seeds and prepare the farm. He has decided to grow aloe, because his neighbors are growing it and it has gone very well. He has much faith that the production will be a success.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in growing aloe in his fields, also for the purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Foluke

texts.en:
Foluke is 35 years old. She is married and has three children. She lives in Alabarago, Lagos state, Nigeria.

Foluke sells garri (cassava flour) and palm oil. She travels to Imo state and Edo state to purchase palm oil and garri, and she resells the goods in Lagos state. She is asking for a loan of 70,000 naira ($600) to purchase more bags of garri and gallons of palm oil. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase garri and palm oil

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong S., 53, is married and lives with her husband and two children in the Prey Veng province, Cambodia. One of their children is a student and the other is a taxi driver. Since 2000, she has sold rice and other food in the village to earn a living.  She is able to make $3 a day.  Her husband sells fermented fish in the market and he usually makes $5 a day. 

Hong S. would like to take out a loan of $1000 to purchase more fermented fish from individual fishermen. (Hong S. and her husband are pictured outside their home.)

loans.use: To purchase fermented fish to sell.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco López  Ávila desea levantar la barda para que quede mas protegida por lo que nos comenta que ha habido muchos robos y no quiere perder parte de su patrimonio que con mucho esfuerzo ha obtenido. También quiere poner piso firme en la parte de atrás por que en tiempo de lluvias se hace mucho lodo.
Solicita la cantidad de $6,500 para hacer su proyecto.
texts.en:
Francisco López Ávila wants to put up a higher wall for protection. He tells us that there have been many robberies in the area, and he doesn't want to risk losing part of the wealth he has worked so hard to create. He would also like to install a more solid floor in the rear of his house, since during the rainy season his current floor becomes very muddy. He is requesting a loan of $6,500 Mexican pesos to carry out this project.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a wall and solid flooring

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina A. is a married 32 year old trader with four children. She lives with her family in Abofour which is a farming community in the Ashanti region. She believes in hard work and dedication as the primary antidote to minimizing poverty, and for that reason, she is very serious about her business.

Georgina trades in cereals like maize and started her business eleven years ago in Offinso but soon realized that business was slow. Georgina then relocated to the next town, which is Abofour, and has remained in business since then. She wants to use the loan to buy larger supplies of maize to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country. She believes that she can buy more bags of maize grains from the farmers and cut out the middlemen who sell to her at a high price.

Georgina belongs to a village bank called ‘Asedaben’ which means Thanksgiving.

loans.use: To buy a larger supply of maize.

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Touch Sath Village Bank Group

texts.en: Nineteen people living in Preaek Doung village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. M.. Srey Touch S., 40, is the president of the village bank. She is married and has four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school, while the youngest one is still too young to work or study. M.. Srey Touch S.'s husband, Mr. Prum Saravuth, is a motorbike taxi driver. M.. Srey Touch S. herself earns income selling pork, and, since her business is doing well, she now wants to expand it. Thus, M.. Srey Touch S. has decided to take out a loan to be able to bU. more pork for sale and thereby earn more profits.

loans.use: Purchase of pork for sale

loans.name: Ly

texts.vi: Chị Đinh Thị Lý  năm nay 22 tuổi . chị đang sống cùng chồng và một con nhỏ hai tuổi tại xã Hưng Trung huyện Hưng Nguyên - Nghệ An. Năm 2006 chị Lý tham gia Quỹ tìnhthương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi gà.  Hiện tại ngoài chăn nuôi chị Lý còn đầu tư vốn để buôn bán hoa quả . Bên cạnh đó  Anh Tường chồng chị làm  nghề thợ xây cho thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi và công việc kinh doanh hoa quả .
texts.en:
Ms. Đinh Thị Lý is 22 yrs old. She lives with her husband and her 2-yrs old child in the village of Hưng Trung, district of Hưng Nguyên - Nghệ An. In 2006 she joined TYM fund to borrow money to invest in raising chickens. Currently, in addition to raising animals, she also sells fruits. Besides these businesses, her husband, Mr. Tuong, is a construction worker and makes 116 USD per month. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 575 USD to invest in her businesses of raising animals and selling fruits.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising animals

loans.name: Uyi

texts.en: Uyi is thirty-five years old and married with five children. She sells provisions at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for loan of $700 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Akutwala Ekiko Group

texts.en: Florence is a wholesale fish seller. She travels to Bbaale, a landing port for fishermen, and buys large amounts of fresh fish. She then packs them into her fish truck and transports them to Bwaise, where she sells to her customers at wholesale prices. When Florence is busy with other things her brother runs her business. Florence has 8 children.  Three of them are still in school and she is able to pay all of their school fees from the profits from her fish business.  Florence is married to a farmer. The farm that her husband works is so large that he is able to employ some people from the community. Florence would like to buy an additional transport vehicle some day because her customer base is now exceeding the amount that she can supply with her currently vehicle.  Now Florence is requesting a loan of 6 million USH to buy fresh fish from Bbaale.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.en:
Tuyêt Ngô Thị (642970686) is a 42-year-old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Tuyêt owns & operates a business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, raising pigs to sell is the main source of income for the business. Tuyêt has been engaged in this business for over 13 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1997, Tuyêt joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve both her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Tuyêt has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Tuyêt is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in the future. The loan will be the 12th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Tuyêt plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve and expand it.

loans.use: To purchase young livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Ikromjon

texts.en:
K. Ikromjon is 30 years old. He is married with two children. Seven years ago he started his business selling cell phones. Ikromjon believes that this business is profitable and the generated income allows him to support his family. However, he thinks that it is expensive to purchase the cell phones locally and it will save him money if he purchases the goods in China. With this purpose, Ikromjon requests $800 US Dollars. Being loaned for the first time, Ikromjon is grateful to everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan promptly.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cell phones from China

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita T. is a hopeful and determined 75-year-old woman trying to rise from poverty. She hails from the Municipality of Teresa, Rizal Province, in the Philippines. She is widowed and strove hard to nurture her children until they grew up. Looking at her age, she still has the will to continue her business, a general store where she sells basic commodities and goods for her neighbors’ consumption in their village. She has been doing this type of business for 18 years already.

In 2006, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines. She was happy, because since joining ASHI, she has had access to capital. She used her previous loans in her general store as well.

Now on her 6th loan, Teresita has proposed a loan for the amount of 30,000 pesos so she can have additional capital for her business. The amount will be used to purchase bulk stock for her general store.

She dreams to help her grandchildren with their school expenses and to expand her general store to a bigger one.

loans.use: Additional capital for general store

loans.name: Sot

texts.en: The smiling woman shown in the picture above, Mrs. Sot V. is a 27-year-old farmer residing in the rural area of Pursat Province. She feeds some pigs in a pigpen behind her house.  Eventually, she will sell her pigs to a slaughterer in four-month cycles. Beside this work, she has also been planting the rice crop that is her annual business. Her husband works in construction. Sot V. is looking for a $800 loan as capital to support her farming business.  She will use the loan to buy a buffalo to plow the farmland and to buy fertilizer and rice seed. Sot V. has two children who are attending school.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo, fertilizer, and rice seed

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda D. started a glassware business in 1990. She is married to Antonio, who was a delivery truck driver. She has three children who are all studying. The income that Erlinda gets from her business helps pay her children's tuition fees, and also covers the expense of books and other school needs.

Now, she needs the additional capital of 13,000 PHP, which she will use to buy assorted glassware to sell. Kiva partner CEVI helps Erlinda sustain her livelihood. She actively participates in CEVI's weekly cluster meetings. She appreciates CEVI's services, especially the loans, training and insurance cover.

loans.use: To purchase assorted glassware for sale

loans.name: Ndiuka C Group

texts.en:
Pendo is a member of the Ndiuka C borrower group,she is 40 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child,Her child is aged 12 years.

Pendo started her clothing business selling kanga and vitenge(fabric) 3 years ago,she works 6 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 250,000 Tsh.

This is Pendo`s first loan from BRAC.She requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more Fabric for sale.
        
With the profit she gain from the use of this loan Pendo hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Frora is another member of the same borrower group,she also requested loan amount 100,000 Tsh in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more vitenge,and kanga(fabric)

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort sells palm oil. She is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She has been in the business for long. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is requesting for the loan amount of N120, 000 to purchase more palm oil to sells. She says thanks to all kiva lenders for support.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Sèlia

texts.fr: Sèlia est une cliente d'ALIDé qui est mariée et est mère de trois enfants. Sèlia n'a jamais été à l'école, ni appris un métier. Très tôt, Sèlia fut initiée au commerce par ses parents. Sèlia vend de pommes fruits et les articles pour bébé : thermos, biberons et autres accessoires de bébé. Depuis, Sèlia n'a pas changé d'activité. Sèlia veut mieux développer son activité. C’est pour cela que Sèlia demande de prêt à ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
L. Sèlia is 35 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. She has never been to school nor has she learned a trade. Very early on, she was introduced to commerce by her parents. She sells apples and baby items: thermos, baby bottles, and other accessories for babies. Since then, Sèlia has not changed her business. She wants to develop her business further. To do so, she’s asking for an ALIDé loan to bolster her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy apples, thermos, baby bottles, and other baby items

loans.name: Nenedta

texts.en:
Nenedta M. is from the village of Colupan Settlement, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Nenedta is married and has 3 adult-aged children.

To make a living, Nenedta owns & operates a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Nenedta has been engaged in her business for over 22 years and earns approximately 6,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nenedta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nenedta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Nenedta is requesting a new loan of 6,000.00 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Nenedta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Belinda

texts.es:
Belinda tiene 37 años, es madre de 4 niños: Jorge de 18, Brigite de 14, Jenifer de 9 y María de 5 años. Vive con sus hijos y su esposo (Hidalgo), de 38 años, en su casa ubicada en el distrito de Ventanilla de Lima.
Ella se dedica al alquiler de cabinas de Internet en un espacio que implementó en su casa y durante las tardes trabaja en un local de comida. Además, concede en alquiler un motocarro que es de su propiedad y con las ganancias tiene una ayuda económica adicional. Como si fuera poco, cada 15 días esta laboriosa mujer se da tiempo para viajar a la sierra del país para vender ropa. Belinda considera sus labores muy rentables, ya que le están rindiendo buenas ganancias, pero lo que no le gusta es dejar mucho tiempo solas a sus pequeñas hijas, ya que están en edades en la que necesitan mucho los consejos de una madre, además de la ayuda que requieren en la escuela. 

Para el futuro Belinda sueña con tener su propio local de venta de comida peruana, donde pueda ofrecer gran variedad de platillos y así auto sostenerse para no dejar a sus hijas solas. 

Este es su doceavo préstamo con MFP, sabe que debe ser responsable y puntual porque todas las mujeres que conforman su banco comunal son muy cumplidas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más mercadería en ropa, además de comprar un nuevo motocarro que también dará en alquiler.
texts.en:
Belinda is 37 years old and the mother of 4 children: Jorge (age 18), Brigite (age 14), Jenifer (age 9), and María (age 5). Her husband Hidalgo is 38 years old. Belinda and her family live in the district of Ventanilla of Lima.

She rents out Internet booths in a designated space in her home and sells food from a vending space in the afternoons. At the same time, she also owns a motorcar that she rents out for additional income. Every 15 days, this hardworking woman also travels to the mountainous region of the country to sell clothes. Belinda says her jobs are very profitable because they generate good income, but she does not like spending time away from her small daughters because they are at an age when they need their mother and require help with their schoolwork.

In the future Belinda dreams of having her own Peruvian food shop where she sells a variety of dishes, becoming self-sufficient, and not having to leave her daughters alone. She is taking her twelfth loan with MFP. She knows that she has to be responsible and punctual so that the other women in her Communal Bank remain happy. The money she is requesting will be used to buy more clothing and purchase a new motorcar for rental.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Provide additional capital to multiple businesses (Internet cafe, clothing sales, & motorcar rental)

loans.name: Railway Quarters A1 Ceazaria Ayugi Group

texts.en:
C. Ayugi is the treasurer of her loan group. She is a 43-year old business woman, married with nine children of which two are schooling. For 6 years, she has had a business selling produce such as maize, rice, and beans, among other things.

She is requesting a loan to purchase to increase her stock of beans, maize, dried cassava, and rice in her business. She is active and enthusiastic business woman whose hope is to see a growth in her business and, in her dream, obtain her own store.

loans.use: To increase the stock of beans, maize, dried cassava and rice for business

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla P. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 31 years old. Perla is married and has 3 school-aged children.

To make a living Perla owns and operates a specialized retail store. Her main source of income comes from selling rice and dried fish in the local community. Perla has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

Perla joined HSPFI to to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.

Perla is requesting her first loan from HSPFI, for 5000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell.

She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Irma Luisa

texts.es:
Irma es una madre D. familia D. 45 años D. edad, tiene 3 hijos D. los cuales dos están aún a su cargo y se encuentran estudiando, se separó D. su pareja hace un año y vive en el sector Ucupe, distrito D. Lagunas a 35 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Las ganas D. sacar a su familia adelante la llevaron a instalar en su vivienda una pequeña bodega en la que ofrece productos D. primera necesidad, abarrotes, carne D. pollo y golosinas a los vecinos D. su zona. Además venD. productos D. belleza. Con los ingresos que le generan estas actividades Irma trata D. solventar la economía D. su familia.

Ella trabaja incansablemente por mantener su negocio. La demanda D. sus clientes ha hecho que desee ampliar su bodega,  por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 800 nuevos soles.

Su más granD. anhelo es construir su casa D. material noble y brindarle a sus hijos estudios superiores. Ella es una madre responsable y que siempre lucha por salir adelante a pesar D. las adversidades.
texts.en:
Irma, 45, separated from her partner a year ago. She has 3 children, two of whom are in school and still dependent on her. She lives in the Ucupe sector, Lagunas district, located 35 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Her wish to see her family get ahead led her to set up a small grocery store in her home. She sells such items as groceries, chicken, sweets, etc. to her neighbors. In addition, she also sells beauty products. With the profits from these activities, Irma tries to meet her household expenses. She works tirelessly to maintain her business. Growing demand has led her to expand her store which has led to the need to seek financing for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa in the form of an 800 new sol loan. Her greatest wish is to build her house with sturdy materials and to be able to proviD. her children with advanced schooling. She is a responsible mother who always struggles to get ahead despite adversity.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For stock inventory.

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en:
Ophelia is forty years old and married with three children. All of her children are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing-dominated community called Axim in the western region of Ghana. Ophelia works hard to support her husband in providing for their family.

She trades in secondhand clothes for both males and females. Ophelia sell these clothes in her community and also treks to nearby communities to sell. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy secondhand clothes

loans.name: Chuluuntsetseg

texts.en: Chuluuntsetseg is a 35-year-old single mother who lives with her ten-year-old son in Zavkhan province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her son is a secondary school student. Chuluuntsetseg operates a small bakery in her town. She makes a variety of breads and buns that are very popular among her many customers. Chuluuntsetseg started her bakery business in 2003 with only one stove at her home. At first she had only a manual oven to make her products but, after several years of steady earnings, she was able to purchase a more efficient modern oven last year. Her success has also enabled her to hire seven more assistants at her bakery booth. Chuluuntsetseg is working hard to continue her success in the future. She hopes to soon purchase more tools and supplies to help her business and says, "My goal is to one day own my own workplace." She is requesting a 2,000,000-tugrug loan to purchase tools and flour for her bakery.

loans.use: To purchase tools and flour for her bakery

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 37-year-old married man with 3 young children. He has been working in construction for the past 20 years. In 2000, he decided to work on his own and create his own business taking on construction projects. He's very happy because he feels independent in his own business. Today, Hasan is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy a car (Rapid model)  for easier transport to the houses where he works.

loans.use: buy a car for easier transport

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth de 52 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de sus 4 hijos; Lily (24), Alexandra (15), Axel (13) y Camila (8).
Desde muy joven aprendió el bordado en chompas y le gustó tanto que ahora este oficio es su mayor pasión. Para ello, compra chompas ya terminadas donde borda diferentes motivos o paisajes y luego las revende a un precio mayor. Elizabeth trabaja de manera independiente ofreciendo sus prendas a sus amigos y conocidos; estando muy satisfecha porque puede generarse buenas ganancias económicas.
Paralelamente vende productos de belleza de tres diferentes marcas reconocidas, y por ello también gana el dinero que le  permite cubrir los múltiples gastos del hogar. Ella refiere que sus actividades son tranquilas y las puede desarrollar cuando quiere y no tiene presión. 
Para el futuro, tiene planeado instalar un bazar donde pueda ofrecer sus productos y sus chompas de manera más estable, sin tener que salir a las calles.

Este es el sexto préstamo que tiene con MFP y asegura será puntual en los pagos de cada una de sus cuotas, además no quiere quedar mal con las integrantes de su grupo porque todas son muy  responsables. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más chompas para bordarlas, además también comprará productos de belleza para revenderlos a mayor precio.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 52. She lives in her own house with her four children. Lily is 24, Alexandra is 15, Axel is 13, and Camila is 8. When she was very young she learned to embroider sweaters. She liked it so much that this craft is now her biggest passion. She buys finished sweaters and embroiders different motifs or scenery. She then resells them at a higher price. Elizabeth works in an independent manner offering her clothes to her friends and acquaintances. She is very satisfied because she is able to generate good earnings. She also sells three different well known brands of beauty products. With this she also earns the money that allows her to cover the many household expenses. She says that her activities are peaceful, and she is able to work at them when she wants without pressure. In the future she plans to set up a bazaar where she can sell her products and her sweaters in a more stable manner without having to go to the streets. This is her sixth loan with MFP. She guarantees that she will be punctual making each one of her payments. Also, she does not want to cause problems for the members of her group because they are all very responsible. The money she is now requesting will be used to buy more sweaters to embroider. Also, she will buy beauty products to resell at a higher price.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more sweaters to embroider

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth M. is from the village of Yumbing Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old. Ruth is widowed and has 3 adult-aged children.

To make a living Ruth sells meat products in the local community. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Ruth joined HSPFI to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruth successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. Ruth is requesting her second loan from HSPFI, for 7000 PHP, which she will invest in her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement her family's income. About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in her meat business.

loans.name: Akif

texts.en: Akif R. is a successful father and dedicated husband and together with his wife he has a daughter. Akif began a small grocery store 14 years ago with a small amount of savings. He was assisted by his father who helps him with serving his clients. Today, his clientele has grown greater and his grocery store becomes more popular. He is asking for a loan so that he may expand the variety of goods that are sold in his store. Akif is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve successes in his business with this loan.

loans.use: purchase more detegents to sell

loans.name: Gagae

texts.en:
Gagae E. is 43 and married with 10 children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Gagae has 1 year of experience in this business.  Gagae needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Gagae joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Gagae's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Gagae E. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
Mirna tiene una tienda de abarrotes en el cruce de Villa Copacabana, en la ciudad de La Paz, donde vende refrescos, pan, conservas, dulces y otros.
Con la tienda puede solventar los gastos de educación de sus hijos y la alimentación de su familia ya que no vive con su esposo.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Villa San Antonio Bajo de la ciudad de la Paz en casa propia.
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de abarrotes, aceite, papel higiénico).
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro,  con este crédito podrá comprar mercadería y mejorar sus costos por compras.
texts.en:
Mirna has a grocery store at the crossroads of Villa Copacabana in the city of La Paz, where she sells drinks, bread, canned goods, sweets, and other items. With earnings from this store she pays the costs of education for her children and food for her family, since she no longer lives with her husband. Mirna lives in the Villa San Antonio Bajo zone of the city of La Paz in her own house. The loan will be used to buy groceries, including oil and toilet paper. It is the first time she has solicited credit with Impro. With this loan she will buy merchandise and improve her costs for purchases.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MERCHANDISE FOR HER GROCERY STORE

loans.name: Conis

texts.es:
En el municipio de somotillo comarca la carreta la señora Conis C. B., ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida al desarrollo de actividades agropecuarias y forestales con las cuales obtiene sus ingresos y le proveen el sostén necesario para su mantención y la de su familia la que consta de sus tres hijas y esposo con quien realiza la mayor parte de estas actividades, dentro de las que destacan la siembra de maíz, ajonjolí, sorgo y en algunos casos Jamaica, también se dedican a la crianza de ganado bobino, porcino y aviar los que le proveen a demás de ingresos la base fundamental para la dieta de su familia, dichas actividades son realizadas en una jornada de 7 horas.
La señora Conis C. B. solicita este financiamiento para la compra de un lote de terreno de 1 mz para asegurar una mejor mantención para su hato ganadero.
texts.en:
En el municipio de somotillo comarca la carreta la señora Conis C. B., ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida al desarrollo de actividades agropecuarias y forestales con las cuales obtiene sus ingresos y le proveen el sostén necesario para su mantención y la de su familia la que consta de sus tres hijas y esposo con quien realiza la mayor parte de estas actividades, dentro de las que destacan la siembra de maíz, ajonjolí, sorgo y en algunos casos Jamaica, también se dedican a la crianza de ganado bobino, porcino y aviar los que le proveen a demás de ingresos la base fundamental para la dieta de su familia, dichas actividades son realizadas en una jornada de 7 horas. La señora Conis C. B. solicita este financiamiento para la compra de un lote de terreno de 1 mz para asegurar una mejor mantención para su hato ganadero.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra una manzana de terreno.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda T. is from the village of Baliangao. She is 39 years old, married and has a school-aged child. Luzminda owns and operates a business selling dry goods in the local community. Luzminda has been involved in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it. She's also involved in snack vending.

In 2005, Luzminda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used as additional capital for her snack vending business. Luzminda is requesting a new loan, her 12th, of 14,500 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita L.'s main source of income comes from raising pigs for sale. She is 50 years old, married and has four school-aged children. They are from the village of Matugas Bajo. Teresita has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Teresita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her fifth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
45-year-old Samwel is the married father of eight children aged between 2 and 21 years. Four of the children are currently attending school.

Samwel is a farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been farming for twelve years and employs three people from his community. His products are milk, which he sells to the tea estate, and tea, which he sells locally. He depends on the income from farming to cater for his family's needs.

Samwel’s biggest challenges have been diseases and inadequate artificial insemination services.

Samwel has requested this Kes 50,000 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help him in paying school fees for his children. In future, he would like to have a pure-bred cow which produces more than thirty liters of milk daily.

Samwel would like to clear this loan without default so that he can obtain more loans in future.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: W. Antoinette est née en 1977 à Grand-Popo au Bénin. Mariée à DOSSOU Florent, Antoinette est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Il y a environs deux ans que Antoinette s’est installée au quartier Lokokoukoumè dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple se partage les différentes charges familiales. Antoinette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Antoinette vend divers produits (pâtes alimentaires, couscous, savons, sucre, piles, etc.) de façon ambulante. Antoinette achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Antoinette sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit, en vue de renforcer son activité et d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu.
texts.en:
Antoinette W. was born in 1977 in Grand-Popo, Benin. Married to Florent DOSSOU, Antoinette is the mother of two children, both going to school. About two years ago Antoinette moved to the district of Lokokoukoumé in the town of Seme-Podji, with her children and husband. The couple shares the different expenses of the household. Antoinette did not go to school. To meet her needs, Antoinette is an itinerant dealer; she sells various products (pasta, couscous, soap, sugar, batteries, etc.). Antoinette gets her supplies in Dantokpa, international market of Benin. This is the second time Antoinette requests a loan from Alidé, in order to strengthen her business and to increase her turnover and income.

Translated from French by viviane reignier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing boxes of pasta, soap, sugar and couscous

loans.name: Crema

texts.en: Crema A. is a married woman who lives in Barangay Liloan, Santander, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: shell craft and food vending. Her husband, Hermogenes A., who is 48 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living. They have four children who are from 17 to 25 years old. Crema joined NWTF-Project Dungganon six years ago because she wished for something better for her family. With the help of her past sixteen loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 5,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her 17th loan, Crema is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use in her shell-craft business so that she can continue to save for the future and send her children to school, especially to college. Crema is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva and become a part of our team.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her businesses

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
N. Joan is 32 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.  Joan has a business of running a retail shop, which she has had for four years.  

To help expand her business, Joan is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy more stock to sell.  Joan hopes that the loan will help her by allowing her to increase her capital.  In the future, Joan hopes to improve her family's life.

loans.use: To increase stock at her retail store

loans.name: Ziyaddin

texts.ru:
Ziyaddin A. 26 let. On ne jinat. Ziyaddin yavlyayetsya IDP personom ,on pereselenec iz qoroda Fuzuli oblast Dilegerde, seychas on projivayet v Absheron regione.

Ziyaddin uje 3 qoda yavlyayetsya masterom pompovoqo nasosa. On provodit zalivku betona  na krishi damov pri stroykax. Ziyaddin etomu biznesu nauchilsya u svoyeqo otca on toje bil masterom pompovoqo nasosa. Seychas Ziyaddin nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chto bi kupit zapchasti i zamenit dviqatel pompovoqo aparata. Vsya eqo rabota zavisit ot aparata poetomu on xochet pochenit eqo.
texts.en:
Ziyaddin A. is 26 years old. He is single. He is an Internally Displaced Person, displaced from the town of Fuzuli in the Dilegerde Region. Now he lives in the Absheron Region. For the last three years he has been working as a cement pump operator. He uses the pump to convey cement to the roofs of buildings under construction. Ziyaddin has learned his trade from his father, who was also a cement pump operator. At present Ziyaddin needs 2000 Azerbaijani Manats in order to buy spare parts and replace the engine. His work wholly depends on his equipment, and therefore he would like to get it repaired.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts and replacing the engine

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita M. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 35 and married with a small child. To make a living, Charita owns a business providing hairdressing and beauty services. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Charita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase materials used in her beauty salon, and is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP for the same purpose. This will be the second loan taken out by Charita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials used in her beauty salon

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes E. is a seamstress and also prepares porridge for sale at Elmina.  She has not been to school. She is married to a driver and together they live with their five dependents. She feeds her family as a way of helping her husband support the family. Her loan will be used to buy more materials and cloth to sew for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a shop in town to sew in.

loans.use: buy more materials and cloth to sew for sale

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: El Sr. Santiago C. C.   él  es de oficio transportista con más de doce años de experiencia en esta actividad de compra y venta de materiales de construcción, el ya tiene sus clientes los cuales ellos lo llaman a pedir los materiales, es casado actualmente, tiene un niño en edad escolar. Ha tenido  seis créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para la compra de  materiales de construcción para mejorar su negocio, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él  ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Santiago C. C. is in the transporting trade, with more than 12 years of experience buying and selling construction materials. Now he has clients who call him to order materials. He is married and he has a school-age son. He has had 6 loans with CEPRODEL. He has used them to purchase construction materials to improve his business. His loans with CEPRODEL have benefited him in a big way and they have allowed him to improve the quality of life for his family and himself.

loans.use: to buy construction materials: sand, cement, quarry stones, etc

loans.name: Merly

texts.en: Merly V. is from the city of Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 51 years old. Merly is married and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Merly runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products like shampoo, canned goods (sardines, beef loaf and corned beef) and other items. Merly has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Merly joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. Merly is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Merly from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jasimin

texts.en:
Jasimin N., a 20-year old a single mother of one child, lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala South region of Uganda. For the past six years, Jasimin has had business selling passion fruit wholesale. She also has a cosmetics shop.

To help expand her business, Jasimin has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase more sacks of passion fruit. With the help of the loan, she hopes to generate greater profits and take care of her child. In the future, she aspires to own a house in Kampala.

Jasimin is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has aided her prospects for the future by helping her acquire new social relationships.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of passion fruit

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
Phorn C. has been living in a small house from which she operates her small enterprise of selling breakfast foods to the neighbors. She is able to earn approximately $2 each day. She has other income from her husband who drives a trailer-motor taxi. This couple has given birth to two children, all of them are still single and studying in school. 

Currently, Phorn C. faces difficulties with her living situation because her house needs repairs, but she doesn’t have enough money to pay for construction fees. She is asking for a loan to repair her house. The rest of her funds will be used to change her husband’s trailer-motor.

loans.use: House repairs and towards her husband’s trailer-motor.

loans.name: Nabat

texts.ru:
Nabat H. 39 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 3 detey. Nabat yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda i seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione.

Nabat uje 7 let kak imeyet bizness prodaji tovari domashneqo upotrebleniya. Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Nabat v pervuyu ssudu ona brala 1000$ chtobi kupit tovar dlya prodaji, ona ochen blagodarna lenderam za ssudu za etu summu ona pokupala kostruli skovorodki chayniki elektronniye( ranshe ona prodovaal tolka tarelki, stakani, lojki ,vilki i t.d). Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi uvelichit pomesheniye dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.  

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/52398
texts.en:
Nabat H. is 39 years old.  She is married with three children.  Nabat is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  She is a refugee from the city of Fuzuli who now lives in the Fuzuli region.

Nabat has owned her housewares business for seven years.  This is her second loan.  Before, she borrowed $1000 to buy goods to sell.  She is very grateful to lenders for the loan.  She bought cooking pots, skillets, and electric tea kettles.  Before the loan, she only sold plates, glasses, spoons, forks, etc.  Now, she needs 2000 AZN to increase the size of her shop and further develop her business.

Here is a link to her previous loan:  http://partners.kiva.org/lend/52398

loans.use: Expanding the shop

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa O. is from Maquilao, Tangub City. She is 32 years old, married, and has 1 grown child. To make a living, Leonisa owns & operates a fishing business The main source of income for the business comes from raising fish for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Leonisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC, and is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be Leonisa’s second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Reng

texts.en: Reng O., 43, produces traditional cakes to sell, earning an income of 1 USD per day. O. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. Her husband is a carpenter, earning an income of 2 USD per day. The family has to spend 83 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity, and 40 USD on other necessary expenses every month. O. is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase a machine to cut wood for her husband to improve his business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. O. is not available so her husband appears in the photograph instead.

loans.use: To buy a machine to cut wood for her husband to improve his business

loans.name: Yaya

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yaya  Koné  est un homme marié de 34ans monogame vivant   avec ses  quatre  enfants dans le quartier Ouest de la ville de Kolondièba, troisième région administrative de la république Mali.
Yaya fait le commerce de bétails depuis maintenant quinze ans. Il est très sollicité et apprécié dans cette activité. 
Pour augmenter son capital il adhère au programme de  Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui il est à son deuxième cycle. 
Monsieur Koné compte achète des bœufs, des moutons et des chèvres, dans la ville de Kolondièba et environnants.  
Il vend ces animaux au marché à bétails de Kolondièba, au comptant et souvent à crédit.   
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice de 70.000FCfa par mois. 
Le bénéfice  sera investi dans les frais  santé et le reste dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Yaya Koné is a monogamous, 34-year-old married man who lives with his four children in the western district of the city of Kolondièba (in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Yaya has been selling livestock for the past fifteen years. He is in high demand and enjoys a very good reputation in this business.

To increase his working capital, he joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and is now on his second loan cycle.

Mr. Koné plans to purchase oxen, sheep and goats in Kolondièba and neighboring areas. He sells the animals at the Kolondièba cattle market for cash and often on credit. He expects to earn a monthly profit of 70,000 FCFA, which will be used to pay for health care and to fund his activities.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Moses
