She has been selling clothes, shoes and kitchenware at the flea market for three years. Her husband helps her with her business, but she faces the challenge of inadequate capital to buy more goods for sale.

Gladys has applied for US $4OO to buy more stock for her business. With the additional income generated from her loan, she will be able to send her children to better schools and give them a good start in life.  Her plan in the near future is to open a shop in town.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of clothes and kitchenware for sale

loans.name: Violeta Estefanni

texts.es:
Violeta, se dedica a la venta de pasteles, vive con una tía, es soltera, realiza sus ventas todos los días, ofreciendo pasteles y tostadas de plátano y yuca, ella tiene tres años en el negocio.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo, el cual invertirá en maíz, plátanos, yuca, condimentos y aceite, estos materiales son los que necesita para elaborar las ventas, por lo que será una gran ayuda este préstamo.
Su aspiración es tener una mejor calidad de vida, trabajar arduamente para mantenerse y cubrir sus propias necesidades y las de su tía.
texts.en: Violeta works selling cakes.  She lives with her aunt, is single, and she makes sales every day, offering cakes and fried plantains and yucca.  She has been working in this business for three years.  Currently she is asking for a loan which she will invest in corn, plantains, yucca, condiments and oil.  These are the materials that she news in order to make her products, and the loan will thus be a great help.  Her dream is to improve her quality of life, to work hard to care for her own needs and also the needs of her aunt.

loans.use: To purchase corn, plantains, yucca, condiments and oil.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es: Miguel trabajador, junto a su esposa tiene como proyecto mejorar la infraestructura de la vivienda. El préstamo anterior fue de gran apoyo para el mejoramiento. En este nuevo ciclo de préstamo será utilizado para seguir poco a poco con la obra de ver su casa construida por completo, compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, piedrines, bloques, estribu, camisas, tablones de madera, perlines, pintura para perlines, clavos de acero, laminas de zinc, hierro, entre otros materiales que se requieren para la construcción de un cuarto que se anexara a la casa, así obtendrá comodidad ya que actualmente están durmiendo en un solo cuarto con sus hijos.  Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo constante para cumplir sus metas y brindarle a su familia beneficios.
texts.en: Miguel is a hardworking man who, along with his wife, has plans to improve the infrastructure of his house.  His previous loan was a great help with the improvement project.  In this new loan cycle, he will continue gradually with the work of completing the construction of his home.  He will buy construction materials such as: cement, sand, gravel, cement blocks, brackets, steel liners, planks of wood, support beams, paint for the support beams, steel nails, corrugated metal roofing sheets, steel and other materials that are needed to build a room that will be added to the house.  In this way he will have more comfort, since currently he and his wife are are sleeping in a single room with his children.  He is grateful for the ongoing support that is allowing him to meet his goals and is providing his family with benefits.

loans.use: to add a room to his house

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Grace has a shop that sells hardware products like weighing machines, hand globes and nails by the kilo. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more stock of hardware products for her shop.

Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her hardware shop.

loans.name: Alvaro Antonio

texts.es: Álvaro  desde Puerto Colombia, a orillas del mar caribe,  envía el siguiente mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva: “Que Dios los bendiga por ayudar tanta gente humilde en todo el mundo. “  Él está muy satisfecho con su anterior credikiva porque logró comprar al por mayor y de contado víveres, reparó su carro triciclo en el cual vende arroz chino por las calles del pueblo Y ahora se ´prepara para el siguiente financiamiento, con el cual comprará un nuevo bici taxi que le permita abrir nuevos mercados y desplazarse con mayor comodidad y rapidez a otros sitios lejanos, y también invertirá en víveres en mayor volumen, con el cual disminuirá los costos de producción por los descuentos que obtendrá al hacerlo en mayor cantidad de dinero.
texts.en:
From Puerto Colombia on the shores of the Caribbean Sea Álvaro sends the following message to Kiva lenders:  “May God bless you for helping so many humble persons throughout the world.”  

He is very happy with his previous Kiva loan because he managed to pay cash for larger amounts of foodstuffs; he repaired his three-wheeled cart that he uses to sell Chinese-style rice throughout the town’s streets.  Now, he’s getting ready for the next loan that he’ll use to buy a new rickshaw that will allow him to open up new markets and get from place to place more comfortably and more quickly getting to more distant places.  He will also invest in larger amounts of foodstuffs which will reduce production costs thanks to the discounts he’ll qualify for being able having the money to buy in larger amounts.

loans.use: to buy a new bike taxi and also to buy larger volumes of foodstuffs.

loans.name: Maria Trinidad

texts.es: La Sra. Maria tiene un negocio de venta de comida el cual atiende con el apoyo de su esposo,  ellos  realizan  banquetes para cualquier tipo de evento  y nos  comenta  que  sus  clientes  han ido  incrementado  de  manera  satisfactoria, es por  ello que en esta  ocasión requiere  ampliar su  negocio extendiéndolo, realizando  la  construcción para  la parte  de  enfrente del  mismo  ya  que  considera  que  es   muy  pequeño , ve  en el crédito  la posibilidad de  que  sus  clientes  tengan mayor  espacio  y una mejor  comodidad  cuando  van a  su negocio
texts.en: María has a business selling food that she tends to with help from her husband.  They cater banquets for all kinds of events and she comments that her clientele has been growing satisfactorily.  Because of this, she wants to enlarge her business extending it by building on to the front of it because she considers it to be too small.  She sees in the loan the possibility for her customers to have more space and comfort when they come to her business.

loans.use: to make her storefront bigger.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is separated with 3 children. 
Reynaldo is providing motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy tools & pay for gasoline for his business.
Reynaldo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Reynaldo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for gasoline for his business

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is thirty-nine years old, and presently lives in Gabunon, Tambulig Zamboanga del Sur. She is widowed with three children.

Annie  has a general store and has been this business for almost four years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more stock for her general store.

She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for almost two months. In the future, Annie hopes that she can improve her family's standard of living, and earn more than she needs.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Devothe

texts.en:
Devothe aged 42 years. She is married with 3 children aged between 7 and 14 years.They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 8 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and to buy a cow. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Anita

texts.es: ANITA: Es una señora sonriente de 53 años de edad, pertenece a la etnia miskita del municipio de Puerto Cabezas, casada, con 11 hijos mayores de edad. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y contribuir con los gastos del hogar, desde hace más de tres décadas, vende en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Bilwi, mariscos y pescados, en un termo con hielo.  Recuerda con gran entusiasmo que inicio con C$ 3,000 (Tres Mil Córdobas Netos) con el apoyo de su esposo e hijos. Solicita financiamiento para aumentar su producción y mejorar sus ingresos. Su sueño es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

loans.use: para comprar mariscos y pescados

loans.name: Rajabu

texts.en: Rajabu lives in Yombo, Temeke District of Dar es Salaam.He is married with three children. Rajabu sell used clothes . He buys these clothes from wholesales, amend them in his tailoring workshop at home and resell them in retail. Most used clothes need some modification before resell, some are undersized ,some are oversized, some are torn. Rajabu owns one old sewing machine. He needs two modern sewing machines. The new machines will increase the speed of repairing the clothes. He is also in a plan to employ one assistant to facilitate his mission, To make his plan work Rajabu is in need of USD 750.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Erick

texts.en: I am a 28-year-old father of 2.  I sell roasted corn. I do my business to meet the basic needs of food and shelter for my family. I want the loan to enable me to earn a profit of US $2 a day.

loans.use: Expand and improve my business

loans.name: Aracely

texts.en:
Aracely is a native of Salitre where she has been farming rice her entire life. She has a small farm where she farms the crop and she also a couple of cattle. Aracely lives with her husband and three children who are in school. She will invest her money in pesticides and feed for her cattle. With the extra profits she hopes she can purchase a cow and continue to provide her kids with an eduction.

She is the latest addition to one of the new Communal Banks in the Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the 10 de enero Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Salitre named 10 de enero. They will use the microloans to prepare the lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the 10 de enero Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but is imperative for the communities Mifex works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Loan Use and Repayment

The loans in this sector will be used to create water deposits that will prevent flooding in the case of heavy rains or store water in case of droughts. They will also be used to treat the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase fertilizer. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 5 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the sixth and final month.

Below is more information about Salitre compiled by the staff at Mifex when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Salitre

Salitre is a rural sector in the Province of Guayas known as the capital of Montuvios (montuvio is a cowboy) with approximately 30,000 inhabitants. The main economic activities are herding and agriculture which make up about 80% of the economy. The infrastructure and basic services are poor, especially the roads and water services.

Salitre is highly dedicated to farming rice and cattle ranching. Rice is a crop that yields about every four months. In order to farm rice, the environment must be very humid and there must be a high volume of water. The lack of a structured water system makes it difficult for the small farmers to be highly productive. The best months for cultivating rice are early in the year when it is the rainy season in the coast of Ecuador.

Salitre is a national tourist attraction as many Ecuadorians visit the fresh water Salitre River. There are cottages, small restaurants and water attractions that people come to enjoy.

Access to Credit

There are not many financial institutions that provides services to the productive sector of the local economy. The primary access to credit comes from loan sharks who charge extremely high interest rates averaging around 20% a month. The locals are also exploited by the intermediaries that buy their products in order to commercialize them in the city and to export abroad. These intermediaries buy crops in advance at very low prices, finance soil at extremely high prices and often provide emergency loans for even higher interest rates than the loan sharks.

Risks

Salitre is a dangerous sector considering it is in the rural area. There is a high incidence of robbery of cattle that results in many of the ranch owners owning weapons to protect their property. Because the police are not present in these areas, farmers and ranchers must apply their own laws and provide their own security. In some instances they have formed their own cooperatives and associations to have a community crime prevention effort.

Salitre is in the lowlands of Ecuador and is vulnerable to flooding in the rainy season. In the event of a heavy rainy season, often at its worse when El Niño occurs, the farmers of rice lose many of their crops. All this is due to a lack of infrastructure in the area.

loans.use: Pesticides for rice

loans.name: Zarmena

texts.en:
Zarmena lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is not married. She makes artificial flowers. She loves this work a lot and she has good experience.

She wants to expand her business so she wants to take a group loan to buy all the materials for making flowers. She wants to attract more clients and make a good income so that she can improve her life.

loans.use: To buy extra materials for artificial flowers

loans.name: Remedios

texts.es:
Remedios F. Quispe is a mother with four children. She prepares and sells food from a cart in all of the markets in El Alto.

She has participated with Pro Mujer for five years, which is the same amount of time that she has had this business. Thanks to Pro Mujer she was able to buy what she needed to get started. Remedios used to make cinnamon ice cream, but she had to quit that business to take care of her children, who were very young.

Now she tends to her food cart with help from her children, due to the existing demand and her need to generate income. She is in need of money to buy a mini-bus, which her husband can use to facilitate their work. This will lessen the work load on Remedios and also her children, who work alongside her.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Remedios F. Quispe, es madre de cuatro hijos se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida en un puesto ambulante en todas las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Ingresa a Pro Mujer, hace cinco años, que es el mismo tiempo que ella se dedica a su actividad, puesto que gracias a Pro Mujer ella compra todo lo necesario para la atención de su puesto de venta de comida. Anteriormente Remedios se dedicaba a la fabricación y venta de helados de canela, pero tuvo que dejar esta actividad por no descuidar la atención de sus hijos que eran muy pequeños. Actualmente Remedios atiende su puesto de venta con la ayuda de sus hijos a raíz de la demanda existente y la necesidad de generar ingresos. Ella precisa de dinero para poder comprar un minibús, con el fin de proveer de una herramienta de trabajo a su esposo y de esta manera aliviar su carga laboral, tanto de ella, como de sus hijos que trabajan a su lado

loans.use: To buy a mini-bus, which her husband can use to facilitate their work. This will lessen the work load on Remedios and also her children, who work alongside her.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana O. is asking for a loan amount of $400 to buy more provisions to sell in her food store, which she keeps obsessively organized. Mrs. O. started her business in 2004 and has been running it for 3 years. She is 40 years old, married with seven children, and lives in Asaba in Delta State. She is a good client of LAPO.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of her food store

loans.name: Judite Luis

texts.pt:
Judite Luís N. is 46 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children. She lives in the district of Magoanine in Maputo. She entered the program in July of 2005 as a member of the Ahiculene group and started with a loan for 1.800MT. She raises and sells chickens and raises hens for production and sells the eggs in her home. She has had great development in her business having grown the quantity of chicks and hens that she raises. With this loan of $825US she intends to buy food for the chicks and hens, and will build a small house in her yard for her workers.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer.

Judite Luís N. tem 46 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é mãe de dois filhos.Vive no bairro Magoanine em Maputo.Entrou para o programa em Julho de 2005 como membro do grupo Ahiculene e começou com um empréstimo de 1.800MT. Cria e vende frangos e cria galinhas poedeiras para produção e venda de ovos na sua residência.Teve grande desenvolvimento no negócio , tendo aumentado a quantidade de pintos e poedeiras que cria. Vai tomar neste ciclo 20.000MT os quais pretende aplicar na compra de ração para pintos e poedeiras, e ainda costruir uma pequena casa dentro do seu quintal para o empregados.

loans.use: Buy food for chicks and hens, and construct home for workers

loans.name: Chiku

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 40-year-old Chiku M.. She is married with no children. In 2002 Chiku established a grain and charcoal business, and now requests a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. 

Charcoal--small black and dirty pieces of dry earth--are important not just to charcoal sellers but to their customers, who rely on charcoal to cook their meals. Many Tanzanians still use small coal pots in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal) and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light them. The fire requires constant fanning to ignite and maintain the flame, and makes cooking quite a hot and laborious task. It may not be the easiest or most environmentally friendly form of cooking, but it is the only option many people can afford.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of rice, beans, and charcoal in bulk.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Mr. Manuel Rios works selling music and movies on DVDs. Ten years ago, he decided to invest C$ 600 (six hundred cordobas) buying these products. This investment was made through a loan from a moneylender. Manuel Rios worked very hard to pay back that debt.

It is necessary to highlight that Manuel is father to three children, and has the responsibility to offer them an education. This is why, intelligently, Manuel Rios has taken loans from Ceprodel (12 loans), which he has invested in his business, acquiring compact discs. He needs to invest more in his business to improve his and his family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La venta de música y películas en dvd es el negocio al que se dedica el caballero Manuel R.. Desde hace 10 años decidió invertir C$ 600 (Seiscientos córdobas) en la compra de estos artículos, la inversión la realizó por medio de un préstamo a un prestamista. Para salir de la deuda, comenzó esforzándose grandemente hasta saldarla.

Es de mucha necesidad destacar que es padre de tres hijos con la responsabilidad de brindarle educación y por este motivo muy inteligentemente, Manuel R. ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel (12 créditos) que los ha utilizado como inversión en el negocio para la adquisición de los discos compactos. Su necesidad es invertir mas en el negocio para mejorar su nivel de vida y el de su familia.

loans.use: Buying compact discs (Compra de los discos compactos)

loans.name: La Fuerza, Group 3

texts.en:
Lujida is a 44-year-old woman who lives with her daughter and two grandchildren in a poverty-stricken community called Los Guaricanos, on the outskirts of the national capital. She has made a small business for herself of selling shoes and clothing from her house, and occasionally along the streets in her community. She is asking for this loan to expand her inventory—specifically she would like to buy a bigger quantity of clothes, as well as a wider variety. With a better variety she can begin to attract new customers, and consequently increase her income.

Her goal is to first grow and expand her business to a new and more profitable level. After that she says she will use her extra income to help give her grandchildren a better and more comfortable life than she has had; she wants to help them grow into smart and good adults.

Lujida says she knows that with God’s help, and this loan, her business will surely grow much stronger. She is very thankful to all of you out there who are helping her by supporting her in this loan!

loans.use: Purchase new varieties of clothing in larger quantity

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 30 years old and has one child. He works and lives with his family in Nabatieh, a town in south Lebanon. He makes his living as a car mechanic, and has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua to buy the spare parts he needs to run and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for a car-repair business

loans.name: Blasia's Group

texts.en:
Eight women who belonged previously to a Committee of Entrepreneuring Women decided to form a new one with their new friends and neighbors. They set up a meeting and invited many women from the town. There they shared with these women their previous experiences in the committee and explained to them how the committee changed their lives. Their hopeful words stimulated optimism among these women and they decided to form a Committee.

The Committee of Entrepreneuring Women is a program carried out by Fundación Paraguaya which targets groups of enterprising women who create a village bank through which they receive assistance in terms of loans. The main goal is to give them the opportunity to carry out economic activities which enable them to live in dignity and contribute to a better quality of life in their homes. Lending to poor women creates a cascading effect that brings social and economic benefits to a whole family, and thus to the entire community. What is more, the sense of belonging to a group gives these poor women members of a committee, the energy and motivation to reach success.

The committee is formed by 15 women whose entrepreneurial activities include: sewing workshops, grocery stores, carpentries, stationeries, bookshops, sales of food, drinks, chairs, lingerie, medicines and candies.

The credit provided will be used for the purchase of: fabrics, threads, wood, nails, cloth, shoes, chairs, medicines, candies and others.

loans.use: Purchase of: fabrics, threads, wood, nails, cloth, shoes, chairs, medicines, candies and others.

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
H. Hamza is 36 years old. Hamza and his wife, who is a nurse, dream that their two children can have a higher education. In order to support the family and to ensure a better future for his children, Hamza runs his own business repairing  electronic equipment like TVs, radios, CD recorders, and tape recorders. Hamza also sells the equipment. Being a good repairman, Hamza is able to choose equipment of a better quality and attractive price for the clients. Hamza’s business is very stable and brings significant support for his family. 
Today Hamza requests 1200 Somoni (350$ US Dollars) for the term of 4 months. With tthe loan funds he is planning to purchase spare parts and diagnostic devices to repair electronic equipment. Hamza thanks all for their support and says that he will repay the loan in time.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and diagnostic devices to repair electronic equipment.

loans.name: Happiness

texts.en:
Happiness N. lives in ojo Igbede, Lagos State, Nigeria. Happiness is 32-years-old and is married with four children.

She sells electronic components. This is a skill that she learned in three months and has been in this business for the past three years. She is requesting a loan to buy more electronic components for resale . She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more electronic components for resale

loans.name: Corazón De Jesús Group

texts.es:
Rusilda R., who lives in the Barrio Santa Lucia zone, formed the committee after contacting her friends and neighbors. The committee is comprised of 18 women who live in the same zone. The women partake in different business activities such as clothing sales, foodstuffs, cosmetics, farming, etc. They are requesting a loan in order to purchase clothing, basic need items, and food, among other goods to be sold.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Para la formación del presente comité fue la señora Rusilda R., ella vive en la zona del Barrio Santa Lucia, esta Sra. contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité. El comité esta constituido por 18 señoras quienes viven en la misma zona. Las señoras tienen actividades diferentes una de otra, como ser venta de ropas, comestible, cosméticos, granjera etc. Ellas obtienen el crédito para la compra de ropas, artículos de primera necesidad, comidas y otros, para su posterior venta.

loans.use: Purchase clothing, costume jewelry, footwear, chickens, tapioca, soft drinks, basic foodstuff (sugar, flour, noodles, herbs, eggs, bread, etc.)

loans.name: Ruziboy

texts.ru: Кудратов Рузибой .житель района Шахринау.Возраст 26 лет, холост. Клиент живет  с престарелыми родителями. Рузибой имеет небольшой лепешечный цех на местном рынке.Этот бизнеес явяляется основным источником дохода его семьи.Так как родители Рузибоя пенсионеры. На полученный кредит клиент хочет закупить  муку для выпечки хлебобулочных изделий. Планирует погасить кредит в течении 10 месяцев
texts.en:
Ruziboy K. lives in Shahrinav. He is 26 years old and single. The client lives with his elderly parents. Ruziboy has a small flat-bread shop in the local market. Because his parents are pensioners, this business is the main source of income for his family. When he receives the loan, Ruziboy wants to buy flour for baked goods. He plans to pay off the loan in 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing flour

loans.name: Lola

texts.es:
Lola es socia del Banco Comunal Golondrinas. Lola es casada, tiene 24 años y 2 hijos, Lola es natural de la comunidad de Quispillacta que se ubica a 4 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, a donde viaja 1 vez por semana donde vende frutas variadas y de la feria compra quesos, ajos, animales menores como cuy, gallina, los animales los vende en el mercado 12 de abril, mientras que los ajos lo pela y luego lo reparte de casa en casa y en algunas oportunidades lo vende ambulatoriamente. Además Lola junto a su esposo tienen una mototaxi con el que realiza transporte de pasajeros en la ciudad.

Lola necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra ajo y quesos. Lola sueña con mejorar su casa, hacer crecer su negocio y que sus hijos estudien en buenos colegios.
texts.en:
Lola is a member of the Golondrinas Communal Bank. Lola is married, 24 years old, and has two children. She is from the Quispillacta community, which is located 4 hours from the city of Ayacucho. She travels there once a week to sell a variety of fruits and to buy cheeses, garlic, and small animals such as guinnea pigs and chickens from the market. She sells the animals in the market on April 12, while the garlic she peels and then distributes house to house and on some occasions she sells it as a street vendor. Additionally, Lola and her husband have a mototaxi, which they use to transport passengers to the city.

Lola needs a loan of 1050 Peruvian Soles, which will be invested in buying garlic and cheese. Lola dreams of improving her house, expanding her business, and having her children study in good schools.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in buying garlic and cheese

loans.name: Loeny

texts.en:
Loeny S. V. is 23 years old and lives in Siem Reap Province with her husband and two children. She has been selling desserts in front of her home since 2004, and earns about $3.50 per day. Her husband, Sm Visal, is 25 and owns a parking lot earning $2.50 per day. Their oldest child goes to school and the other is too young to attend. Their average household expenses are $50 per month.

Loeny S. V. is requesting a loan through Kiva’s field partner CREDIT – Micro Finance Institution. CREDIT-MFI has a repayment rate of 99.8% with a portfolio at risk 30+ at 0.33% (taken from their 2007 Annual report). CREDIT – MFI structures their non-agriculture Kiva loans with a declining balance interest rate. Agriculture loans are structured as balloon repayments with monthly interest rate payments and principle repayments at the end of the loan. To learn more about CREDIT-MFI please visit their Kiva Field Partner page or their website at

http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=9

http://www.credit.com.kh/

loans.use: Purchase a motor-bike for her husband to commute to work, and also to increase her own business.
